loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs Ly’s husband has died of cancer and she must support her 4 children between 26 and 7 years old. Two of her children go to the University, one is in grade 11 and the last one is in grade 3.

She don’t have any land and only a small hut. She sells fruits at a small market. Fortunately, she borrowed a loan of $50 from the project. Now she has repaid the loan and her family income increased by $2/person/month to an average of 10$ person/month. She wants a loan of $75 to buy fruits.

loans.use: Buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Oup

texts.en: Mrs. Oup V. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  V. makes rice wine and shampoo, which she then sells to local retailers.  She is able to make about $7.50 per day from this business.  V.'s husband works at a local gas station and can make about $2 per day.  The couple has three children, all of whom are still students.  V. hopes to use this loan to purchase the raw materials to make more rice wine and shampoo.  In the future, she hopes that she will be able to further expand her shampoo production business.  Eventually, the couple hopes that their children will be able to attend university.

loans.use: To purchase the materials to make rice wine and shampoo, which she will sell to retailers.

loans.name: Seuga

texts.en:
Seuga owns a fruit and vegetable garden. She is always to be found tending her garden when her daily chores are finished. In the evening she goes around the village to sell her produce,earning about $40 daily. At the same time her brothers help her out in her big banana plantation, especially during the harvest process. These bananas are sold at the local market at affordable prices, which earns Seuga about $240. She uses her earnings to make her loan repayments, provide her family with food everyday and attend to other family and church obligations.

Seuga is requesting $800 to purchase cucumbers, fertilizer, cement, timber, sand and an iron roof for her fruit and vegetable garden.

loans.use: To purchase cucumbers, fertilizer, cement, timber, sand and an iron roof for her fruit and vegetable garden.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suardani

texts.id:
Wayan Suardani started his livestock supplies store business since 2000. He sells daily essentials. But his daily profit from business of Rp 25.000 does not cover his expenditure. Wayan must obtain funding of Rp 500.000 (USD55), - s/d Rp 600.000, - monthly to cover living expenses and his son’s education. Most of the funding is to increase his livestock supplies business, selling livestock feed. Every fortnightly, Wayan orders between 2 to 2.5 tons of supplies. Selling livestock supplies supplement her fortnightly income of Rp 600.000 (USD70). Currently, Wayan is in need of additional funding of Rp 5.000.000 (USD550). With this funding she can increase her volume of business thus increasing her profit.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Wayan Suardani memulai usaha warungnya sejak tahun 2000.Barang –barang yang dijual adalah merupakan kebutuhan sehari –hari. Keuntungan yang di dapatnya perhari Rp. 25.000, tetapi dibanding dengan pengeluaran yang dikeluarkan masih belum menutupi.Wayan Suardani harus menyediakan dana Rp. 500.000,- s/d Rp 600.000,- perbulannya untuk biaya hidupnya dan pendidikan anaknya di SMP.Banyaknya permohonan akan pakan ternak membuatnya menambah dagangan dengan menjual pakan ternak babi. Jenis pakan ternak babi yang dijual seperti Dedak Padi, Dedak Gandum,Konsentrat. Setiap dua minggu Wayan Suardani mengoder 2 sampai 2,5 ton pakan dari supliyer. Menjual pakan ternak ini justru dapat menambah incomenya antara Rp. 600.000,- perdua minggu.Saat ini Wayan Suardani sangat memerlukan tambahan modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,-.Dengan modal inilah Wayan Suardani berharap bisa menjual lebih banyak lagi sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehpun bisa meningkat.

loans.use: Purchase livestock supplies for the demand within the community (Membeli pakan ternak untuk melayani pembeli dari masyarakat sekitar rumahnya)

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan owns and operates a clothing stand in the bazaar of his hometown of Saatli, which is located in the central plains area of Azerbaijan. He is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and quality of his clothing inventory.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his clothing inventory and improve his turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his fish selling business.

loans.name: Intizor

texts.ru:
Intizor Tagoeb is 25 years old, married and has 3 children. She also has a High school education. She has a small grocery store in the Tutak village, Javansk region. Initzor plans to use the money from the loan to increase the selection of goods she has for sale. Her primary customers are the people of the village. The loan will therefore allow the locals to purchase produce in their own village as opposed to having to travel to the central market of the region located several kilometers away from where they live. Intizor is planing to repay the loan over a period of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Тагоева Интизор – 25 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Интизор имеет небольшой магазанчик в кишлаке Тутак Яванского района. Основным товаром, которым он торгует это продукты питания. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Основными его покупателями являются жители данного кишлака. Полученный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимые продукты питания у себя в кишлаке, при этом не выезжая на центральный базар района, находящегося в нескольких километрах. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Diversify the selection of goods for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is 36 years old and a beloved daughter and aunt within her family. Like her siblings and parents she is dedicated to the beautiful art of weaving chompas, decorative jackets made from alpaca. They also weave decorative headwear. From very early in the morning, everyone in her family works to combine their immense variety of wools and threads to make their beautiful decorative items, which they then collect to distribute wholesale in the city of Desaguadero. This responsible woman takes care of her parents and provides for her little nephews, who fill her life with joy and happiness. Doris' goal is to acquire more wool so she can continue creating her crafts and be able to export them quickly in large volumes. Doris waits for your help to add new life to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doris de 36 años de edad, es una hija y tía muy querida dentro de su familia, ella al igual que sus hermanos y padres están dedicados al bello trabajo de tejido de chompas. Chullos y chalecos; toda su familia desde muy temprano empieza a combinar la inmensa variedad de lanas e hilos que existe para proceder a tejer sus hermosas prendas de vestir, luego de reunir una muy buena cantidad de prendas se dedica a distribuirlas al por mayor en la ciudad de Desaguadero.Esta responsable dama tiene a su cargo el cuidado de sus ancianos y queridos padres y el apoyo económico a sus pequeños sobrinos, quienes con su alegría y travesuras van llenando su vida de dicha y felicidad, dándole mayor sentido.El deseo de Doris es adquirir materia prima (lana) para seguir elaborando creativamente sus prendas de vestir y así llegar a exportarlos en corto tiempo en grandes volúmenes. Doris espera por tu ayuda para darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of wool

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a young, 21-year-old man who lives at home with his parents. He started his business of selling household goods with his uncle when he was very young, and he continues to work in sales because it brings in a good amount of income.

With the income he generates from the business, he is able to pay for his night school. At school, he is majoring in accounting and is working hard to graduate on time. Leonardo is seeking a loan in order to buy more goods in bulk so that he can sell them for less money, thereby making his business more competitive in the market.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (e.g., saucepans, thermoses, sheets, etc.) in bulk.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Mrs. Tem C. is 50 years old, and she earns approximately $1.66 per day working as a grocer from her home. Her husband, Et Vy, also earns approximately $1.66 per day selling groceries with her. They live with their four children in Ann Doung Chea Village in the Kampong Cham Province. One of their two single children is a worker in Thailand, while their other single child is a student. C. is seeking a loan of $500 to expand her grocery-selling business as well as to purchase more small pigs to raise. With the additional income she expects to generate from her business by virtue of this loan, she will be able to cover her family’s expenses and to send her children to school.

loans.use: To expand her grocery-selling business and to purchase additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata accessed a previous loan from Kiva, and she is very happy that she completed paying her installments. She purchased gallons of palm oil and rice, and she was able to make a profit. With the profit, Aminata was able to support her jobless husband in meeting some of the family's expenses. Aminata's business is the only source of income for the family, and the loan enabled her to expand it. She is very grateful to Kiva and would like to access another loan of Le.800,000 to continue expanding the business for more income.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of palm oil and rice

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa K. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Yaa and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling palm oil.

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married with two sons. He sells different household items and motorcycle parts. His business is located in a very favorable location and he offers nice selection of versatile inventory; e.g. household items, office supplies and bike and motorocycle parts. Gennadyi has been in this business for 10 years. He has about $7000 invested in inventory. His turnover capital is about $5000.

Gennadyi has been in the market for a while. He knows the trends and dynamics of this sphere of commerce. He has just finished construction of a new vending facility in the market where he owns his trade. His business is characterized by stable growth and consistent expansion. Today Gennadyi is hoping to get a 3500 Grivna loan to purchase seasonal inventory for summer. Additional funds will help him increase assorted merchandise without withdrawing this money from the family budget.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Inoyatullo

texts.ru:
IInoyatullo A. lives in Dushanbe city. He is 30 years old and married. He does not have children yet. Inoyatullo is a businessman. He sells men's clothes. He purchases goods in Bishkek city. Currently, he does not have enough money in order to increase the variety of goods he sells. This is why he came to us for help. Inoyatullo would like to receive a loan in order to increase the assortment of goods. He would like to repay the loan within 12 months. This loan will help him attract new customers and gain additional profit. Despite the fact that he does not have children, he lives with a large family. His family includes parents, brothers and sisters. He has to work a lot, because he is the oldest son. His family is very friendly.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизов Иноятулло проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 30 лет , женат . Детей пока не имеет. Занимается бизнесом в сфере продаж. Торгует мужской одеждой. За товаром ездит в город Бишкек. Но его оборотной суммы не хватает для того , чтобы разнообразить ассортимент товара. Поэтому он обратился к нам за помощью. Хочет получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Этот кредит поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и получить дополнительную прибыль. Не смотря на то , что у него нет детей, он живет в очень большой семье . где живут родители , братья и сестра. Поэтому ему приходится много работать , так как он старший сын. Но все-таки у них очень дружная семья.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Ni Made Mertini

texts.id: Tinggal di daerah pinggiran kota dengan pemukiman yang padat tidak mengurungkan niat Ibu Made Mertini untuk menjalankan usaha beternak babi. Dengan lahan yang terbatas Ibu Made Mertini membuat kandang sederhana yang bisa menampung 2-3 ekor babi. Walaupun kandangnya terletak berdekatan  dengan rumah tetangganya namun limbah dari kandangnya tidak sampai mengganggu lingkungan sekitarnya karena ternak dan juga kandangnya dirawat dengan baik. Hasil dari memelihara babi penggemukan tersebut dipergunakannya untuk mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya baik itu untuk di dapur maupun keperluan lainnya seperti biaya pendidikan anaknya yang berusia 14 tahun dan saat ini masih duduk di bangku SMP. Walaupun hasil yang diperolahnya dari usaha ini tidak terlalu banyak tapi hal ini tidak mengurangi semangatnya karena usaha ini sudah ditekuni cukup lama dan terbukti bisa membantu menopang kehidupan keluarganya. Ibu Ni Made Mertini saat ini mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola DINARI dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama enam bulan dan pembayaran akan dilakukan kembali setelah periode pinjaman berakhir, dan selalu berharap usahanya bisa lebih maju dan keuntungan yang sebelumnya hanya Rp 300.000 per ekor bisa bertambah sehingga kehidupan keluarganya bisa lebih sejahtera lagi.
texts.en:
Living in the suburb with dense population does not hold Made Mertini to run pig raising business. Having limited space, she build a simple pigpen for 2-3 pigs. The pigpen is closed to her neighbour house, however the waste is not a problem as she cleans the cattle and the pigpen regularly. The income from raising fattening pig is used for meeting her daily needs and for education of her 14-year old child in junior high. Although the profit is not that much, but it is proved to be able to support her family livelihoods and, therefore, inspire her to keep the spirit for the business. Made Martini joins pig raising program of DINARI with 6-months loan term and repayment is started after the loan period is over. She hopes for the development of her business and for her profit from USD 33 per pig to be increased for the prosperity of her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Persada Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy piglet

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Por el bienestar D. sus 7 hijos, Rolando trabaja arduamente en sus terrenos D. cultivo, lo  hayamos rumbo a su chacra en compañía D. su burrito, quien le ayuda a llevar las cargas  y las herramientas necesarias para trabajar en sus tierras.  Le es muy beneficioso tener animales D. carga, los que alivianan su carga, así como sus toros, que le ayudan en el arado para el comienzo D. sus sembríos.  En el transcurso D. estos meses a doblado su trabajo con el fin D. ayudar a su hijo quien  se encuentra muy mal D. salud y los médicos no han podido diagnosticar claramente  su enfermedad, lo que mantiene a L. familia preocupada y angustiada.  Ronaldo se mantienen sereno, consiente D. que su hijo tiene que tener varios exámenes, y conlleva gastos, por ello está duramente trabajando en su chacra para que después D. L. cosecha pueda vender sus productos y tenga dinero para poder llevar a su hijo a alguna ciudad cercana donD. puedan examinarlo adecuadamente.  Por ello, solicita un préstamo para L. compra D. fertilizantes y una fumigadora,  indispensable para desinfección D. sus chacras.
texts.en:
For the well-being of his seven children, Rolando works hard on his agricultural plots. He can often be found en route to his land alongsiD. his donkey who helps to carry his loads and the necessary tools to work the land. It is very beneficial for him to have beasts of burden to lighten his load; his oxen are very important to him as well, helping him to plow the earth before planting his seeds. In the last few months, he has doubled his work-load in order to help his son who is suffering from poor health. The doctors have not been able to clearly diagnosis his sickness which has his family very worried. Ronaldo helps to keep them calm, but knows that his son needs more tests which will cost a lot; that is why he is working hard on his land in order to have a good harvest, sell his crops, and be able to take his son to a nearby city where he can receive a proper medical exam. This is why Ronaldo is seeking a loan in order to purchase fertilizer and a fumigator, which is absolutely necessary to spray his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and a fumigator in order to spray his agricultural land

loans.name: Saing

texts.en: Mrs. Saing K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sokleang Saum, 45, live in a small village located 17 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Married in 1991, they have three sons and two daughters. One of their children works in a garment, while the other four are studying in a local school. Mrs. Saing has been a garment factory worker for five years, while Mr. Sokleang has been a motor remoque taxi driver for two years. A motor remoque taxi is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. His trailer is currently broken and he needs to replace it. Therefore, Mrs. Saing is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase a new trailer to replace the one for her husband to continue his business. Besides driving a remoque, her husband is also a Khmer traditional musician.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer

loans.name: Orfelina De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora Orfelina de Jesús es una socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas” y vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, los cuales son visitantes del mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará  verduras como papas, cebolla en sacos, tomate, ajíes, culantro, cebolla china, ajos y menestras para surtir su negocio y asegurar sus ventas. 

Orfelina tiene 62 años de edad, es madre de 06 hijos, todos independientes y vive con una de sus hijas quien la acompaña y la ayuda en sus momentos libres. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos, que permite crecer en el negocio, tanto a ella, como también a las demás mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orfelina de Jesus is a member of the Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) Village Bank and lives in the city of Moyabamba in San Martin, Peru. She sells vegetables from her store located in the city's central market where her customers seek her out daily. With this $425 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase vegetables such as potatoes, onions, tomatoes, chilis, cilantro, Chinese onions, garlic, and beans to stock her business and assure her of future sales. Orfelina is 62 years old and the mother of 6 adult children. She lives with one of her daughters who accompanies her and helps her when she has free time. She is grateful for the help she will receive from Manuela Ramos which will help her to grow not only her business, but the businesses of the other women in her lending group.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, onions, tomatoes, chilis, Chinese onions, cilantro, garlic, beans, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth N. is 38 years old. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her family in Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Elizabeth has been selling infant layettes such as baby’s cots, Pampers, etc., and other textile materials for eight years. She procures her goods from big shops in the city at wholesale prices. She sells in the market square in her community and also hawks to houses. Elizabeth wants a loan to procure the goods in bulk so that she can trek to nearby markets. Elizabeth belongs to a Trust Bank group called “Kingdom.” The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan. She said she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To procure infant layettes in bulk such as Pampers, diapers, feeding bottles, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Алиев Али житель района Шахринав.Возраст 36 лет,женат.Али вот уже 6 лет занимается куплей продажей крупно-рогатого скота.Он скупает на местном рынке молодых телят,откармливает их и перепродает на том же рынке.Бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ali A. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 36 years old and married. For the past six years Ali has bought and sold large-horned cattle. He buys young calves at the local market, feeds them and resells them at the very same market. This business is the main source of income for his family. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase cash flow

loans.name: Enma Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Enma Soledad C. S., tiene 33 años, vive en la Urb. Libertad, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, dejo los estudios debido a que sus padres ya no quisieron enviarla al colegio, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Enma se dedica a la venta de quesos, roscas, manjar y salchipollo, al principio inicio vendiendo quesos, roscas y manjar de casa en casa, ahora tiene clientes que le compran, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro un carrito sanguchero con el que también vende salchipollo en las noches,  su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de  quesos, roscas y manjar para la venta.
Con el crédito de 200 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de quesos, roscas y manjar.
Enma sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Enma Soledad C. S. is 33 years old, lives in Libertad of the district of Trujillo, in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru.

She completed primary school but she left school because her parents no longer wanted her to attend. She has 2 children, both of whom are financially dependent on her.

Enma sells cheeses, breads, caramels, french fries with fried chicken. In the beginning she started out selling cheeses, breads and caramels from door to door, but now she has a client base that buy from her. With her earnings she purchased a sandwhich cart that she now uses to sell french fries and fried chicken in the evenings. She runs her business from home.

With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the Community Bank "Mujeres Decididas II", she invested in the purchase of cheeses, breads and caramels for resale.

With the current loan of 200 soles, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of cheeses, breads and caramel. Enma dreams of having her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses, breads and caramel.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mr. Choeun S., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Sinan Chea, 36, live along National Road Number 6, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They were married in 1982 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family house, one daughter is a hair dresser, and three children are in school. One son studies at the university.

Choeun S. has been driving a taxi in his village for 5 years. His wife stays home to look after their house and take care of their children. He is requesting his first loan of $1000 to purchase one motorcycle for his son to drive to the university and to buy cosmetics for his daughter to sell at her hair salon.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his son to drive to school and to buy cosmetics for his daughter to sell at her hair salon.

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Asha has been a bites (buns and chapati) seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to improve her business. She is hoping that with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Asha is 28 years old, married, and has a 6-year-old child.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Teofrida, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to improve her business.

loans.name: Teopista Nabadda’S Group

texts.en:
Teopista is a 56-year-old widow with nine children aged between 18 and 30. Four of her children go to school and the rest are working. Teopista owns a five-roomed house in the suburb of Kisaasi, where she lives with six people. The house has access to electricity and piped water, and the family gets two meals a day. She also owns rooms for tenants.

Teopista earns a living from the poultry farm at her home where she has about 400 chickens. She supplies their eggs to shop owners and sells to about five customers a day. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for 30 years. Teopista incurs extra transport costs to and from shops, and the Mengo-Kisenyi Market in Kampala. She currently faces the challenge of thieves who break in to steal her chickens, and she is trying to build strong defences to curb that challenge.

This is Teopista's 22nd loan since she joined Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, eight years ago, and she has always worked with this same loan group. Teopista wants to use this loan to buy more chickens and feed. She aspires to own at least 1000 chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly C., 48, is a widow with two children: one son and one daughter. Both are married. Her son lives outside the family home, and he has been selling vegetables for three years. The daughter assists her mother in farming. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ly has been a farmer for over thirty years; she grows many kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, corn, eggplants, wax gourds, and bananas. She is requesting her first loan of US$ 1,000 to help fund her son so he can purchase vegetables on contract for re-sale.

loans.use: To help fund her son to purchase vegetables on contract for re-sale

loans.name: Nonouwede

texts.fr:
Cette femme  est née dans la ville de tabligbo, une ville à l’intérieur du Togo, aujourd’hui elle habite à kpogan où elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons alcoolisées appelée "Sodabi" qu'elle met dans des bidons de 25l, cette boisson est de production locale et très appréciée par les togolais. Actuellement, elle fait face à une rupture de stock, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 400l de Sodabi. 
Elle est veuve et a 01 enfant, c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman was born in Tabligbo, a city in the interior of Togo. She now lives in Kpogan, where her money-making business is consists in selling an alcoholic drink called "Sodabi". She puts it in 25-liter containers. This beverage is produced locally, and very much appreciated in Togo. At this time, she's out of stock and, to resupply, she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 400 liters of "Sodabi". She's a widow with one child, and she uses the profits of her business to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 400 liters of "sodabi" (local alcoholic drink)

loans.name: Vladimir Flavio

texts.es:
Vladimir trabaja como empleado de limpieza en el Aeropuerto internacional de El Alto es su ingreso con lo que mantiene a sus cuatro hijos que estan estudiante el colegio, tiene su casa propia ubicado en la  Zona Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinara para comprar de material de construcción para la refacción de su vivienda y culminar con la obra fina de una cuarto que la falta.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación el  préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Vladimir works as a custodian at the international airport in El Alto. His income supports his four children, who are in secondary school. He has his own home, which is located in the Villa Tunari area of El Alto. He will use this credit to buy construction materials so he can make repairs to his home and put the finishing touches on one of the rooms. This is his fourth loan with Impro, and he has a good payment record that allows him to qualify for it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. is a resident of Sanepa. Sanepa is located in Kathmandu district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. She lives in a single family home with her husband and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Bhakta B., is a driver and her daughter is studying in pre-primary school. 

Her husband’s income is not enough to run her family smoothly, so Rita decided to open her own grocery store. She opened her grocery store two years ago in Sanepa. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, various snacks, etc. She uses her income for household expenses.

Rita is applying for a loan of Rs 10,000 to purchase additional grocery items as stock for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: el sr. Gabriel D. se dedica al comercio, el sale a vender ropa americana usada a pueblos pesqueros como ser punta raton, cedeño, monjaras y pueblo nuevo, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. el ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y pagar los estudios de sus 4 hijos, tambien ha logrado comprar un terreno para construir una casa para su familia. el necesita el credito para comprar mas fardos de ropa y asi tener mas producto y obtener mas ganancias, en el futuro el desea comprar un carro para poder llevar mucha ropa a todos los diferentes pueblos que el visita porque ahora lo hace por medio de bus.
texts.en:
Gabriel D. dedicates himself to business. He sells used American clothing in fishing towns such as Punta Ratón, Cedeño, Monjaras, and Pueblo Nuevo. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has been able to help his family get ahead and pay for his 4 daughters’ studies. He has also been able to purchase land to build a house for his family. Gabriel needs the loan to purchase more bundles of clothing so that he has more products and obtains more earnings. In the future, he wants to buy a car to be able to bring a lot of clothing to the different towns that he visits because he currently does it by bus.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas is very lucky to have a good and loving husband, neighbors usually say to Felicitas. She is the manager of her own general store in their rural village of Catabban Burgos, Isabela. She is married to Livegildo D., a kind and hard working farmer. While Felicitas is taking care of her general store, her husband manages their farm lot and maintains their hog raising business. The couple helps each other to improve their living situation, to become progressive and give their five children a better living. Through their business with hard work, patience, sacrifice, loyalty, and faith in God, they successfully sent their children to school though their youngest still is studying at the moment. To further maintain their business, Felicitas is asking the support of Kiva to lend her the amount of PHP10,000 as additional business capital. She promises to work hard so that somehow she will be able to pay the loan and become successful someday to prove to others that “poverty is not a hindrance to success”.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Estrellas De Oro Group

texts.es: Grupo “Estrellas D. Oro” esta conformado por doce socias 80% mujeres Y 20 % varones que radican en la zona D. Alto San Pedro, es un grupo que ingresa a su primer ciclo demostrando unidad y solidaridad en sus reuniones previas. Las socias en su mayoría se dedican a la venta D. verduras, ropa, víveres y otros pero lo comercializan en el interior (Nor Yungas - Zud Yungas), por que lo consideran un mercado poco explotado y con mayores oportunidades D. venta D. los productos; otras D. las socias se dedican a la peluquería contando con su salón D. belleza ubicados en lugares estratégicos donD. cuentan con clientes leales a su trabajo;  entre ellas se tiene socias que confeccionan chompas, mantas hechas a mano las cuales son comercializan en empresas que exportan o realizan venta local, otras ofrecen sus productos en ferias o ambulan, sus productos son relativamente económicos con costo mínimo D. su material D. trabajo; entre otro los socios se dedican al transporte público los cuales requieren del crédito para la compra D. llantas y repuestos. El mercado actual se encuentra saturado D. productos similares pero las socias saben como salir adelante llevando sus productos al interno o exterior del país. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.Por los continuos viajes alguno D. las socias no se presentaron pero mandaron a sus esposos a la reunion.
texts.en:
The group, “Estrellas D. Oro” ('Stars of gold') is maD. up of twelve members, 80% of which are women, 20% of which are men, who live in the zone of Alto San Pedro. This group is going into their first cycle having demonstrated their unity and solidarity in previous meetings. The majority of the members dedicate themselves to the sale of vegetables, clothing, provisions and other things that they sell in the interior of the country (Nor Yungas - Zud Yungas) as it is not a well exploited market and offers great opportunities to sell products. Other members dedicate themselves to hairdressing, as they have beauty salons located in strategic places where they have a lot of regular clients. Between them, there are members that make sweaters and handmaD. blankets which they sell to export businesses or locally. Others offer their products in markets or in the street, and their products are economically maD., using low cost working materials. Other members dedicate themselves to public transport, and they need the credit to buy tyres and spare parts. The current market is saturated with similar products, but the members know how to move forward, taking their products to the interior and exterior of the country. The members are in their first cycle but they can already count on experience in such groups which is why they promise to give everything to move forward with responsability and unity. Due to the journeys they must take, some of the members couldn't be at the meeting, but sent their partners instead.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations' capital/capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Lauina

texts.en: Lauina M. (0) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Samatau Fou 4. She is married and has four school-aged children. Lauina owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 350 WST a month. Lauina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Launiu is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will again be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Chhan K., 34, is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling fish at the market. She typically makes about $5 US a day. She has a little child living at home to support. Her husband has been a horse cart driver since 2006 and is able to make $5 US per day as well. Chhan K. is asking for a loan to purchase more fish to sell at the market. This will allow her to make more money to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 42 years old, married to Rondillo Sr. and they were blessed with four children: Rondillo Jr. - 26 years old, college graduate and married; Roger - 24 years old, is working as a salesman;Catherine, also a college graduate, and their youngest is Cristina - 6 years old, already in grade one.  Her family lives together in Barangay Mabini, Cauayan City, Their place is along the city proper of Cauayan. 

Cynthia manages a retail business of fruits and vegetables just in front of their house for almost three years. She earns a weekly income of PHP2, 500 and it is being budget to provide the basic needs of their family and also as a rolling capital in her business.  Cynthia is now asking for additional business capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP15, 000.  This will be of big help in improving her retailing business by purchasing more goods. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved for them to become successful.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending business

loans.name: Mrs. Sa Vong Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are all living in Angk Ta Phouk village in TaK. province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Sa Vong L. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, and they all will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sa Vong L. is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Pen Hun, is a cow middleman. Mrs. Sa Vong L. is 48 years old and the mother of a child who is a grocer.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend the rice field

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem M. is a long-time businesswoman. She has been growing rice on her own farmland since she was single. Besides her farm work, she also sells a few fish that she gets from her husband's fishing. Kem M. is a good mother blessed with seven teenage children. Two of the children are employed; one is a garment worker and the other one drives a motor taxi. Kem M. is taking out her loan to repair the broken fishing equipment as well as buy more tools for her husband to use to fish. Note: The picture here shows Kem M.'s husband.

loans.use: To repair fishing equipment and buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Raïmath

texts.fr: L. Raïmath est née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Raïmath est mariée à ADOGBO-MEDAGBE Armand, un commerçant. Le couple a un enfant qui n’est pas encore scolarisé. Raïmath vit avec son mari et son enfant au quartier Aïbatin à Cotonou, depuis deux ans. Raïmath assure les dépenses de la famille avec son mari. Raïmath a très tôt abandonné l’école et a appris le métier de coiffure. A côté de cela, Raïmath vend des mèches et des produits pour cheveux dans son salon de coiffure situé à Agbodjèdo à Cotonou. Raïmath a déjà 8 ans d’expérience dans ce métier. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Raïmath s’approvisionne. Raïmath est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, et a un comportement irréprochable dans les remboursements du crédit. Raïmath sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin d’agrandir davantage la taille de son activité et de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
L. Raïmath was born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ADOGBO-MEDAGBE Armand, a merchant.  The couple has one child who is not yet in school.  She has been living with her husband and child in the Aïbatin district in Cotonou for two years.  Along with her husband, she ensures that family expenses are met.  Early on, Raïmath dropped out of school and learned the trade of hairdressing.  Aside from this, she sells hair extensions and hair products in her hairstyling salon located in Agbodjèdo in Cotonou. She already has eight years of experience in this trade.  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  Raïmath is a previous ALIDé client who has a spotless loan repayment record.  She's requesting a third loan from ALIDé to expand her business further and to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hairstyling products

loans.name: Charifa

texts.en:
Charifa has worked as a home-based tailor for the past 10 years to support her husband and the household. She's 44 years old. She became well known in the neighboring villages where she presents a variety of products to them.

Today, Charifa is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine and textiles to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and textiles

loans.name: Laurette

texts.fr: A. Laurette est née le 11 Novembre 1979 au Bénin. Laurette vit depuis une dizaine d’année, à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à OROBIYI Afred, un imprimeur, Laurette est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Laurette a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Tous les enfants vivent avec leurs parents à Cadjèhoun. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Laurette n’a pas été à l’école. C’est depuis 18 ans que Laurette mène comme activité, la vente de produits de SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasserie), en face du Ministère des Finances. Laurette vend divers autres produits (lait, savons, cigarettes, eau minérale, huile d'arachide, etc.). Laurette s’approvisionne dans les dépôts de boissons à Cotonou, et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé et qui ont été bien remboursés. C’est dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, que Laurette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Laurette was born on November 11, 1979 in Benin.  She has been living for about ten years in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to OROBIYI Afred, a printer, she is the mother of three children who are all in school.  She has another child to support in addition to her own.  The children all live with their parents in Cadjèhoun.  The couple is covering family expenses jointly.  Laurette did not attend school.  For eighteen years, she has been running a business selling SOBEBRA products (Société Béninoise de Brasserie, a beverages company of Benin) across from the Finance Ministry.  She sells a variety of other goods (milk, soaps, cigarettes, mineral water, peanut oil, etc.)  She stocks up from beverage outlets in Cotonou and from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client having benefited from two ALIDé loans, which have been repaid.  With regard to augmenting her working capital and to raising her level of business, in order to respond better to the demands of her customers, Laurette is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of canned drinks and liquor

loans.name: Omo

texts.en:
Omo sells drinks at retail prices to her customers to make a living in Benin City, Edo State. She is 28 years old and is married with three children. Her eldest child is 4 years old. Omo is a friendly woman and she is also hardworking.

Omo has been in her business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

Omo is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
K. Gulnora is 37 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Gulnora has been selling clothing for kids for the past five years. With her savings she started to travel to the neighboring towns to buy clothing and then sell it at the local market of Dushanbe. Little by little she increased her number of clients and expanded her business. Nevertheless, her current selection of garments is poor; therefore, she requests a loan of 5,000 MNT. With this loan Gulnora can purchase new and varied merchandise to offer her clients.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase kids' clothing to sell

loans.name: Channat

texts.en:
Mrs. Channat B., 43, is a widow with two sons, one of whom has full-time employment and the other one attends school. She lives in a small village along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Channat has been selling groceries since 2001. She buys them from Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. She wants to expand her business so she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 40 years old, married.  She had no job before starting the business.  Financial problems brought her tenacity and innovation, however, and she decided to start her small business.  Today she has a small shop selling clothing from different bales.  She has been in this business for about 3 years.  Her business hours are from 7 AM to 7 PM every day.

Jeanne is focused, hard worker.  She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable.  One of her greatest joy is one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.  Jeanne would like to get a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase additional bales of clothes and re-supply her inventory.  She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing items and will significantly expand her clothing trade.  Jeanne believes that having a variety of bales of good quality will increase her sales and offer both warmth and styles suitable to any taste and weather.

loans.use: Additional bales of clothes for sale

loans.name: Paglalunan

texts.en:
Paglalunan R. is from the village of Galingon, Tampilisan. She is 43 years old. Paglalunan is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Paglalunan owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Paglalunan has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Paglalunan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paglalunan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Paglalunan is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Paglalunan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela P. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Cerela is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Cerela owns & operates a business providing hairdressing & beauty services like manicures and pedicures to local community members. Cerela has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cerela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She decided to request a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cerela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials needed to provide service

location.town: Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Arturo De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Arturo de Jesús R. D., tiene la edad de 39 años, vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino con su compañera de vida la cual trabaja como domestica, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad casados e independientes, ellos son agricultores desde hace 8 años, gracias al papa quien le enseño los menesteres del cultivo de la piña.

Dentro de los planes que tienen a futuro está la apertura de un negocio en la vivienda para que sea su esposa quien la administre y así mismo cuide del hogar debido a que el lugar donde habitan se ha registrado varios robos,  ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, fungicidas, semillas, e insumos vegetativos que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a las tierras para una producción de mayor calidad y su posterior venta, este apoyo que se le brinde a la familia R. lo beneficiara para planificarse a futuro a nuevos proyectos que deseen emprender como familia.
texts.en:
Arturo de Jesús R. D., 39, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood with his life partner, who is a domestic employee. They have three adult, married, independent children. They have been farmers for the past 8 years thanks to his father who taught him how to grow pineapple. Among their future plans is to set up a business in their home that the wife can tend to while watching over their home because the area they live in has had several robberies. They are requesting funds to buy farming supplies like, fertilizers, fungicides, seed and other supplies that will allow for better field maintenance and improved crop quality for better post-harvest sales. This help will help the R. family for their future family projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fungicides, seed and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mrs. Man Y. is a humble woman who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She earns about US$4 per day from selling fresh fish at Chrang Chomres market. Mrs. Man Y. has five children: one is now married and lives outside of the family home, while the other four are no longer in school and are employed at different jobs. She has a life partner in her husband who is shown in the picture above. He assists his wife in delivering fish to the market for sale.

Man Y. has a son who wants to have a life partner in his wife but he needs to hold a wedding party. Because the family doesn’t have enough money yet, Man Y. decided to request a loan of US$1,100 from Kiva lenders to pay for a wedding party for her son.

loans.use: To pay for a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es: Yoli, es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, tiene 45 años, está casada con Hernán de 52 años, juntos tienen 5 hijos pero solo viven con 2 de ellos en su vivienda propia, mientras que los demás ya son independientes. Hace más de 10 años se dedica al cultivo de café, plátanos, fréjol y palta, frutos que posee en sus propios terrenos, ella y su esposo comparten el anhelo de tener una mejor calidad de vida, además de continuar apoyando a sus hijos. Es conciente de que los esfuerzos que realiza por cuidar sus plantaciones siempre tienen como recompensa una buena producción, por eso le gusta mantener limpios sus terrenos, sobretodo proporcionarles fertilizantes para nutrir la tierra. Sin embargo le desagrada comercializar sus productos a bajos precios, pero eso no la desanima y casi siempre hace respetar el valor real de sus productos. Yoli, afirma que la agricultura es muy rentable si sabes trabajar y aprovecharlo, gracias a ello pudo cubrir la educación de sus hijos, comprar bienes y solventar sus gastos domésticos. En adelante desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas y contar con mayor cantidad de producción. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y agradece a los integrantes de su grupo comunal por el respaldo que le brindan, asimismo se compromete a trabajar de manera responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, pues quiere aplicar abono a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Yoli, 45, is a cheerful and tenacious woman. She’s married to Hernán, 52, and they have 5 children, only two of whom still live with them in their own home; the rest are all independent. For over 10 years she has farmed coffee, bananas, broad bean and avocados, on her own farmlands. She and her husband share the dream of having a better quality of life as well as continuing to support their children. She is aware that her efforts to care for her crops always have the reward of a good yield. Because of this, she likes to maintain her fields clean and provide proper fertilizers to nourish the soil. She dislikes having to sell her products for low prices but she doesn’t become discouraged, however, and usually manages to have the real value of her products respected. Yoli affirms that farming is very profitable if you know how to work and take advantage of it. Thanks to farming, she was able to pay for the education of her children, buy assets and cover household domestic expenses. In the future, she would like to buy more farmlands to produce increased crop yields. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she thanks her fellow communal bank members for the support they provide and she also commits to work responsibly. She will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of manure to apply to her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Elvis Axamir

texts.es:
Don Elvis es padre de familia de tres hijos, junto a su esposa trabajan para poder apoyar  a sus hijos con los estudios. 
El señor Elvis trabaja en su negocio propio desde hace varios años, como cadete de taxi, carro que logro comprar con apoyo de sus hermanos que están en otro país. 
El cual fue una gran ayuda y oportunidad para tener el sustento diario de alimentación. Lo difícil que abecés solo logra para la gasolina y no alcanza para otros gastos, así como también hay días buenos, es un trabajo cansado y riesgoso ya que mucho somos asaltados por los delincuentes. Con este financiamiento hará mantenimiento a su carro en la suspensión y dirección del vehiculo para seguir dando un eficiente servicio de carrera de taxi. gracias a estos prestamo logra hacer este mantenimiento rutinario para manejar su transporte de trabajo en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Elvis is the father of three children, he and his wife work to support their children with their studies. Elvis has worked in his own business for many years, as a taxi driver, with a car he was able to buy with the help of his brothers who are in another country. The assistance from his brothers was a great help and opportunity to provide daily nourishment for his family. The difficult thing is that sometimes he only has money for gasoline and not enough for other expenses, so while there are good days, it is a tiring job and is dangerous now that many of drivers are assaulted by delinquents. With this financing, he will do maintenance on his car’s suspension and steering so that he can continue providing efficient taxi service. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to do routine maintenance so that he can keep his transportation in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Taxi Maitenance: Suspension and Steering

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie M. is a married woman who lives in Banaba, Kalumbuyan, Bawayan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures. She sells RTWs (ready-to-wear clothing) and she also buys and sells jewelry. Her husband, Ramil M., who is 42 years old, works as a driver to earn a living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children between the ages of 4 months and 20 years.
 
Regie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Regie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $112 - raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is again borrowing 19,000 PHP which she intends to use as additional capital for her businesses so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and pay for her children's education. Regie M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 32 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Erick de 32 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. La actividad a la que Soledad se dedica es la venta de leña, siendo este material muy solicitado por sus clientes. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad, le ha sido rentable por lo que desea incrementarse de este material y aumentar sus ganancias, ya que su anhelo y prioridad es pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijos, a quienes cuida con mucho amor y siempre se ha preocupado por que no les falte nada. Disfruta conversar con sus clientes, ya que su principal estrategia de venta es la alegría y la amabilidad que tiene con ellos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y se ha comprometido a pagarlo puntualmente.Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más madera para tener una buena reserva en su negocio.
texts.en:
Soledad, 32, is a cheerful, hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband, Erick, 32, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a good education. Soledad sells firewood, a highly sought-after material by her customers. She has been in this line of work for 10 years. It has been profitable so she’d like to increase her supplies of this material and thereby increase her profits because her greatest wish is to be able to afford to pay for her children’s higher education. She cares for her children very lovingly and she’s always careful to see that they lack nothing. She enjoys chatting with her customers since her main sales strategy is the good cheer and the kindness with which she treats them. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She is happy to have gotten it and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more wood so that she’ll have a good reserve stock available.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more wood in order to have a reserve stock available.

loans.name: Anibal Jose

texts.es:
Anibal Jose M. L. tiene 42 años. Es casado vive con el esposa y con los hijos,  tiene 3 hijos, Mónica (16), Francisco (10) y Maria Jose  (9 meses), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Anibal es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Anibal se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales como son pollos y cerdos Realiza sus compras cada tres meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales para incrementar la producción y cumplir su sueño. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades.

Le gusta la agricultura y cría a sus animales.
texts.en:
Anibal Jose M. L. is 42 years of age. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He has 3 children: Mónica (16), Francisco (10) y Maria Jose (9 months). He lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Anibal is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates in all, the majority dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that he has requested from the San José cooperative Anibal is dedicated to breeding animals such as chickens and hogs. He carries out his purchases every three months in Matilde Esther and sells his animals in the local community. He requests a loan to purchase more animals in order to increase his production and realize his dream. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have the money to purchase a house. He faces challenges such as diseases. He likes agriculture and raising his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
Tarcila T. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Tarcila owns and operates a furniture-making business making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Tarcila has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Tarcila joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tarcila is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta S. is from the town of Talibon. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a fishing business, using a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Julieta is thankful for her business because she is able to provide for her family and sustain her children's education.
Julieta joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her first from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine M. is married with 2 children. She has been in the clothing and shoe trading business since 1998. Karine works from a rented trading booth at one of the city markets. She has applied for this loan in order to be able to purchase new clothing and shoe inventory.

loans.use: To purchase new shoe and clothing stock.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara D. P. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Barbara owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Barbara joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI which was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Barbara is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to increase her working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Barbara from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Siddiqa Faiz Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqa F. A. is a very caring mother who is raising her children very well. She is a housewife who stays at home handling her household responsibilities. She has proved herself a responsible wife who is always ready to support her husband in any difficult time.

Siddiqa and her husband, F. A., live in Vehari, a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan that is famous for its agricultural industry. F. is involved with livestock. He buys young goats and buffalo from animal markets at a cheap rate and then raises them for resale. His client base is butchers. He supplies them with animals and earns a good profit this way.

Siddiqa has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy goats and buffalo and increase the income of his business. Siddiqa is hopeful that with the growth of her husband’s business, her family’s standard of living will improve.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and resell

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es: Hortencia, de 60 años, es una madre de familia muy tierna y laboriosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores de los 7 hijos que tiene. Recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Mala; Hortencia se dedica a vender sus cosméticos, yendo de casa en casa a colocar el producto. Con el tiempo se ha convertido en una excelente vendedora, logrando así estabilizar su negocio y percibir buenas rentas.  Uno de sus objetivos es procurar hacer una lista de pedidos, cuanto más es el pedido mayor para ella es la ganancia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es orientar a sus clientes sobre el uso de cada producto que vende, de esa manera sus clientes le tienen mayor confianza. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo, aunque tenga que caminar, pero no le importa con tal de poder vender la totalidad de productos que ofrece. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar más su negocio y terminar de construir su casa. Es su  sexto crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos. Asimismo esta feliz, de pertenecer a su banco comunal, por que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables. Con el crédito solicitado, desea comprarse una vitrina para exhibir sus productos de belleza.
texts.en: Hortencia is 60 years old,she has a very loving and hard-working family, she is married, and lives in her home with the 2 youngest of 7 children.  Hortencia walks the streets in the city of Mala selling her cosmetic products door-to-door.  In time she has become an excellent salesperson and has managed to stabilize her business and retain good income.  One of her objectives is to make a list of orders; the larger the order the more she earns.  What she likes most about her job is being able to advise her clients on the proper usage of the products she sells, this way her clients learn to trust her.  She enjoys her work despite having to walk, but she doesn't mind as long as she sells all the product she offers.  With time, she would like to expand her business and finish building her home.  This is her 6th loan with MFP and she will continue to be punctual with her payments since she plans on obtaining future loans.  She is happy to be a part of the communal bank because all of its members are very responsible.  With this loan she wishes to purchase a display case for her beauty products.

loans.use: Purchase a display case for her beauty products.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza B. is a married woman who lives in Proper Budlasan, Canlaon City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   a general store, motorcycle transport and videoke singing. Her husband Pasto B. Jr., who is 40 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have five children who are 13 to 21 years old. Meliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Meliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks of goods for her general store so that she can continue to save for the future expansion of her business and the education of her children. Meliza B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita G. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 54 years old. Juanita is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetables and fruits like bananas. Juanita wishes for her business to grow. She hopes to earn a better income.

Juanita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juanita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha Isabel; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando al público en general y también a los amigos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para poder la ropa y los cosméticos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa y cosméticos al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha Isabel belongs to the “Ricchary Cusco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Martha Isabel is 46 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes and cosmetics.  She sells independently, offering her products to the general public and also to her friends.  She would like to have a store where she can sell her clothes and cosmetics.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy clothes and cosmetics wholesale.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en:
Liberathe is 38 years old, married with eight children aged between three and 18 years. Liberathe sells a local traditional beer in the Rugarama District in Rwanda. She has been in this business for about six years. The hours of her small bar are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day, except on Saturdays. 

She currently employs three people in her business.

Liberathe will use this loan to buy more sorghum for making local traditional beer. 

With this loan, Liberathe hopes also to improve the quality of service in her bar. If it is completely successful, Liberathe will start saving for her future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to make traditional beer

loans.name: Walberto

texts.es:
Walberto es un padre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en un caserío del distrito de Lambayeque, un distrito bastante comercial que se encuentra situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayoría de pobladores de la zona, se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la agricultura, el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar diversos granos como maíz.
