Adicionalmente cría y vende animales menores y trabaja eventualmente como jornalero en los campos de cultivo cercanos.

Walberto es una persona que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Todo el esfuerzo que el realiza en sus actividades es para mejorar poco a poco la calidad de vida de los suyos. Actualmente se encuentra realizando algunas mejoras en su vivienda y necesita comprar material adicional para lograr su objetivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Walberto is 40 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in a neighborhood in Lambayeque district, a rather commercial district located twenty minutes from Chiclayo city.

Like the majority of those living in this zone, since he was a young boy he has worked in agriculture-related jobs. He has a small piece of land he works where he plants a variety of grains such as corn. In addition he grows and sells small animals and works as a laborer in nearby fields.

Walberto is a person who always wants to give his family the best. All the effort he puts into his work is to improve, little by little, the quality of life of his loved ones. Today he wants to do some improvements to his home and he needs to buy additional material to achieve this goal, so he has approached Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 700 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Buy materials to make home improvements

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina; ella tiene 48 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member pertains to the communal bank, “LLAPANCHISPAC”.  This bank is located in the Cusco District, in the Province and Department of Cusco.

This member is Agripina, who is 48 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her daily activities involve her restaurant business, where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  She works from 8am until 9pm every day.  She has been able to proviD. her children with a better future because of this business.  She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of cooking ingredients, such as meat, chicken, and vegetables.  

She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill her payments.

loans.use: Purchase products to cook with, such as meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: Reynaldo José se dedica a la venta de productos varios y elaboración de pastes hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado obtener este medio de vida. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Reynaldo es un hombre trabajador luchador y que disfruta todos los días de realiza los diferentes productos que a diario elabora para venta y uso personal.  Sus clientes siempre le solicitan diferentes productos y el siempre se preocupa por brindar un buen servicio y calidad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de paste, hilo, tijeras,  entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Reynaldo Jose sells a variety of products and he has been making articles of clothing for more than 14 years. He managed to succeed in this business with a great deal of effort. It is not the first time that he has accessed a loan. Reynaldo is a hardworking person and he enjoys making different products every day for sale and for personal use.  His clients request various products and he always makes sure to provide them with good service and with quality products.  He requests the loan to purchase fabrics, threads, scissors, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, scissors, and other items.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline, 45, is married with 6 children who are between the ages of 10 and 26 years. Three of the children are currently attending school. She has been farming for ten years now in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces eggs, maize, milk and beans that are sold locally.

She has requested for a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the dairy cow she will acquire, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase flour, wood, and other ingredients and supplies necessary for baking bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread

loans.name: Jeaney

texts.es:
Jeaney  Pérez G., tiene la edad de 20 años de edad, está soltero y vive con su madre. El pretende comprar con el dinero  las bolsas para sembrar el café y los insumos para la asistencia de este. El lo que pretende es tener el almacigo para la venta y así obtener ganancias para su bienestar y la de su madre. El cuenta con la experiencia en la elaboración de almácigos por lo cual quiere  invertir en esto pues es una opción de mucha venta  e ingresos. El quiere generar ganancias para su madre y el y a la vesz tener un nivel económico mejor.  
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jeaney Pérez G. is 20 years old, single and lives with his mother.  He wants to use the loan to buy bags of coffee seeds and supplies to care for the crop.  He wants to sell seed-beds in order to obtain enough profit to improve his and his mother's lifestyle.

He has experience working with seed-beds and wants to invest in the business because he knows sales and income are a good option.  This is a way of generating more income for his mother and himself and for them to have a better economic level.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never taken out any state bank loans; but FUDECOSUR is giving him a loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy and plant seed-beds

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, reside con su familia en Cerco Quemado, ubicado en el distrito de Motupe.  Este distrito se caracteriza por la fe religiosa que profesan sus pobladores y se ubica a 1 hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

José se dedica a la venta de ropa para varones, mujeres y niños.  Él es muy conocido en Motupe, y cuenta con clientela bastante fidelizada quienes acuden a comprar siempre a su establecimiento.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los invierte en sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

José desea comprar más mercadería para poder venderla posteriormente.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José, 32, lives with his family in Cerco Quemado located in Motupe District.  This district is noted for the religious faith practiced by its inhabitants and is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Department’s capital.

José sells clothing for men, women and children.  He is very well known in Motupe and has quite a few regular customers who always come by his establishment to buy.  He uses income generated from this activity to cover his personal expenses and those of this family.

José wants to buy more merchandise for subsequent sale.  Because of this he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: C4817 Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 22 years old and single. He is the president of a group called “Urukundo”. Emmanuel sells bananas. Others in the group have businesses selling beans and sorghum at the local market. Emmanuel employs one person in his business and has one year of experience.  Emmanuel is the first person on the right side. 

Emmanuel and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy a large quantity of bananas to sell. With his profits, Emmanuel and his team would like to use the profits to start saving and to satisfy the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like bananas

loans.name: María Fabiola

texts.es:
María Fabiola tiene 20 años, es soltera vive con la madre y con un  hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

María se dedica a la agricultura tiene un solar, siembra cebada, papas, maíz, arveja y trigo el terreno es de sus padres tiene seis cabezas de ganado, cerdos, ovejas y pollos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y comprar animales.

Le gusta festejar todas las fiestas.
texts.en:
María Fabiola is 20 years old.  She is single and lives with her mother and son in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Grupo de Mujeres Carbon Chinipamba' community bank is located in Carbón Chinipamba neighborhood, in Cuatro Esquinas sector, in Guaranda canton, twenty minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  Most of the members of the bank work in farming, livestock raising and sales.  They produce rice, barley, beans, quinoa, potatoes and animals such as dairy cows and farmyard animals.

María is a farmer.  She has a plot of land where she sows barley, potatoes, corn, peas and wheat.  The land belongs to her parents.  She has six head of cattle, pigs, sheep and chickens.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the city's wholesale market.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to provide her children with an education.

María enjoys celebrating fiestas.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a Rwandan entrepreneur who runs a store which sells lotions and Vaseline products, and also provides services such as burning CDs and making invitation cards. She is married and has three children, with the youngest being two and the oldest being six.  They are in school apart from the youngest. Clementine has been successfully running her business for four years now, and the profits generated from it have allowed her to pay for her children’s education.  

Clementine wishes to use this loan from Kiva lenders to buy bigger quantities of lotions and Vaseline products so that she can meet the demand of her growing business. 

Loaning to Clementine will help her reach her goal of becoming a wholesaler and saving enough money to buy a house for her family

loans.use: To buy lotions and Vaseline.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Mov, is a 35-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Cham Province. She has been planting rice crops as her annual business. Her husband works in construction. Mrs. Mov is looking for a $1100 loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for planting. Mrs. Mov has three single children, two of whom are assisting her husband in the construction business. The other one is attending school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nilda Rosa

texts.es: Nilda está satisfecha porque muy pronto recibirá su quinto crédito y el segundo credikiva y comprará  materiales como hilazas de algodón  para la elaboración de artesanías y nuevos diseños de sandalias que tiene solicitadas por sus clientes. Su meta es aumentar su capital de trabajo y por eso debe ejercer su mayor esfuerzo en conseguir nuevos clientes y más recursos financieros para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual agradece a sus financiadores el gran apoyo que le están prestando. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Nilda ingrese al siguiente enlace:   http://kiva.org/lend/218803
texts.en: Nilda is satisfied because very soon she will receive her fifth loan, her second with Kiva.  With this she will purchase materials such as cotton yarns for making handicrafts and new designs for sandals that have been requested by her customers.  Her goal is to increase her working capital and therefore she must exert her best efforts to get new customers and more financial resources to achieve this.  This is why she is grateful to her lenders for the great support they are providing.  If you want to know the history of Nilda enter the following link:  http://kiva.org/lend/218803

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cotton yarns for making handicrafts and new designs for sandals.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio es mototaxista, hace 5 años que trabaja en esta profesión, esta casado con la señora Elisa, tienen  3 hijos, la mayor se llama Rocio Elizabeth tiene 26 años ya esta casada, el segundo es David tiene 22 años, trabaja y estudia, y la tercera hija se llama Liz y tiene 15 años, esta estudiando en el colegio todavía.
El se define como un hombre muy trabajador que se siente uy orgulloso de lo que hace, ya que por medio de ese trabajo ha podido hacer estudiar a sus hijos y darles una vida digna y decorosa.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para que de esa forma pueda invertir en otro negocio que siempre quiso poner con su señora que es un copetin.
El solicita el credito para la compra de repuestos para su moto taxi, el cual es el medio para su trabajo, sin lo cual no podria trabajar.
texts.en:
Señor Julio is a motorcycle taxi driver, he has been working in this field for 5 years.  He is married to Elisa, and they have three children.  The oldest is called Rocio Elizabeth, she is 26 years old and married; the second is David who is 22 years old, he works and studies; and the third child's name is Liz, she is 15 years old and is still studying at school.

He defines himself as a very hardworking man who feels proud of what he does, and through this work he has been able to make it possible for his children to study and gives them a decent and dignified life.

His dream is to continue working in this way so as to invest in another business he has always wanted to have with his wife, which is a fast food counter.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of spare parts for his motorcycle taxi, which is the means for him to do his work.  Without this, he would not be able to work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with four children; two are still attend school while the other two have already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past four years, she has operated a vegetable selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy seasons. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su padre y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, inicio el negocio hace 6 años, ya que pertenecía inicialmente a su madre, y está enfermo, dejándola a Rosa como encargada para atenderlo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio como: quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, tomates y condimentos. Este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el nivel de materiales y poder preparar las pupusas sin ningún atraso.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente, aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos, para tener mejor solvencia con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her father and her three children.  She works selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas).  She started the business 6 years ago; it originally belonged to her mother who became sick, leaving Rosa to attend to it as manager.

She is currently seeking a loan to purchase supplies for the business such as cheese, pork, oil, tomatoes and seasonings.  This loan will help to improve the standard of her ingredients and allow her to prepare pupusas without any delay.

Her aim is to work hard and increase her sales and income, so as to have better finances for family expenses.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork, oil, tomatoes and seasonings, for preparing pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Agnes operates a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 10 years and works 6 days a week. Apart from services, Agnes sells beauty products in the shop.

Agnes has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use, to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. The main business challenge for Agnes includes seasonality and defaulters. She aspires for her small salon to grow bigger, into a bridal salon. Agnes lives in a rental home that has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables, fish, beans, groundnut and other condiments

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with 3 children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Susana; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de piña, ella tiene un carreta donde vende piña en rodajas, ella vende en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de piñas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar piñas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susana, 26, is a member of the “Tres de Mayo de Poroy” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling pineapples.  She has a cart where she sells sliced pineapple in various streets in the city of Cusco from 9am until 5pm.  

She’d like to expand and improve the pineapple sales business and is asking for a loan to buy pineapples at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy pineapples at wholesale.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
With the help of a previous loan, Pov (pictured at her loom), continues her silk weaving business. In addition, she buys more finished silk fabrics from other weavers in her village and sells them in other provinces away from her house.
 
Her husband, Aun, is a farmer. The couple has been married since 1983 and live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Pov is asking for another loan in the amount of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to buy additional silk fabrics for sale.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and buy additional silk fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 21 год. Холост. Живет вместе с родителями и сестрами. Он занимается торговлей музыкальных дисков. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения DVD дисков и DVD.
texts.en: Ismoil lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 21 years old, single and lives together with his parents and sisters.  He is involved in selling music disks.  Ismoil has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of DVD disks.

loans.use: to purchase DVD disks

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan, a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings, has been working as a farmer for the past 13 years, cultivating vegetables according to the season. Adnan is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers to increase his agricultural productivity and perform  needed maintenance on the canal to ensure sufficient water for his crops to grow well. In the future, he plans to expand by cultivating fruits in addition to vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and perform needed maintenance on the water canal.

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en: Silvano is married and blessed with three children all whom attend school. For the last six years, he has been running a grocery business to bring up his family. He also sells clothes to supplement his income. Silvano has employed two people to assist him in the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy fruits and potatoes to resell. He expresses his gratitude to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

loans.use: to buy fruit and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is married with 4 children. He is 47 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, in the province of Zamboanga Sibugay.

Joey has been selling rice and corn for a living for 24 years. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase sacks of rice and corn to sell/retail. He became a member of PMPC in 2011. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and corn to sell/retail

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара пользуется кредитными услугами "Надежды Украины" почти 10 лет; за это время сложились хорошие отношения, которыми она дорожит, так как ей нравятся условия кредитования и обслуживание. В этот раз Тамаре нужен кредит, чтобы закупить женскую верхнюю одежду - куртки и пальто. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Тамара получила дополнительную прибыль и приобрела новую бытовую технику для дома.
texts.en: Tamara has been using the lender "Hope Ukraine" almost 10 years; during this time they have developed a good collaboration that Tamara treasures, since she really likes the conditions of the loans and the customer service. This time Tamara wants to take out a loan to purchase women's winter clothing - jackets and coats. Thanks to her past loans Tamara has been able to ear additional profits and has purchased new appliances for her home.

loans.use: to purchase women's winter coats and jackets

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para seguir cultivando en el terreno, este será invertido en la compra de insumos como el abono y herbicidas, también en la preparación del terreno, los préstamos han tenido un efecto positivo en Edilberto, ayudándole a mejorar las cosechas.
texts.en:
Ediberto decided on a new loan in order to continue cultivating the land.  The loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies like fertilizer and herbicides.  The loan will also be used in the preparation of the land.

The loans have had a positive effect on Edilberto as they are helping him to improve his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 53 years old and single.

He runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for his business.

Ramon has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Ramon aspires to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell for his business.

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Dulce es una persona trabajadora, está embarazada  tiene siete meses de embarazo  y está feliz y contenta por su bebé que viene en camino.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Víctor Hugo a quien quiere y le agradece el apoyo que le ha dado para que pueda seguir trabajando aun estando embarazada.
Se dedica a la venta de leños  por carga(150 leños)
Doña Dulce tambien  se  dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife desde hace dos años, ella pidió el préstamo para la comprar de más productos Herbalife para la venta.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Dulce is a hardworking person who is 6 months pregnant, and who is very happy and content about the baby that is on the way.

She is happily married to Victor Hugo, who she loves and is grateful to for the support that he has provided her so that she could continue to work even though she is pregnant.

She sells logs (150 per load).

Dulce also has had a business selling Herbalife products for 2 years.  She requested this loan to buy more Herbalife products to sell.

She thanks the Fundacion for the support that they have given her so that she can get ahead and succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase natural health products to sell.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai, a widow, is 58 years old with 3 children. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing cherry blossoms and raising chickens for eggs. Her business started 10 years ago and creates good income for her to manage her family's life.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnam dong to buy  chicken feed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, 41, has been farming for the past 10 years. Over this time, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not doing comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. 

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Gladys could increase her profits by satisfying the demand. Gladys believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals. Gladys also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Gladys to repay this loan and secure the future of her 5 school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a hardworking 42 year old woman who earns a living through selling snack foods like hot cake and bibingka (rice cake),  which she has used to manage the economy of her house.  She has her own property where she lives with her  3 school-aged-children and her husband, and she is happy to have her family. Her husband earns a living by operating a tricycle transportation services.

She  wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI  to purchase more ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and yeast . Thus, it enables her to prepare higher volume and continue to handle it efficiently. She is hoping that these would help improve the family's current situation and also able to finance the schooling of all her children.

Felipa used the previous loan to  expand her business and continue in  doing so.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and yeast

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Honest and hard working are the characteristics that clearly define Miss Julia. It has been 10 years since she has been divorced, and she was left destitute with her still very young children. But she alone was able to raise them with a small business she started during this difficult time, the sales of flour tortillas. Some time ago she was forced to leave the place where she had established her sales counter because the people no longer allowed her to stay, which was the beginning of a series of difficulties. Nevertheless she was able to re-establish herself in her own home and she continues on with her business that has allowed her to provide her family with all they need.

She now needs a loan of $250 to be able to purchase ingredients and necessary utensils to increase her productinos and increase her earnings. Miss Julia needs your generosity and your help. Do not abandon her and help her keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Honrada y trabajadora, son características que definen claramente a Doña Julia, hace 10 años que es una mujer divorciada y quedó desamparada con sus hijos aún muy pequeños. Pero ella sola pudo sacarlos adelante con un pequeño negocio que inicio en esa época tan complicada, la venta de tortillas de harina. Hace tiempo que tuvo que retiras del lugar donde estableció su puesto, pues las personas ya no le dieron el permiso necesario, por lo que enfrentó una serie de dificultades. Si embargo ahora se estableció en su propia casa y continúa con esta actividad que le ha permitido darle a su familia todo lo necesario.

Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $250 DLLS para poder comprar los insumos e utensilio necesarios para aumentar su producción e incrementar sus ingresos. Doña Julia requiere de tu generosidad y ayuda, no la abandones y apóyala a continuar.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
This 42-year-old man has 7 years experience in this business. Having borrowed a loan of $500, he bought clothes for women. Now he needs a loan of $800 to increase the assortment of his goods.
He lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village, is married, and has 3 children.

loans.use: To increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Henry Anye

texts.en: Henry is married with four children, all attending school. Challenged by his untimely retirement and the hardship  which it brought, he resorted to farm-to-mouth practice for survival.  Later on he struggled and succeeded in starting a piggery which has never really been rewarding. This hardship and the changes he saw in the lives of other community members who were members of GHAPE in his community, has motivated him to join the GHAPE program. With his training in Piggery, Henry is prepared to revitalize his pig-farm. Given a loan of $75, he plans to buy 1-piglet and feed. He plans to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Buying of pig feed

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Mrs O. is a woman of 65 years of age with 10 kids altogether. Although she has many children to raise  plus family commitments, she hasn't failed in taking up these duties. And it’s because of this particular business of ice-blocks where she started from her 1st loan of $750.She is now on her 5th loan of $1500 and it was used to repair the roof of her house and buy more ingredients for her ice-blocks. She has now also added her pancakes business which help the most in her repayments. She believes that without the help she got from the SPBD program through their loans that she could not raise her family and satisfy her family needs as well as her kid’s education. She is asking for a $1000  loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Business & Home Improvement

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
M. Elbrus is 28 years old. He is single. He was born in the Gubadi region, which is situated in the western part of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. It is also the site of the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict.  He started his business in 2003. He runs a fruit stand. He purchases the fruit from the wholesale market Salyan city and he sells it with his friend at his stand. In 2004, Elbrus borrowed $300 from Normicro and expanded his business by buying grapes. Next, he borrowed $600 to repair his car (which he uses to transport the fruit)  and increased the number of clients and his income.

Now Elbrus is applying for a loan of $1000 to increase his capital and the volume of his business. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to increase the volume of his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Surtinah

texts.en: Surtinah is 32-year-old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn US$44.50 per month, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Surtinah requests a loan to fil her shop. Her husband, L., has no regular income, so she has to work hard for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
On of the busiest avenues of the city of Juliaca we find Victor, very happy to be providing his service of cell phone calls to the population. He starts his work at 7 in the morning and finishes at 8 at night, every day of the week. He carries out his work with a lot of joy. He feels very satisfied because in a very little time he has accomplished the short-term objectives he had drawn up for himself. Before starting the business, Victor was studying to be a mechanic in a private vocational school, but his lack of economic resources forced him to abandon his studies. Now, with great expectations in his work and his professional life, he wishes to continue prospering. To achieve this he is willing to invest all of his effort. He is thinking about acquiring another cell phone. With this purpose in mind, he turns to your good disposition and requests a loan to make the goals he has set for himself a reality. Victor anxiously awaits your response.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

En una D. las avenidas más concurridas D. L. ciudad D. Juliaca encontramos muy contento a Víctor, brindando sus servicios D. llamadas móviles a L. población. Él inicia su labor a las 7:00 D. L. mañana y L. culmina a las 8:00 D. L. noche, durante todos los días D. L. semana; esta actividad que desempeña con mucha alegría le viene generando muchas satisfacciones porque en corto tiempo ha logrado alcanzar los objetivos que se había trazado a corto plazo. Anteriormente Víctor estudiaba L. carrera técnica D. Mecánica en un instituto privado, pero por sus bajos recursos económicos se vio en L. necesidad D. abandonarlos; ahora con muchas expectativas en su trabajo y en su vida profesional, desea seguir prosperando, para lograrlo está dispuesto a esforzarse mucho más y tiene pensado adquirir otra herramienta D. comunicación. Con ese prepósito recurre a tu buena disposición y hace L. solicitud D. un préstamo a fin D. cristalizar las metas que se ha propuesto. Víctor espera ansioso tu respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional work tool in order to expand his services.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun N., 42, is a widow and works as a chief in one restaurant in Phnom Penh city. Normally she earns from her work about $2.5 a day. She has 7 children and two of who are live away from home. Mrs. Bun wants to create anther business for her son by purchasing a motor-taxi for him. To buy this motor she needs money around $700. So now she is requesting some loan from Kiva about $700 to run a business for her son. ( Mrs. BUN took pic with her mum)

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase a motor-bike for her son to run a business as a motor-taxi driver.

loans.name: Joseph K.

texts.en: Joseph is 36-years old and married, and is living in a rented house.  As a teacher, his salary is less than $100 per month.  It took 3 years for Joseph to save money to start the foundation of their house.  With his wife’s small business, they do not earn enough to invest in the building.  Joseph is requesting for a loan of $275 to his monthly salary.

loans.use: For additional capital to complete a house

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 33 years old and has two children. He works and lives with his family in the town of Saida in southern Lebanon. Ali makes a living by selling chickens and sandwiches. This is his second loan from A. Majmoua, and he plans to use it to buy a generator for his business.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
Madeleine is a young mother of a beautiful 3-year old girl. She sells firewood and furniture pieces such as drawers/chests which help her pay the monthly bills and the basic necessities of her little daughter. At this time, she's requesting a loan which she will used to renovate her home to accomodate/make room for a beautiful grocery/convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Madeleine, es una joven madre de una pequeña niña de tres años. Se dedica a la venta de leña y cajones que le ayudan con los gastos en su hogar y las necesidades de su pequeña hija, pero en estos momentos requiere de capital para poder ambientar su domicilio y hacer de ella una hermosa tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: To renovate her home to accomodate/make room for a grocery/convenience store

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina, a member of the Village Bank Retoño, is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Faustina visits the different fairs of the regions where she buys cereals and potatoes, then sells the cereals in the Nery Garcia market. She dries the potatoes (used for many typical Peruvian dishes) and also buys already-dried potatoes, later selling them in cities on the coast. Faustina needs a loan of $700, money which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes by the sack.

Faustina´s dreams are to help her children become professionals, develop her business, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of potatoes by the sack.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines lives on Arani Street in the Luis Espinal zone of the city of El Alto. She lives with her 2-year old daughter in the home of her mother because she is separated from her husband. She dedicates herself to selling toys from a stand near the mayor’s office. She plans to invest her loan into the purchase of more toys, for which she indicates there is great demand. By increasing her inventory, she hopes to improve her income. It is her first loan through IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted indicates she qualifies to receive the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ines, vive en la calle Arani de la zona Luis Espinal de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su pequeña hija de 2 años en la casa de su madre, en vista de que por razones familiares se separo de su esposo Se dedica al comercio de juguetes en un puesto callejero en alrededores de la Alcaldía de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de más juguetes, para los cuales ella indica qaue existe mucha demanda y así mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of more toys, which is the product she sells.

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en:
Asiah is a married woman with a one-year-old child. She has owned a small food shop since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US175 from her sales.

Asiah now hopes for a loan to buy more items including rice, sugar, and beans for her business.

loans.use: To increase  shop inventory

loans.name: Maryam's Mama Imarisha Group

texts.en: Maryam is 30 years old and married with two children, aged 5 and 10 years old. She has run her own shop since 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales. Maryam is looking for a loan to buy more more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, bites sales and firewood sales.

loans.use: Maryam would like to buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es: Desde niño Valentín supo trabajar, sus padres le enseñaron a desempeñarse como agricultor, lo que aprendió muy bien, ya que ahora siendo padre de familia, sigue dedicándose a esto.  Gracias a sus padres, él tiene ahora la oportunidad de salir adelante en la agricultura, desea incrementar sus productos agrícolas, para brindarles a sus seres queridos una vida más prometedora.  A pesar de ser un buen agricultor y en hombre trabajador necesita de apoyo para salir adelante y mejorar su producción, por ello solicita un préstamo, para comprar  los abonos necesarios, los cuales están sumamente caros,  pero sin ellos su producción no sería la mejor. Usted puede ayudarlo a seguir  adelante con sus planes de  desarrollo.
texts.en:
Since he was a child Valentin has known to work. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist, and he learned very well. Now that he is father of a family he still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents he now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive, but without them his production will not improve. You can help him keep moving forward with his development plans.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers so his agricultural production will be of good quality/Compra de abonos para que su producción agrícola sea de calidad.

loans.name: Sinart

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinart N. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Takeop Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. For her rice farming, she cultivates a 1 hectare field, and cultivates vegetables on the other 2 hectare field. In the second plantation, she is facing a small problem because she does not have enough money buy cassavas to grow, so she decided to ask for a loan.

Mrs. Sinart N. is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is only two years old. The man on the right of the photo is Mrs. Sinart N.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy cassavas to grow

loans.name: Ami Collé

texts.fr: Ami Collé S., mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Plateau 2 depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce de condiments (poissons séchés, yet, piment, balai, patates et autres. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ami Collé S., married and having five children to look after, has been a member of the village loan group Plateau 2 for a year and a half. She wants to boost her commerce in goods, such as smoked fish, 'yet' (a kind of dried mollusk), chili peppers, brooms, potatoes, and more. Her income enables her to cover family expenses and to improve living conditions at home. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish, dried mollusks, chili peppers...

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort G. is forty-five years old and married with four children. Two of her children have completed high school. Comfort is working very hard to help her husband earn enough to send their children to higher levels of academics.

Comfort trades in textiles such as clothes, pants, etc. She has been in business for ten years. She buys from the nearby towns and sells in the community market. Comfort wants a bigger working capital so that she can procure in bulk and trek to nearby villages to sell. She desires to secure a loan to be able to achieve this. Comfort belongs to a Trust Bank group called “Kingdom”. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Jamaica Group

texts.en:
Nasra S., age 39, is married with three children, ages 14, 9 and 3. She has a charcoal  and fish businesses that she started 3 years ago. She works daily from 8am until 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $.218. 

This will be Nasra’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the three previous loans to improve both of her businesses and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her fish stock. 

Nasra will share this loan with subgroup B of the Jamaica group. The subgroup has 6 members who run stationeries, and sell fish, charcoal, and clothes. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Nasra is the second person from the left in the back row.

loans.use: To increase her fish stock

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Tạ Thị Hằng năm nay 32  tuổi. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Sóc Sơn -Hà nội. Năm 2008 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán thịt lợn. Hiện nay bên cạnh nguồn thu nhập từ buôn bán thịt lợn, gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc làm thợ lắp đặt điện nước của chồng. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng đầu tư thêm vốn buôn bán thịt lợn, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thêm thiết bị phục vụ cho công việc lắp đặt điện nước của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ta Thi H. is 32 years old. She is living with her husband and two small children in Soc Son District, Hanoi. In 2008, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to buy and resell pork. Currently, in addition to income from pork trading, her family also receive income from electrical/water installation work of her husband. With an income of VND3,000,000 per month, the condition of living of her family has been improved.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000. She will use part of the loan to buy more pork to sell, and the remaining part to buy tools and equipment for the electrical/installation work of her husband.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more pork to sell, buy tools for electrical/water installation

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
B. Ibrohim has been associated with MicroInvest since 2003. He lives in the B.Gaurov region and has a large family. Ibrohim is engaged in commercial service and sales. He sells food products in the local bazaar (sugar, conserves, slated tomatoes, cucumbers, coffee, tea, vegetable, cotton oil, etc). He also sells household wares (shampoo, soaps, cleaning powders, etc), products that he buys in Istaravshan and Uzbekistan. 

Ibrohim's professional background is that of a school teacher. He sells in the local bazaar and his children help him. Ibrohim wants to import household wares that are made in the Russian federation as they are popular and the quality is good.  Ibrohim asks KIVA for business support in the form of a loan of 4100 STJ over 3 months. This loan will permit him to increase his sales turnover and expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his sales turnover and strengthen the existing business.

loans.name: Yakub

texts.en:
Yakub A. is 56 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Yakub’s goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Dushanbe city in search of customers. He has owned his business for 6 years. Yakub plans to replace his car's fuel supply system with one using gas, as gas is cheaper than petrol. His car also needs thorough repair.  With these goals in mind, he wants to borrow $2500 USD for the term of 18 months. He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, new Western culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing Kapron gas cylinders for his car's fuel supply system and spare parts for thorough repair.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr:
GODJO Hélène est née vers les années 1951. Hélène est mariée à AGBIOINOUKOU Bernard et est mère de cinq (05) enfants tous scolarisés. Hélène vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. C'est des légumes que vend Hélène. Hélène a eu déjà de prêt à ALIDé; prêt qu'elle a bien remboursé. Aujourd'hui encore, Hélène sollicite de prêt auprès de ALIDé pour mieux s'approvisionner en légume afin d'éviter des ruptures de stock et de mieux faire fasse à la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Hélène Godjo was born around 1951 and is married to Bernard Agbioinoukou. She has five children, all of whom attend school. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and sells vegetables for a living. Hélène has already obtained a loan from ALIDé, which she repaid without issue. She is now requesting another loan from ALIDé to bolster her supply of vegetables so that she avoids running out of stock and is better equipped to meet customer demand. ALIDé means "there will always be a path for the poorest" in Fon, a regional language of Benin. Benin is a small West African country next to Nigeria, of which the per capita GDP is $1,500.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eight vegetable hectares

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de cartes de crédit pour téléphones,  de pagnes wax, de  tissus et font des prestations de teinture.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 25 complets  tissus pour hommes et femmes, 13 pièces de pagnes wax, une centaine de cartes de crédit pour  téléphones,  5 colis de colorants et une barrique de soude caustique.
Elles s’approvisionnent au Burkina Faso et au grand marché de Sikasso ville. 
Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso ville, à domicile et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant et en détail. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille(en épargne) et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi ambitionnent d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle et  de devenir grossistes.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Benkadi are all married women who average 41 years of age and 3 children each. They live mainly in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, a district in Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their fourth solidarity loan. All the preceding loans were settled. The group members do a diversity of work, including selling mobile phone cards, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and fabrics, and they offer cloth dyeing services.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 25 suits for men and women, 13 bolts of Wax pagnes, 100 mobile phone cards, 5 packages of dyes, and a barrel of caustic soda. Supplies are gotten in Burkina Faso and at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City. The merchandise is sold in mostly retail cash transaction to customers composed of men and women at different marketplaces in the city, in their homes, and in the area going door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 15,500 franc CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs (savings account), and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to increase their turnover, so as to satisfy their customers better, and to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Jitahidi group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell so as to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rehema is 23 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina tiene 37 años, vive con sus hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a las confección de prendas de vestir, especialmente, moda para ejecutivos(as), en sociedad con unos familiares, instaló un puesto de ventas donde expone sus más clásicos y novedosos trajes ejecutivos, el cual es también su taller de confecciones. Periódicamente, Lina estudia algunos cursos para capacitarse en las últimas tendencias de estas prendas de vestir y poder elaborar mejores y modernos trajes. Para más adelante le gustaría expandir su mercado de ventas y llevar a vender sus prendas a otras ciudades. Por el momento, está aumentando su producción por la creciente lista de pedidos que ha obtenido. Esta es la quinta vez que Lina tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un grupo solidario y reafirma su compromiso de seguir trabajando con una actitud positiva. El dinero que solicita estará destinado a la compra de telas por fardos, así como mayor cantidad de conos de hilos de diversas calidades y colores.
texts.en:
Lina is 37 years old. She lives with her children in her parents' home. For the past 10 years she has worked as a seamstress, especially designing formal fashions for executives. Along with some relatives, she set up a shop where she displays both classic and new suits for executives. The shop is also her workshop. Periodically, Lina takes training courses on the latest trends in formal clothing and to be able to create better and more modern suits. In the future she would like to expand her market and sell her clothing in other cities. For now, she is increasing her production due to an increase in orders. This is the fifth time that Lina has requested a loan through MFP. She is part of a united group and she reaffirms her commitment to continue working with a positive attitude. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase bolts of fabric as well as more spools of thread of different colors and quality,

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Erdenedulam

texts.en:
Erdenedulam P. is 31, a single mother who has two children aged 5 and 6 respectively. Both her children are attending a local kindergarten. She lives with her father, two younger brothers, and her children in Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

In January 2009, together with her sister, she started running a cosmetics sales business in a rental stall at the Baky, the local market. She used to run a clothing business before she started her cosmetics sales. Once or twice a month, Erdenedulam goes to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to purchase cosmetic items at wholesale prices. Her sister works as a saleswoman when Erdenedulam is out to purchase goods. Most of her repeat customers are local residents. She says that "My hope is to expand my tiny business for my children's future, to attain a better life." She requests a loan to purchase more cosmetics to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Marta Leticia

texts.es: la sra. Marta tiene una pequeña pulperia, en la cual vende productos basicos de consumo diario como ser arroz, azucar, frijoles, refrescos, entre otros. su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia San Francisco, su negocio lo abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, tambien ella en su negocio hace golosinas para vender como ser tacos, enchiladas, tajadas de platano fritas y pastelitos. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas productos al por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancias, ella se mueve dos veces por semana al mercado a comprar su producto, nos cuenta ella que su mayor deseo es poder terminar de construir su casa, ella es muy amable y siempre atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa.
texts.en:
Marta has a small general store where she sells basic products of daily consumption such as rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, and others. Her business is located in the San Francisco neighborhood; she opens her business at 7 in the morning and closes at 10 at night. She also makes snacks to sell in her business like tacos, enchiladas, fried plantains, and pastries. She needs a loan to purchase more products wholesale to be able to obtain better earnings; she travels twice a week to the market to purchase her products. She tells us that her biggest wish is to be able to finish building her house. She is very friendly and always attends to her clients with a smile.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans, churros, soft drinks, juices, canned goods, pastas, canned soups, sugar, rice, milk, coffee, cookies, bread, candies, lard, butter, tortillas, and margarine.

loans.name: Cherley

texts.en:
To uplift their living situation from poverty is one of the dreams of Cherley E. a hog-raiser in the village of Siempre Viva Sur Mallig, Isabela. She is 47 years old and already a widow.  She believes that unity, patience and hard work are essentials to become successful in life. She solely works for the welfare of her four children.  Being a widow is not a hindrance for her to achieve her dreams.  She needs to be diligent and determined to overcome every difficulties of life. She remains a fighter and tries not to be a loser for every test of time.

Through her hog raising business, Cherley was able to cope up with their daily needs.  her need of business capital encourages her to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 15,000.00.  She will use the money to buy feeds supply for the maintenance of her business for her to further support the education of her children.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Nadine

texts.fr: Nadine est née vers les années 1982 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Nadine est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Nadine vit avec sa famille à Cococodji non loin de Cotonou. Nadine vend des fromages (de la marque, la vache qui rit) aux vendeuses de pains de Cococodji. C’est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier du Bénin que Nadine achète ses cartons de fromages. Nadine a besoins de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle en possède actuellement pour répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Nadine sollicite de crédit auprès d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Nadine was born around 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou. Nadine sells cheeses (the brandname Laughing Cow) to bread vendors of Cococodji. Lomé, the capital of Togo (a nation bordering Benin) is where she buys boxes of cheeses. She has need of more financing than she currently possesses for responding appropriately to customer demands. This is Nadine's reason for requesting an ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 boxes of cheeses

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a member of The Dawn village bank. 
She is 37 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children who are 13, 7, and 10 months old. Her two eldest are studying at the public school. 
For three years, Sonia has spent every Sunday selling tamales and every weekday afternoon selling picarones (Peruvian dessert). 
Since joining FINCA Perú, Sonia has learned to save and when there are tough economic situations, her business helps cover the expenses of her family. 
Sonia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy ingredients to make tamales such as corn, banana leaves, oil, and flour. Her dream is to own a place where she can start a convenience store business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales such as corn, banana leaves, oil, and flour.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia P. is from the village of Danao. She is 58 years old. Lucia is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Lucia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Lucia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 44 years old and she is married to Cesar, a carpenter. This couple is blessed with a daughter named Quinnie who is 21 years old. The family is happily living in the village of San Fabian Echague.

Leticia hopes for the success of her business. She sells vegetables and at the same time she manages a carinderia or canteen. Developing her carinderia is what she wants to do in order to encourage more costumers to go to her place. In this regard, she would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000. She hopes that she will be able to obtain the loan which will help her in buying additional vegetables and ingredients. Some of it will be used in developing her carinderia.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell and to develop her carinderia

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.en:
Geronimo P.'s main source of income comes from selling scrap metal and other used products in his community. He is 27 years old, married and has a small child. He is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. Geronimo has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Geronimo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Geronimo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 pesos from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand his product offering. Geronimo is requesting a new loan of 8000 pesos which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Erlinda T.

texts.en:
Erlinda has been two years in her livestock business and her net profit per month is Php 3,000. Sometimes she also sells vegetables in their village for additional income.

Now Erlinda is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 to strengthen her livestock business in order to improve her family's living conditions. She plans to use the loan to renovate her pigpens for provide better shelter for her hogs. She also wants to buy young piglets to raise.

Erlinda’s family resides in the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is married to a farmer named Nicanor Jr. and their marriage is blessed with four children who are: Flordeliza, Sherwin, Darwin, and Rodalyn, two of whom are already married. She wants to improve her business and she also wants to support her children in their education.

loans.use: To renovate her pigpens and to purchase some piglets

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Mrs. Vanny S. is a villager who lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Eom Chamroeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice.  In this plantation, they face a problem because the field is infertile which has a bad to effect on their crop. Thus, Mrs. Vanny S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. This couple does not have any children. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon, who is 40 years old and married with three school-age children, runs Gideon Electronics and sells various electronic accessories. He has been in business for four years and is requesting this loan from Faulu for Kes. 50,000 to increase his inventory of accessories.   Describing himself as optimistic and hardworking, Gideon says that in Faulu he has learned how to save money. In the future, he hopes to improve his standard of living by expanding his business into wholesale supply and purchasing a pick-up truck to use for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a stock of electronic accessories.

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Jokudu L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and beans, and she is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Jokudu is 34 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aquiles Jose

texts.es: El señor Aquiles Jose M. P., tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el barrio laureles sur, es casado y sus esposa es ama de casa, el señor M. es asalariodo siendo este el único ingreso económico que posee la familia, ellos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales el mayor de 22 años de edad, está por terminar su carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, el mediano de 17 años estudia la escuela secundaria y la menor tiene tres años de edad. El señor Aquiles trabaja para el Ministerio de Educacion, Cultura y Deportes, tiene 7 años y medio de trabajar para ellos, lo cual esto demuestra una estabilidad y responsabilidad, pues tiene 9 creditos con Kiva de los cuales con ninguno a quedado en M. y todos los ha utilizado para realizar modificaciones en su vivienda, gracias a estos fondos la familia M. ha podido mejorar sus estilos de vida y comodidades en el hogar, con este prestamo ahora construirá un cuarto para el hijo mayor y de esta manera ofrecerle a su hijo mayor, una mejor privcidad que tanto necesita debido a la edad que posee.
texts.en:
Aquiles Jose M. P., 54, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He's married and his wife is a housewife. Mr. M. is a salaried employee and his earnings are the family's sole source of income. They have three children. The oldest, who is 22, is about to finish his professional Business Administration studies. The middle son is 17 and is in high school. The youngest is a three-year-old daughter. Aquiles has worked for the Education, Culture and Sports Ministry for seven-and-a-half years, which shows stability and responsibility. He has had 9 loans with Kiva and he hasn't defaulted on any of them. He used all of them to make home improvements. Thanks to these funds, the M. family has been able to improve their standard of living and the comfort level in their home. This loan will be used to build a bedroom for the oldest son so that he can have more privacy, something he now needs because of his age.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en:
Basima is a 55-year-old widow who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her five children. Basima has been selling women's clothes from her house since 1983. She sells dresses, shirts, sweaters, etc. Basima requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her sales. Basima has been a microcredit client for eight years now, and has always paid on time. 

Basima is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and they feel comfortable purchasing from her. Her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties, since she has a big social network and people know her well. Basima decided to start her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation, especially after she lost her husband; she is a very active woman who does her best to improve her income and provide the best to her family. Therefore, she decided to have independent work. 

In the future, she plans to keep up the good work, and hope one day to expand her business by opening a shop, which will allow her to welcome more clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her sales

loans.name: Victoria Group 4, Lugazi

texts.en:
B. Patrick is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a 36-year-old businessman who buys fish for resale to his customers in Lugazi and Mukono. From his sales, he is able to make over 300,000/- as profits a month.

Patrick works so hard for his business to increase as he hopes to become the biggest supplier of fish around the region and his determination and hard work, in addition to the loans for increased capital, will take him there. He needs a loan to be able to buy more fish for resale.

(One of the ladies squatting in a black sharia with a yellow and white robe appears in another subgroup since in this photo, her face is not very clear.)

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Alohida

texts.ru: Шарифова Алохида проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Алохида зарабатывает путём разведения крупно- рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продаёт на рынке. В этой деятельности она уже 7 лет. Во всем этом ей помогает муж. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Alohida S. lives in the Yavan district. She is 43 years old, married and has 6 children. Alohida earns a living by breeding cattle. She buys young bulls, raises and sells them at the market. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her husband helps her with the business. Alohida is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle. She wants to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham B. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Oroquieta City. He is 35 years old and married. To make a living, Abraham owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing barber shop services to local community members. Abraham has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Abraham joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Abraham is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating his barber shop. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey H. is 47 years old and a villager who lives in Lieb village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Meng Mos, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, her husband is a fisherman who can earn a small income to support his family. Even with both businesses, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Srey H. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Srey H. is a mother of four children. One of the children is a seamstress in the garment factory and the other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar P. se dedica a la construcción desde hace ya más de diez años.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto de que será para sus dos hija que ya están en la adolescencia y quieren su privacidad, ya que comparten el una habitación con sus hermanos menores. Solo le esta haciendo falta el material ya que le se encargara de la construcción en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
El se encargara de pagar el préstamo con el ingreso que obtiene de sus trabajos, ya que su esposa la señora Maria Elena Zavala se encargara de los gastos familiares, en el sueldo que recibe como empleada de una fabrica.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar P. has been working in construction for over 10 years. He is requesting a loan in order to start building a room for his two adolescent daughters, who want some privacy at this stage as they currently share a room with their younger siblings.
