The only things he needs are building materials since he will build the room himself in his spare time. He will repay the loan with the income he obtains from work since his wife, Maria Elena Zavala, takes care of the family expenses with the money she receives as a factory worker.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an additional room

loans.name: Ingreel Geammy

texts.es: Ingreel Geammy H. D. de 22 años de edad, es una joven madre, la cual posee su propia negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación el la ciudad de Soyapango, ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su pequeña hija, su madre quien es un gran apoyo para ella y su hermano. Ingreel se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, así como también productos alimenticios, desde hace dos años que ella trabaja de esta manera en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual también se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar a su pequeña hija la cual es el mayor incentivo para Ingreel, ya que ella a su corta edad es madre soltera, por lo que debe trabajar muy arduamente para brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija. Ingreel solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda, comprando productos los cuales aún no posee y así mismo aumentando el número de aquellos que tienen una gran demanda lo cual le permita aumentar sus ventas, lo que es el mayor deseo de Ingreel, puesto que esto le permitirá brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Ingreel Geammy H. D., age 22, is a young mother. She has her own business, which is located in her house. It is in the city of Soyapango in the San Salvador department. She lives there with her little daughter; her mother, who is a great help to her; and her brother. Ingreel sells basic needs items for the home. She also sells food products. She has been working in her house this way for two years. She also does the household chores and takes care of her little daughter. Her daughter is Ingreel’s greatest incentive. At her young age, she is a single mother. She needs to work arduously in order to provide her daughter with all of the necessities. Ingreel is asking for a loan to have the money she needs to invest in the store. She will buy products that she still does not have. She will also increase the number of products for which she has a great demand. This will allow her to increase her sales, which is Ingreel’s greatest wish. This will allow her to give her daughter a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal B. is a National Authority employee and a father of a nine-year-old twins, Massara and Mustafa, a seven-year-old, Shahd, and a five-year-old,  Muhammad. Nidal owns an accessories and cosmetics booth in Rafah City which is located in front of a girls' college in the city.

Nidal has been running the booth for the last five years in order to provide better living conditions for his wife and four children. Having the store in front of a girls' college is helping it to prosper.

Nidal thought of expanding his work and purchasing a wider variety of accessories and goods to attract more customers and meet their needs. He came to FATEN to take out a $1500 loan and is hoping to be able to afford a store in the near future.

Nidal stands in front of his booth in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es:
El señor Santos Javier G. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo construir la barda alrededor de su vivienda.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para los acabados de interior de la cocina de su casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga  de una compañía de trasporte.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Cynthia Aurora Barba esposa del señor Santos Javier ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita a si vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos Javier Guzman is grateful for your support of his previous loan with which he was able to build a fence around his home. He is requesting a new loan to finish the interior of his kitchen. He plans to repay the loan with his earnings as a transport truck driver for a transport company. His wife Cynthia Aurora Barba is in the photo because he was at work on the day of the visit to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completion of kitchen

loans.name: Phai

texts.en:
Mr. Phai U. (pictured with his wife), is 56 years old and his wife, Mrs. Kimheng Kong, is 50 years old. They live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1979, and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Three of them are garment factory workers, one assists his father in their farming business, and four attend school.  

Phai has been a farmer for 17 years; he grows eggplant and melons on his farmland in the village. His wife has been selling vegetable for two years. Phai does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm and pay for plowing fees. 

Hence he is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,200 USD as additional working capital.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide and pay for plowing

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios, tiene 39 años y es natural del Cusco.

Juan de Dios nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a la distribución de productos de aseo personal y accesorios de la casa a las tiendas de la ciudad de Izcuchaca y a las comunidades de Anta y también trabajo para el socio Jacinto, le ayudo a vender zapatos los sábados en el mercado Altiplano de la ciudad del Cusco y me paga un sueldo. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Juan de Dios is 39 years old and from Cusco.

Juan de Dios tells us: " We are 10 members in my community bank and I was chosen to give testimony about my economical activity. I distribute products for personal hygiene and home accessories in the stores of the town of Izcuchaca and the communities of Anta and I also work for the member, Jacinto. I help him sell footwear on Saturdayes at the Altiplano market of the town of Cusco, and he pays me a salary. For several years I have worked with Asociación Arariwa and I have done well. At the moment I need the loan to buy more merchandise."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Marjorie Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marjorie es una joven, trabajadora esforzada en esta vida, con deseo de poder tener una casa digna para sus dos hijos,  con ayuda de su esposo han logrado hacer su pequeña casa, que aun falta mucho por hacer, pero no cuenta con dinero en efectivo.
Es por eso decide trabajar de lavado y planchado toda la semana y poder obtener ingresos propios que ayude a los gastos, de alimentación, educación, medicina, u otros para lograr el equilibrio.
Con su primer préstamo logro terminar de cerrar su casa de concreto, ahora con este financiamiento, comprara: nueve láminas de zinc, golosos para cambiar parte del techo y cerrar la parte que le hace falta. Logrando con esto una mejora más en su casa, y un bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Marjorie is a young woman, hard-working and accomplished in this life, with the desire to be able to have a worthy house for her two children. With the aid of her husband, she has managed to make a small house, which still needs a lot of work, but they lack the money. Because of this she decided to work taking in washing and ironing all week in order to obtain her own income that helps with the expenses of food, education, medicine, and other things to achieve a balance. With her first loan she finished closing in her concrete house. Now, with this loan she will buy nine sheets of zinc, metal braces and screws to change part of the ceiling and to close the part that is missing. With this she will improve her house and the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets of zinc, metal braces and screws to close up the ceiling so the family will not get wet when it rains.

loans.name: Niymat

texts.en:
Niymat R. was born and lived in the Republic of Tadjikistan. He grew up in a large family with 12 children. From early childhood he had to help his parents in the field where his family cultivated potatoes and cotton. After serving in the army, Niymat returned home and began to work as a builder.  He was 27 years old when he married and soon became the father of twins – a boy and a girl.  

Niymat didn’t want to stay to his native village because of civil war in Tadjikistan. He took his family and in 1999 moved to the central part of Kyrgyzstan, Ivanovka village. Using the money he had earned, Niymat bought a house and one bull-calf for fattening.  Also, he planted vegetables--cucumbers, tomatoes, eggplants, and potatoes on the plot of land.  

Niymat didn’t have any experience in cattle breeding, however within 10 years he multiplied the number of cattle. Today, he has one cow, two calves and one bull-calf. Being very purposeful and positive person, Niymat works hard to support his family.

Niymat plans to use this loan of 30,000 Kyrgyz Soms to increase the number of cattle. In the future, Niymat is planning to give higher education to his children and build a house for his son. He also plans to marry his daughter off and wants to see his grandchildren. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn G., 56, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Angelito G., a string instrument maker, and is the mother of a daughter currently taking a nursing course in college. By the grace of God, Evelyn has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to support her child until she finishes college. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Evelyn. As she has been a college graduate herself, she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.
Evelyn operates a string instrument business. She mostly supports her husband, Angel, who is the one who makes the string instruments by hand. Together, they manage to produce high quality instruments such as violins, cellos, guitars and others. Angel has also managed to invent a few things he currently uses to make his instruments – one of them is a violin clamp that he is planning to patent. They are going to start trying to export soon, as there are very few customers who buy their products in their immediate vicinity.
To help her continue to operate her business, Evelyn is requesting a loan of 28,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her instrument business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Evelyn dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her instrument business

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en:
Baatar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in his own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His eldest son, Enkhtuvshin, 24, is married and lives separately with his wife. He works as a driver in the police department. Baatar’s daughter, Enkhtuul, 22, graduated from college as a chef and is looking for a job at the moment.
Baatar has been running a taxi business for 12 years and has gained valuable experience. On average, he drives 100 kilometers a day, of which 60 kilometers is with passengers. Baatar is one of our reliable customers. He has taken microloans from Kiva partner, Credit Mongol LCC, four times, using them to build a house for his son. This time, he is planning to rebuild his old family house, making a proper wall, roof and extension to the house. The basement was completed last summer. Before the winter he wants to complete the construction work and external decoration of the house. The loan he is asking for will be used to pay for construction materials for the house and some labour costs.

loans.use: To pay for construction materials for the house and some labour costs

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie H. is from the village of Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Tessie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Tessie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna C., age 49, is from the city of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. Benigna is widowed and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Benigna raises livestock, specifically pigs, for fattening and sale. Benigna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,700 PHP when she sells a pig she has raised.

This year, Benigna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Benigna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Benigna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 32 years old and married with seven children between the ages of one and fourteen. All of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband is a farmer and Mariam works in a beauty salon. She has had this business for 10 years. Mariam will use her loan to buy more beauty products and with the profit she will increase the number of products that are used in her salon. She says her business is successful because she has many customers. In the future Mariam would like to sell other items such as women’s clothing.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta E. is a 50-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a small eatery and a piggery business.

She lives in C. Batiancila, Poblacion, Sta. Fe, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her small eatery and piggery businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. 

Loreta is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she could fund her business operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

Loreta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella T. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Estrella is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling Filipino delicacy meats, like chicken halang-halang and adobong pork, for the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Estrella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Consuelo Janeth

texts.es:
Consuelo Janeth M. M. tiene 36 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Consuelo Janeth  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta pasear.
texts.en:
Consuelo Janeth M. M. is 36-years-old.  She lives in a common law marriage with her partner and her children.  They live in the town of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.  She has four children.

The members of the V.R.C Valle Paraiso (Paradise Valley) are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes office in the town of Chillanes.  This service point works with short season agricultural activities like cacao growing, which they have been doing for a long time.

Consuelo Janeth works in agriculture growing cacao and has for the past two years.  She buys products from Matilde Esther and sells them in the Chillanes fair and in the same store where she makes her purchases.

She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation.  With the support of the loan, it will help her to meet her economic needs.  She faces challenges with her plants like pests, disease, and weather variation.  Her dream is to buy a car.

She enjoys going for walks.

loans.use: Agricultural additives and fertilizers for cacao cultivation.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 45 years old and the mother of three daughters and two sons. She lives in Tulkarem City and has started a small business of producing pickles and sells them to shops and neighbors. The small project grew and became a small factory to answer the local demand.

Hanan's husband is a taxi driver. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee and her other son manages work in the factory with Hanan.

Hanan came to FATEN's office in Tulkarem, where she is pictured above, and took a loan to partly pay for a car she purchased to ease transportation and managing her work with clients as she promotes and works on partnerships with shops around the city.

loans.use: To purchase a car to help Hanan manage her work

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Enma O., pertenece a la alcancía comunal La Nueva esperanza conformada por siete integrantes, los cuales son todos vecinos ya que viven en el mismo barrio. Algo que las caracteriza es el esfuerzo que realizan diariamente por salir adelante y dar un mejora económica a sus hogares, muestra de ello es la señora Enma O. de 49 años de edad casada y madre de dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un pequeño puesto que pudo conseguir por medio de una amiga, hace ya más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica, el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones económicas a lo largo de tantos año, una de ella  es la educación de sus hijos y la implementación de mueble para su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería como son polos y pantalones.
texts.en:
Enma O. belongs to the “La Nueva Esperanza” Communal Bank.  It is comprised of seven members who are all neighbors.  They live in the same neighborhood.  One thing that distinguishes them is the effort they put forth daily to get ahead and improve their households’ finances.

Enma O., age 49, is an example of that.  She is married and has two adult children.  She sells clothes from a small stand that she was able to get through a friend.  She has been selling clothes for over 20 years.  Throughout these many years this business activity has given her a lot of financial satisfaction.  Some examples are educating her children and getting furniture for her home.

She plans to use this loan to buy merchandise like polo style shirts and pants.

loans.use: To buy polo style shirts and merchandise

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena A. is married to a driver. She has had senior high school education. Mena has been selling children’s dressses, shoes and other items in Takoradi for six years. Mena uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Mena will use this loan to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to buy a shop.

In the photo, Mena has displayed a few of the dresses she sells.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 55 años, es divorciado, tiene dos hijos (Claudio y Mitzu) y pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. Hugo es director de teatro y Mino de la escuela de taller “JUGLAR”, ya son 30 años con su trabajo.  La escuela de teatro tiene una línea pedagógica donde enseñan a confeccionar disfraces, mascaras y nariz de papayo.  El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más material para la elaboración de sus disfraces y mascaras. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Hugo is 55 years old, divorced with two children (Claudio and Mitzu) and belongs to the communal bank "Inti" Arariwa Association. Hugo is a theater director and school coordinator at the Workshop "Juglar" (minstrel); he has done done this job for 30 years. One of the courses at the theater school teaches how to make costumes, masks and fake noses. He requests a loan to buy more material for making costumes and masks. 
Hugo is grateful for the opportunity offered by this microfinance organization and thus he is commited to pay back according to the schedule. 
(Inti is a word in Quechua language that means Sun)

loans.use: Purchase of costumes and masks making material

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
Hệ  Trần Thị  (20203040079) is a 29 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hệ  is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 2 (Nhóm 10).


Hệ  is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Hệ  owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community.  Hệ  has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Hệ  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hệ  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Hệ  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Bá D. (0) is a 29 year-old male who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Trần Thị L. (0) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Cao Thị H. (0) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Trương Thị H. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 2.464.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Nguyễn Thị Thuyên (0) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hệ  Trần Thị  (20203040079) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hệ  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 2 (Nhóm 10).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ B.n hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hệ  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hệ  kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hệ  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hệ  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Bá D. (0) là 29 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trần Thị L. (0) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Cao Thị H. (0) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.464.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Nguyễn Thị Thuyên (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn B.n thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông B.o bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông B.o các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Mylene Faith

texts.en: To make a living, Mylene Faith J. plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She is 25 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of San Juan Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Mylene Faith is just starting her business. In 2009, Mylene Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Mylene Faith is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 29 years old and married. He has three children, and two are currently studying in school. Martin works as a bricklayer and has been doing so for 10 years. He started out as a bricklayer’s assistant and worked his way up to the position he has now. He hopes to one day be a construction foreman. His wife works as a weaver and helps support the family. 

Martin is requesting a loan to help pay for the remodeling of his family home. This is his second loan with ASDIR. The previous loan was repaid in full with no problems.

loans.use: to remodel and expand the family home.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío de 20 años, natural en el distrito de Santa Rosa; convive con Armando de 37 años y tienen 01 hija llamada Flor de 02 años de edad, juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la armonía. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesina y cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café, barbasco y hojas de coca plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 04 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha contrata a los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad es no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno no cultivado. Este su octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro crédito con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con el  crédito solicitado podrá contratar jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Rocío, 20, is originally from the district of Santa Rosa and lives harmoniously with her partner Armando, 37, and their daughter Flor, aged 2, in the house they own. From an early age her parents taught her how to work on the farm. She is a farmer and owns 3 hectares of land planted with coffee, barbasco and coca leaves, all of them native to the Apurimac river valley. 

She has worked in her lands for 4 years. During the harvest she hires day labourers who harvest and transport the produce. What she likes the most about her job is reaping the fruits from her plants, as it gives her the feeling that their quality pays off the months of hard work. She thinks that the most difficult part is to transport the produce from the farm to the collection centres in the city of San Francisco, where she's offered the best prices for her goods. 

Her main challenge is not to have enough income to cover the advance payments to the labourers who help her with the harvest. That's why she's requesting the support of the loans granted by MFP. However, her main priority at the moment is to sow more coffee plants, as she has 1 hectare of uncultivated land. This is her eight loan with MFP and she knows that if she pays it back on time she will be able to get another one with more confidence and without giving trouble to her community bank. With the requested loan she will be able to hire labourers to help her with the coffee harvest.

loans.use: to hire labourers to help her with the coffee harvest.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a resident and a farmer in Litein Town in South Rift, Kenya and has been in mixed farming for twenty years. His farm produces milk and tea which is sold to the local market. He has two farmhands in his farm. He is married with eight children, six of whom are schooling.

Julius has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy farming will help him educate his eight children including the two who have not begun their education.

Julius say access to animal feeds is his greatest challenge since sometimes they are quite expensive. He is however appreciative of Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Solidario Atardecer Group

texts.es: Solidario Atardeser: este grupo esta conformado por tres señoras las cuales se dedican a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad, Doña Patricia A. casada tiene 3 hijos uno de ellos es menor de edad y esta estudiando.Doña Patricia es la presidenta de este grupo ella lleva 7 años de ser comersiante ella vende productos Mexicanos de primera nececidad,como frijol, arroz,golocinas,aguas,etc ellas solicitan este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos comestibels de primera nececidad  ya que cuando viajan a la frontera ellas aprovechan comprar por mayor porque les sale mas barato,
texts.en:
Solidario Atardeser is a group made up of three women that are dedicated to selling staple foods.  Patricia Arellana is married and has three kids.  One of them is a minor and a student.  Patricia is the president of the group and has been a businesswoman for seven years, selling Mexican basic needs products like beans, rice, sweets, water, et cetera.  

The group requests this loan for the purchase of more merchandise.  When they travel to the border, they take advantage of purchasing items in bulk, since it turns out cheaper.

loans.use: purchase staple foods.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 54 años, es una persona muy luchadora, hace 3 años que se divorció, tiene 6 hijos pero sólo vive con sus dos últimos hijos, Dennis y Greta. Juntos residen en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Alto Yapaz. Los deseos de brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos, mediante una actividad que le agrada mucho, motivaron a que ella, junto a su familia cultivará plátanos, piña y café en terrenos propios y alquilados. Ya que ellos consideran rentable la agricultura,  Julia dice que le permite solventar los gastos domésticos, pagar la educación de sus hijos y sobre todo le permite ahorrar para cubrir alguna eventualidad que se le presente en el futuro. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace 15 años y aunque a veces le disgusta que sus plantaciones sean atacadas por algunos insectos, es perseverante y no se deja vencer, es así que a diario se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y trasladarse a su chacra hasta que caiga la noche. Además se dedica a vender durante los fines de semana, anticuchos, platillos en base de corazón de res a la parrilla, en la plazoleta de su localidad, obteniendo una ganancia neta de S/. 35 a S/. 40 soles como mínimo. Como obtiene buenas ganancias con este oficio, para su futuro, quiere contar con una mayor productividad, por eso plantará más cantidad de café,  producto requerido en los mercados a buen precio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los progresistas”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se muestra muy entusiasmada de saber que continuará trabajando con los integrantes de su asociación. Julia, invertirá el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá en sus cultivos de café, pues ya está comenzando el periodo de extracción de los primeros granos.
texts.en: Julia, age 54, is a very determined person. She was divorced 3 years ago, and has 6 children, although only the youngest two - Dennis and Greta - now live with her. Julia lives in her own house, located in the Alto Yapaz area. The desire to offer her children a decent quality of life, through doing work she loves, motivates Julia. Together with her family she will cultivate bananas, pineapples and coffee, on her own and rented land. The family have already found their agriculture profitable. Julia says it has enabled her to meet her domestic costs, pay for her children's education, and above all to save for whatever might present itself in future. She has dedicated herself to agriculture for 15 years and although sometimes she has been horrified to find her crops attacked by insects, she perseveres and will not let herself be beaten. She wakes at 5am each day to prepare food and go out to her fields until night falls. At weekends, she also finds time for selling anticuchos - dishes based on grilled beef heart - in the local square. She earns at least 35 to 40 Soles profit in this way. Because she has good earnings from her work, in future she would like to increase productivity. For this reason she plans to plant more coffee, a sought-after crop that fetches a good price in the markets. She belongs to a communcal bank calles "Los progresistas", and this is her third loan with [field partner] MFP. She is very pleased to be able to continue working with the other members of the association. Julia will invest the loan in buying sacks of organic fertilizer which she will spread on her coffee crop. The time to harvest the best coffee beans is just beginning.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Geovan

texts.en:
Geovan is a Rwandan businesswoman who runs a shop that sells new children’s clothes. Her business has proven to be incredibly successful, and it has expanded 6-fold during the five years she has been running it.  She is married and her husband is a soldier.  They have four children ranging in age from 5 to 13, and all of them are enrolled in school.

With this loan Geovan plans to buy more children’s clothes for ages 0 to 12, which will allow her to meet the demand of her growing clientele.

Geovan will use the profits from her business to reinvest and grow her capital so that she can continue to expand her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Thắm's Group

texts.en:
Thắm is a 46-year-old woman living in Yên Phong District of Băc Ninh Province. Thắm is the group leader of a two-member group receiving a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Mai - Nhóm 02 (2).

Thắm is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Thắm owns a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Thắm has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month.

In 2010, Thắm joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thắm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings to include beds and wardrobes. This will be Thắm's second loan from SEDA. Thắm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. H. is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a loan of 7,392,000 VND to support her manufacturing business, involving timber production and buying tables and chairs for sale.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thắm là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Thắm là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Mai - Nhóm 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thắm thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thắm kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Thắm đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thắm đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Thắm là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Amelita has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & breads. She has had this business for 13 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods to resell.

Amelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 58 años, radica actualmente con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que nació, sus padres forjaron en ella el trabajo duro como es las tareas del campo. Ahora los terrenos que ha heredado, le sirvieron para generarse ingresos económicos que le ha ayudado para sostener a sus hijos, que hoy son personas  mayores y de bien. Es así que continua cultivando hortalizas como zanahoria, cebolla, espinacas, acelga y maíz, que los hace secar y desgranar vendiéndole al por mayor, siendo llevados a la ciudad de Lima para venderlos en un puesto de ventas que ha conseguido en la misma ciudad. Asimismo vende frutas, en dicho puesto que ya tiene 5 años de funcionamiento y le ha traído buenas ganancias que compensan el esfuerzo que ha realizado en la temporada de siembra y de cosecha. Siente gran satisfacción de haber logrado mejoras económicas por lo que desea seguir trabajando. Lleva vaR. años trabajando con MFP y es una de las integrantes que impulsa la unidad de su  grupo solidario, que con su responsabilidad se siente orgullosa y tiene más ánimos de continuar trabajando de esa manera. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para la compra de sacos de abono orgánico y también en la compra al por mayor de frutas para implementar su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Luisa is 58 years old.  She currently lives with her two children in her own house.  Since she was born her parents instilled the value of hard work, like field chores, in her.  Now, the fields she’s inherited serve to generate income for her that has helped her support her children who are now adults and upstanding citizens. 

She continues farming such vegetables as carrots, onions, spinach, chard and corn, which she dries and hulls to sell at wholesale.  She has it taken to Lima to sell at a sales stand that she acquired there.  She also sells fruit in said stand.  The stand has been in operation five years and it has produced good profits that compensate for the effort she’s put into the planting and harvesting seasons.  She feels very satisfied to have reached improved economic conditions and wants to continue working.

She’s been working with MFP for years.  She is a member that foments group unity in her communal bank.  She feels proud to have this responsibility and is encouraged to continue working this way.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure and also to buy fruit at wholesale to stock her fruit stand.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to buy fruit.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 48 years old and married to Violet. They are blessed with five children who are 18, 16, 14, 12, and 11 years old. He does farming and has been farming for 21. His monthly income is KES 13,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD to buy fertilizer for his wheat and maize. He plans to use the anticipated profit to pay for his children's school fees and to hire land for next year's farming.

This is his second loan.  His dreams and hopes are to continue with his farming and offering electrical repair service in order to get additional income for the family to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for wheat and maize

loans.name: Santos Macario

texts.es: Don Santos tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos y es caficultor desde hace 30 años. Inició a dedicarse al cultivo de cafe por su propio esfuerzo e iniciativa, y sus ganas de salir adelante. Trabaja diariamente desde las 6 am hasta las 2 pm y uno de sus hermanos le ayuda, sus hijos no pueden ayudarle aun porque son muy pequeños y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Hasta el momento las dificultades que se le han presentado son de salud y de orden economico, ya que cuando el o alguien de su familia se enferma no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para trasladarse al centro de salud mas cercano. Por otra parte, una de las ventajas de don Santos es que su propiedad se encuentra en una zona muy apta para el cultivo y por lo tanto la produccion del Cafe se da muy bien, por este motivo él se atrevió a solicitar este prestamo ya que necesita comprar comprar abono y chapiar la tierra, y asi darle un mejor y adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo. Su meta es poco a poco ir tecnificando su finca y que esta le genere mayores ganancias, para poder sostener a su familia. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y piensa invertir muy bien el dinero para luego pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y asi obtar a mas prestamos y de mayor cantidad.
texts.en: Santos is 53 years old, he is married, he has two children and has been a coffee producer for 30 years. He started engaging in growing coffee by his own accord and thanks to his own means and his desire to progress. He works daily form 6 am to 2 pm, helped by one of his brothers as his children cannot help him yet because they are too young; his wife takes care of the housework. To today, the main difficulties he has had to face are health- and money-related, as when he or someone from his family falls ill he has not enough money to travel to the closest health care facility. On the other hand, one of Santos’ advantages is that his property is located in a very suitable area for the crops, therefore coffee production goes very well. For this reason he has dared asking for a loan, as he needs to buy manure and clear his land in order to give a better and appropriate maintenance to his crops. His goal is to gradually improve the technology of his plantation in order to generate more income to provide for his family. This is his first cycle with FAMA, and he plans on investing the money very well to punctually repay his dues, and to then be able to obtain more loans for higher amounts.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 35 years old, widowed and has one child, aged 13, to whom she hopes to provide education to the university level. Anne operates a salon business in Mtongwe, Mombasa. She also supplies water and sells gas to the local people. Anne has been in this business for one year and says that, though the business is profitable, there are challenges of financial constraints.

Anne is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy hair weaves, gas and water to grow her businesses and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her businesses and diversify to real estate and farming. Anne describes herself as jovial, reliable and responsible.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, gas and water.

loans.name: Hannah's Group

texts.en: Meet with this group of teachers from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 5,800,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges like paying school/college fees and buying house-building materials. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. Hannah is the leader of this group of teachers. The 44-year-old is married to a teacher and the couple has six children. Hannah has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Sinfrosa

texts.en:
Sinfrosa is 72 years old, married and has two children. She has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Sinfrosa has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Sinfrosa requested a 19,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Sinfrosa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anatilia Josefa

texts.es: Anatila Josefa tiene su negocio es que es una pulpería. Ella se encuentra muy contenta con su medio de vida. La dedicación que tiene con su negocio es algo que con las ganancias observa que ha valido la pena el esforzarse diariamente. Es en su vivienda donde está ubicado su negocio y llegan sus diferentes clientes a comprar los víveres necesarios como granos básicos, detergentes, refrescos, pan, galletas, entre otros.
texts.en: Anatila Josefa’s business is a grocery store.  She is very happy with her way of life.  The dedication she has toward her business is something that has borne fruit with profits earned and she notes that it’s well worth the daily effort.  Her store is located in her home and various customers come by to purchase needed foodstuffs like basic grains, detergents, soft-drinks, bread and cookies, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 47 years old and married with four children.

Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Sally has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from farm equipment & pig retailing.

Sally aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.ru: Рухсора жительница города Вахдат. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится заграницей. Сама Рухсора работает в ателье. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев и разных костюмов. В этой области она четыре года. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки и покупки тканей. Он хочет у себя дома шить национальные платья для продажи.
texts.en: Rukhsora lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 29 years old, married and has tow children.  Her husband is abroad.  Rukhsora works at a sewing salon.  She is involved in sewing national dresses and various suits.  She has been in this business for four years.  Rukhsora is requesting this loan for the purchase of sewing machine and fabrics.  She wants to start sewing national dresses for sale at home.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Fredy Alonso

texts.es:
Fredy es un hombre de 31 años, dedicado a transportar todo tipo de mercancía, trasteos, productos agrícolas y material de construcción, gracias a su vehículo de tracción animal. Su mayor sueño es tener varios coches y caballos para generar empleo para su familia, para quien anhela una mejor calidad de vida.

En este momento necesita acceder a un crédito para comprar otro coche y otro caballo y así, además de mejorar los ingresos familiares, tendrá la posibilidad de brindarle empleo a uno de sus hermanos menores, quien se encuentra desempleado y también requiere empezar a producir para obtener su propio sustento.
texts.en:
Fredy’s a 31-year-old man who works transporting all sorts of merchandise: furniture, farm products, building supplies thanks to his animal powered wagon.  His greatest dream is to have several wagons and horses to generate employment for his family that he wants to provide a better quality of life for.

At present, he needs access to a loan to buy another wagon and another horse so that besides improving his family income he will be able to provide employment for one of his younger brothers who is unemployed and needs to start producing to support himself.

loans.use: to buy a wagon and a horse.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman who has two children. She is 45 years old, residing at Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Alma owns and operates a business venture, cultivating fruit trees & harvesting fruit for sale to earn a living. She's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the cost of coconut harvesting. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost three years. In the future, Alma wants to expand her business and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of coconut harvesting.

loans.name: 030709-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Xuân is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. She is the leader of an eight-member group, the 030709-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Xuân has a manufacturing business, knitting bags to export. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to maintain her business.

In 2010, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xuân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Xuân hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy more land, and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase material to maintain her business.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is married and she's 46 years old with 1 child.

Matalena owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro (a tuber) for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Matalena needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Matalena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Matalena's 1st loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 47 years old and has six children aged 8 to 23 years old. All of her children attend school. She sells clothes in a store she has run for six years. Donatha would like a loan to increase her inventory of clothing to sell. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of becoming a clothing distributor in the future.

loans.use: To add more clothes in her store.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is 27-years-old and married with 2 children who are currently going to school. Everlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Everlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Everlyn has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, milk, sardines, noodles, etc.

In the future Everlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Louena

texts.en:
Louena is twenty one years of age and is married and has no children. Louena owns & operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Louena needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Louena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Louena's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isabel Antonia

texts.es:
La Clienta Isabel vive en La Libertad, tiene ella 44 años de edad. Ella empezó a vender productos en su casa para así poder tener ingresos económicos para su hogar, porque no había nadie para que le diera dinero, y como le fue muy bien decidió implementar su más su negocio para convertirlo en una tienda de víveres. 

Ella atiende la tienda  todos los días de la semana, de lunes a viernes. El único inconveniente que se le presenta en su negocio es los ladrones de su barrio, que intentan arrebatar las ganancias del día. 

 Ella es soltera el esposo la abandono. No tiene hijos. El préstamo lo usara para comprar víveres para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, jugos, etc. Ella desea tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old and lives in La Libertad.  She started selling products out of her house because she needed to generate household income since there was no one else who was earning money.  Isabel decided to grow her business even more by turning it into a grocery store.  

Isabel manages her store every weekday, Monday through Friday.  The only challenge that she faces in her business is dealing with neighborhood thieves who try to steal her daily earnings.  Isabel is single since her husband abandoned her.  She has no children.  

This loan will be used to buy products for her store such as rice, sugar, oil, juices, and other items.  Isabel would like to have her own commercial shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, juices, and other products.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Hoa has had a manufacturing business making cured pork for 5 years. This is a type of traditional specialty dish in this province. She hires 5 labors work together in house. She get up at 5 am every day to buy pork and material. All employees come at 7:30am and begin making cured pork. Then they bring their product to sell at cured pork agents or beer store (This dish is eaten while drinking beer)  
The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase materials and supplies to make cured pork to sell.
With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to be able to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies to make cured pork to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring more variety to her textile stock.

loans.name: Alikhan

texts.en: Alikhan was born in 1973 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has a child. Alikhan has 5 years experience in this business. He is a very hardworking person. Having borrowed a loan of $400, he bought 10 lambs. Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 20 lambs.

loans.use: To buy 20 lambs

loans.name: Marl

texts.en: Mrs. Marl H. is 35 years old and is a widow with 4 children. She lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia and makes her living by making and selling palm sugar to the wholesalers at a market. With this business activity, she normally makes about $5/day in revenue, which is a meager amount of money for her family's expenses. In order to maximize the family's income, Marl H. is asking for a $700 loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport her palm sugar to the market, so that she no longer spends so much on a motor-taxi or a trailer's service. In the future, she is thinking about how to have enough money to offer a better education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport her palm sugar to a market.

loans.name: Bentah

texts.en:
Bentah is a married mother of four lovely children. She is a very innovative and hardworking lady. She loves to help around the community at her home area at Nyahera, Kisumu-Kenya. She belongs to a self-help women's group called 'Ongeza Maarifa,' which is a Swahili phrase meaning "increase your wisdom." They make a variety of products and are particularly involved in a project termed 'jiko kisasa' (earthen oven/cooker). This cooker was recently introduced, and due to the high demand, the group is targeting to buy a kiln with higher capacity than the one currently in use.

They also need to purchase a vehicle which would enable them a quicker and more efficient means of transporting their goods. Bentah also hopes that with the profit that she will make she will be able to ensure her children's future with a good education.

loans.use: To add more stock and purchase a group lorry

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
My husband and I make paper envelopes. We purchase the raw materials from the local paper market on credit and sell the finished goods to various markets.

We are barely managing to send all three of our children to school. The reality is that our income is dwindling in comparison to our expenses. We wish to expand our business by purchasing paper using cash as it will be relatively cheaper .We are thus requesting a loan of $325 USD.

loans.use: To further expand business by purchasing paper on cash

loans.name: Dona

texts.es:
Dona is a very active woman who lives in San Martín, Peru. Her business is located in her own home within the city. It's a general store where she sells groceries as well as cosmetics, lingerie, and, most recently, eggs at wholesale. Thanks to her constant attention and dedication she was able to set up the store with iron shelving and glass display cases and stocks it every day with new products.

With the loan Dona is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase eggs to sell wholesale, 50kg sacks of rice and sugar, cosmetics and canned fish, milk and other non-perishable goods.

Dona is 53 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is very active. She leads a women's community group and is a member of a local communal bank. She's also very kind, which helps her sell cosmetics and lingerie to customers. In the future she wants to have a store selling lingerie, gifts and haberdashery.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Dona es una mujer activa, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Inmaculada, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jr. Tomás Villacorta Nº 241 y posee una Bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, lo cual combina con la venta de cosméticos, lencería fina y últimamente huevos al por mayor. Gracias a su constante esmero y dedicación ha logrado ir implementando la bodega, con andamios de fierro, vitrinas de vidrio y surtir cada día con nuevos productos. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 soles ($ 267.00), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 5 javas de huevos, para poder vender al por mayor, arroz y azúcar en sacos de 50kg, un stock de cosméticos en docenas y productos como conservas de pescado, leches y otros enlatados. La señora Dona tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, es muy activa, dirige un comité de damas de la hermandad del Señor de los Milagros, es muy amigable, lo cual le permite hacer clientela para la venta de sus cosméticos y lencería fina. En el futuro desea tener una tienda de lencería, regalos y mercería.

loans.use: Purchase various groceries and cosmetics

loans.name: Virginia Socorro

texts.es:
Virgina is a member of “Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas”. She lives at Jr. Urubamba 763, Calleria District, Province of Ucayali. She’s 50 years old and has 3 children, one of whom still lives with her and is the object of her adoration. Her husband is a driver, but his salary doesn’t cover their cost of living. That’s why Virginia invested in the sale of hardware with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles ($100US).

Currenlty, she sells hardware in her home and other places. She also sells other hardware items and she’s thinking about having her own hardware store in the future, God willing and with much effort. She told us that she will persevere because she who is persistent, perseveres. Every day she wakes up early to attend to her husband and son and then goes out to sell her products. In the afternoon, she attends her business at home and in the evening she’s with family.

With the current loan she’s received from Manuela Ramos of 2,600 soles ($870US approx.), which will be paid back in 5 months, she’ll buy 10 kilos of nails, 1 dozen hammers, half a dozen pliers, 20 iron pieces, half a dozen inner tube removers and other smaller items.

Virginia tells us that Manuela Ramos is the best for loans because thanks to her the business came to fruition. She and her family feel happy and are always giving thanks to our Lord for all things afforded them.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevas Amigas, vive en el Jr Urubamba 763, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 50 años D. edad y es madre D. 3 hijos, solo uno está con ella y es su adoración. Su esposo es chofer (transportista), pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos familiares, es así que Virginia, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) deciD. invertir en la venta D. fierros.

En la actualidad ella desarrolla esta actividad en su domicilio, pero también venD. a otras partes. También venD. algunos materiales D. ferretería y piensa poner su propia ferretería, mas adelante si Dios quiere y con mucho esfuerzo. Nos dijo que lo logrará porque el que es perseverante lo logra. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender a su esposo e hijo y luego sale a ofrecer sus productos, en las tarD. atienD. en su casa y en la noche la pasa con su familia.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,600, (US$ 870.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará D. 10 kilos D. clavos, 1 docena D. martillo, ½ docena D. alicates, 20 unidades D. fierros, ½ docena D. paquetes D. llaves para desarmar llantas y otros materiales mas pequeños.

Virginia nos dijo que Manuela Ramos es lo máximo con los préstamos porque gracias a ellos su negocio surgió. Ella se siente feliz y su familia también y siempre dando gracias a nuestro Señor por todas las cosas brindadas.

loans.use: To buy hardware items.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz is a lovely 23-year-old mother. A few months ago, she decided to leave her hometown of Sandia and relocate to the city of Juliaca. Since then, she has worked in a bakery and as a carpentry assistant in order to obtain the financial resources necessary to provide her 1-year-old daughter, Zayumí, with well-being and comfort. In the home she was renting she met Vicki, a joyful and friendly woman who taught her how to create beautiful macramé handiwork. She is using her spare time to undertake this activity with great patience and dedication. It is allowing her to earn the extra money she needs to provide for her young daughter. Mary Luz would like to create her handiwork in large quantities, but this requires more raw materials. For this reason she is seeking your support by requesting a loan and investing in the life of this young and entrepreneurial mother.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer

Mary Luz es una amorosa madre de 23 años de edad, hace algunos meses decidió salir de su pueblo natal Sandia y radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde entonces estuvo trabajando en una panadería y apoyando en una carpintería con el propósito de obtener recursos económicos para ofrecerle bienestar y comodidad a su pequeña niña Zayumí de 1 año de edad.En el domicilio que alquilada conoció a la señora Vicki mujer muy alegre y amable que le enseñó a realizar hermosos trabajos de manualidades en macramé, esta actividad que desempeña en sus horas libres con suma paciencia y dedicación le está permitiendo obtener ingresos económicos extras e indispensable para el bienestar de su pequeña hija.El deseo de Mary Luz es realizar estos trabajos en grandes cantidades, para eso requiere obtener materia prima, con ese fin recurre a tu generosidad y hace la petición de un préstamo que será invertido en las manos de esta joven y emprendedora madre.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase raw materials for creating a larger quantity of her beautiful handiwork

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: B. Dilorom is 37 years old and  lives in the B.Gafurov region. She is married and has 2 children. Mrs. Dilorom has cancer but she is full of enthusiasm and is ready to work hard to ensure that her children have a happy future. She is engaged in a family livestock business where she makes and sells sour milk products.  Now Mrs. Dilorom requests a loan of 3500 TJS ($1,025USD) to purchase supplies and equipment necessary to open a trade outlet for her sour milk products.

loans.use: Open a trade outlet to sell sour milk products

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Delia Hernández is a married mother of a 7-year-old son. Her husband works as a crane operator. Looking for an additional source of income, she started selling shoes by catalogue a year ago. Little by little, her clientele has been increasing, which is why she now needs a loan in order to purchase more merchandise.

She needs $300.00 USD, which she is willing to repay in 3 months. With your help, Alma and her family will be able to aspire to obtain a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Delia Hernández es una mujer casada con un hijo de 7 años, su esposo trabaja como operador de grúa y hace 1 año buscando una fuente de ingresos adicional para su hogar empezó a vender calzado por catalogo entre sus amistades poco a poco se fue haciendo de mas clientes, es por esto que requiere un crédito para comprar mercancía.

Ella necesita US $300, cantidad que esta dispuesta a pagar en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda Alma y su familia podrán aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Celina Armando

texts.en:
Celina is a beautiful, lively, and hard-working 27-year-old woman, originally from the capital city Maputo. She finished primary school in Maputo and didn’t attend secondary school because she got married.

Celina comes from a wealthier family than her husband; her father is a good carpenter in Maputo and always gave comfort to his family. Celina faced a lot of prejudice from her family when she decided to get married to a man who had no financial conditions at all, but she knew he was the right one. They have been married for 13 years now and today Celina’s family loves him. They have 3 children: a 10-year-old girl, a 7-year-old boy and a 4-year-old boy.
