The 2 oldest attend primary school and the youngest go to kindergarten.

Celina and her husband moved to Ponta D’Ouro, a village bordering South Africa very famous for tourism, for 2 years, but moved back to Maputo when she found a better job. In 2001 her husband found a job in a hotel in Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland, so she moved there as well and started to work at the same hotel in the laundry department. In 2005 her husband was fired and moved back to Ponta D’Ouro to work at a hotel there, but Celina decided to stay in Namaacha as her work was doing very well. She earns a minimum wage salary per month, in 2001 it was Mozambique Metical (MZN)850 and today it is MZN1,600. She works either between 6:00 am to 2:00 pm, or between 2:00 pm to 10:00 pm, and she has a cousin who stays home with the kids. The cousin is 19 years old and attends secondary school in the morning as well. On top of that income, Celina’s husband sends her MZN3,000 monthly, helping with the household expenses and with their project of building a house.

This will be Celina’s first loan. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is a client and decided to ask for a loan to buy more construction material and speed up the construction. With this loan, Celina will be able to finish the 2 rooms (including roofing), will move there and stop paying the current MZN500 per month in rent. It will still be necessary to finish the living room and kitchen, but Celina is extremely positive that she will be able to do it in 2 more loans.

In the future, Celina would like to build a small grocery shop or a bakery near her house to have a business to leave for her children. She dreams of giving her children the same luxury she had when she was a kid, and with her strength she will definitely succeed.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Edi

texts.id:
Edi B. today lives in Wibisana Barat street Denpasar with his wife Nur Yatim. He is in this buying and selling used items business since 2003. He usually collects used items 2X/day. Early in the morning strating at 6:00 AM, and evenings starting at 16:00. His operation route are around Gunung Agung street Denpasar and near terminal Ubung. The assortment of collected items include beverage cans, mineral water bottles and used newspaper. Package goods and cartons he usually buys from shops in Denpasar. From his profits he is saving to prepare for his first child's upcoming birth.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Edi B. saat ini tinggal di Jl.Wibisana Barat Denpasar bersama Nur Yatim istrinya. Dia sudah menekuni usaha jual beli barang bekas sejak tahun 2003. Ia biasanya mencari barang bekas 2 kali sehari. Pagi hari Ia berangkat jam 06.00 dan sore Ia berangkat jam 16.00. Jalur yang biasa ditempuh adalah sekitaran Jl.Gunung Agung Denpasar dan dekat terminal Ubung. Adapun jenis barang yang dikumpulkan adalah kaleng minuman, gelas air mineral dan koran-koran bekas. Dos atau kardus biasanya dia beli dari toko-toko di Denpasar. Dari keuntungan yang dia dapat, bisa disisihkan sebagai persiapan bagi kelahiran anak pertamanya.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en: Elsy S. sells provisions and runs a restaurant. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Elsy and their four children. Demand for her goods is high, so she is seeking a loan of $475 to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva is a businesswoman who sells eggs and cooking oil in bulk. She has a store in the Tejar zone of La Paz, her husband is an accounting instructor in the private schools. These activities are their sources of income which help them cover the costs of raising their two small children. The family lives in the Alto Tejar zone of La Paz. The loan requested will be used to increase Elva's merchandise (eggs and cooking oil) in order to generate better income for her family. This is her second loan with Impro, who determined that she qualifies for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Elva es comercializadora al detalle de huevos y aceite comestible a granel; ella tiene su tienda en la Zona Tejar de la Ciudad de La Paz, su esposo es docente de Contabilidad en los Institutos privados. Esas actividades son sus fuentes de ingreso con los que cubren la manutención de sus dos pequeños hijos. La familia vive en la Zona Alto Tejar de la Misma Ciudad. El crédito lo destinará a incrementar su mercadería (huevos y aceite)para de esa forma generar mayor ingresos familiares. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Elva.

loans.use: Purchase of larger quantities of eggs and cooking oil in bulk, which are products that she sells.

loans.name: Sinignèsigui (Foresight) Group

texts.fr:
Sinignesigui is a group of four women from the Zogofina village of the Ségou prefecture (fourth economic region of the Republic of Mali) who are 39 years old on average. Married and mothers of at least 4 children each, they all live in traditional polygamist families with the in-laws, and generally co-spouses, their children, their husbands, and brothers and sisters. Having known each other for about a decade tied by professional, familial, and marital relationships, these women sell farm produce, seasonings, firewood, and various other items. In their desire to grow their business, the members decided to participate in Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program, which they have been doing for two years. They have already received three group loans, all of which have been properly repaid. With this new loan, they plan to buy 14 bags of peanuts, 16 loads of firewood, and a large quantity of seasonings. They stock up on seasonings at the big market in the city of Ségou (especially on market days) from people from Bamako et Sikasso, on peanuts from farmers from Konodimini, on firewood in villages with those who have wood-chopping permits (i.e., in Chola and in Bounoubougoula). The Sinignesigui group sells the items at their homes, traveling in the neighborhoods of the city of Ségou, and in neighboring village markets for cash or credit to a clientele that consists primarily of retailers and women. They hope to earn 26,000 CFA francs per month on average, which will be used to make loan payments, the rest of which will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Sinignesigui est un regroupement de quatre femmes du village de Zogofina de la préfecture de Ségou (quatrième région économique de la république du Mali) qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants chacune, elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames traditionnelles avec les beaux parents, généralement des coépouses, les enfants, leurs maris et des frères et soeurs. Se connaissant depuis une dizaine d’années car liées par des relations professionnelle, de parenté et de mariage, ces femmes font le commerce de produits agricoles de condiments du bois de chauffe et divers autres articles. Dans leur souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans. Elles ont bénéficié déjà de trois prêts de groupe, tous correctement remboursés. Avec ce nouveau prêt elles comptent acheter, 14 sacs d’arachide, 16 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe et une grande quantité de condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent, en condiments au grand marché de la ville de Ségou (surtout les jours de foire) auprès des forains venant de Bamako et Sikasso, en arachide auprès des paysans producteurs de Konodimini, en bois de chauffe dans les villages avec des paysans ayant une autorisation de coupe de bois (comme à Chola et à Bounoubougoula) Les produits des membres du groupe Sinignesigui sont vendus sur place à domicile, dans les quartiers la ville de Ségou de façon ambulante et les marchés des villages voisins au comptant en détail souvent à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de revendeurs et de femmes. Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26. 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt investir le reste dans les affaires.

loans.use: To purchase seasonings, firewood, and peanuts

loans.name: Mrs. Nuon Ret Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nuon R. is the group leader of four who live in Phum Thmei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Nuon R. is a farmer and she will use the loan to purchase fertilizers to support her plantation because her rice field now has infertile soil. Besides this business, she also sews palm leaves together to process into thatches to sell. Mrs. Nuon R. is a 56-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver who can generate $3 per day. The other one, 16, is attending the local school. 

Four members have end-of-term loans and these members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her plantation.

loans.name: Sharon Maria Patricia

texts.es:
Sharon se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 2 años, se inicio en esta actividad por que una compañera vendía en el lugar donde laboraban, ella se retiro del lugar y muchas compañeras se quedaron sin su proveedora, entonces vio la posibilidad de emprender su negocio, invirtió sus ahorros en mercancía y poco a poco esta creciendo su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer y así incrementar sus ventas. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Sharon has been selling shoes for 2 years. She started this activity because a partner who retired, was selling the products where they were working. A lot of other partners were left with out their provider. Then, she saw the possibility of starting her own business. She invested her savings in goods and little by little she is making the business grow.

She needs a loan of $200, which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, to have a bigger variety of products to offer and this way increase her sales. With your support she will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Serey

texts.en:
Mrs. Serey P. is 34 years old and lives with her mother. Three nephews and two nieces, four of them working in factories, while another studies, also share the same house. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Serey has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to a trader in the village, who then sells her products at a market in Phnom Penh. Her mother is 70 years old and assists her with spinning threads. Serey is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Mrs. Yann N., a 48-year-old rice farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province, is the mother of five children; one is married and another is a waitress at a guesthouse. Her husband, Mr. Souv Kong, 44, has been a rice farmer since 1979.

To earn additional income, Yann is applying for a loan of $250 to purchase piglets to raise in her home. The increased family income resulting from this loan will help them sustain their financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Juana Lucila

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Universo (Universe) Village Bank.  She is 50 years old, married, and has four children. Juana sells sweets from a cart in the bus terminal of a local transportation company. She works seven days a week. She also cleans and takes care of the terminal in exchange for the right to sell her products insiD.. Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy soda, cookies, and caramels. Her dreams are to improve her home, to have a store of her own in a fixed location, and for her children to grow up to be working professionals. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Universo. 
Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Juana venD. golosinas en el terminal terrestre D. una empresa D. transportes, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta, actividad que realiza todos los días. Juana además realiza la limpieza y cuidado del terminal a cambio D. vender sus productos. 
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas, galletas y caramelos. 
Los sueños D. Juana son mejorar su casa, tener una tienda estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buy soda, cookies, and caramels

loans.name: Yatim

texts.ru: Ашуров Ятим житель района Ваорзоб.Возраст 56 лет,женат ,имеет 9 детей.Образование среднее.Клиент занимается животноводством.Клиент покупает на рынке молодых телят и откармливает их в течении 45 дней.После чего продает их на рынке.На доход от этой деятельности содержит свою семью.На полученный кредит хочет купить очередного бычка.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Yatim A. is a resident of the Varzob region. He is 56 years old, is married and has 9 children. He has a secondary education. The client raises livestock. He purchases young calves at the market and raises them for 45 days. After this he sells them at the market. He uses the earnings from this business to support his family. Yatim will use his loan to purchase another calf. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Maximina C. H., tiene 73 años, vive en la Urb.  La Rinconada, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no estudio debido a que sus padres no la enviaron a la escuela, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella.
Maria se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y panca durante casi 25 años, al principio empezó vendiendo pan y alfalfa poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientela y amplio su negocio con la venta de panca, negocio que hasta ahora desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas II”, lo invirtió en la compra de alfalfa y panca para su negocio.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de alfalfa y panca.
Maria sueña con tener en su casa una tienda de abarrotes. 
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Maria Maximina C. H. is 73 years old and lives in La Rinconada, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, in Perú. She didn't study, owing to the fact that her parents didn't send her to school. She has 5 children, none of whom depend on her. Maria has been selling alfalfa and chilies for 25 years. At the beginning she started selling bread and alfalfa, and little by little began getting clients. She expanded her business with the sale of panca chili, a business which until now she has operated from her own house. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from her communal bank, 'Mujeres Decididas II' (Determined Women II), she invested it in buying alfalfa and panca chillies for her business. With this loan of 800 soles, which she will pay back within 4 months, she will invest it in buying alfalfa and panca chillies. Maria dreams of having a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alfalfa and chillies to sell

loans.name: Zokhrab

texts.en: Zokhrab, 37, lives in Khachmaz town, where he is the married father of one child. Four years ago he started a taxi business and is now requesting a loan of 1500 AZN to buy spare parts and repair his car to improve the business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair his car.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Мардонова Раъно жительница района Шахринау. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 56 лет .Уже 15 лет занимается бизнесом в сфере услуг. Работает в столовой. Ее столовая находится в центре района. Кредит решила получить для того, чтобы закупить инвентарь. Таким образом она сможет улучшить условия работы и качество обслуживания. Этим она привлечет новых клиентов , что даст возможность заработать больше. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rano M. lives in the Shahrinav district. She is 56 years old, married and has four children. She has been in the service industry for 15 years and works at a cafeteria. Her cafeteria is located in the center of the district. Rano decided to obtain a loan in order to purchase additional inventory. This will allow her to improve work conditions and service quality. As a result, she could attract new customers and earn more money. She can repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Дусматов Рустам житель района Шахринау. Возраст 48 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. В центре района имеет столовую. Столовая функционирует уже 8 лет. Сейчас Рустам планирует получить кредит и поменять инвентарь , что даст возможность изменить и улучшить условия работы, а так же улучшить качество обслуживания.
texts.en:
Rustam D. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 48 years old, married and has three children. He owns a cafeteria in the district center. The cafeteria has been in business for 8 years. Currently, Rustam plans to obtain a loan and update his inventory, which will enable him to change and improve work conditions and improve service quality.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Shabana Samulean Masih Group

texts.en:
Shabana is a wife of S. M. who lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past eight years. Her husband is a driver with three years experience. He drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shabana operates a sewing clothes business. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because its engine needs to be repaired.

Shabana is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shaheen wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Ulfat wants a loan to buy chickens for her butcher shop. Zareena wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Yasmeen wants a loan to buy fruit to sell.

This is a group loan that will be distributed among members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee the entire loan. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Abla's Group

texts.fr: Cette  association  a été crée en  1999 par  3 femmes mariées toutes dynamiques, l’une d’entre elles fait comme activité le commerce de céréales, les 2 autres vendent des produits d’alimentation générale. Le revenu issu de leur activité leur permet de réaliser des œuvres sociales et d’aider beaucoup de femmes de leur quartier. Elles veulent agrandir leurs activités pour mieux vendre et réaliser plus de bénéfices. Elle sollicite alors de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter, des céréales et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This association was created in 1999 by three energetic married women. One of them sells cereals; the two others sell groceries. The income from their businesses permits them to take on charitable work and to help lots of women from their neighborhood. They want to expand their activities so as to make more sales and thus more profit. They are asking WAGES for their first loan to buy cereals and various grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of items for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo
Carmen  es casada tiene 41 años, tres hijos de 23, 19 y el ultimo de 6 años que esta en la escuela estatal.
Carmen  por años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo  y ahora  esta trabajando  en una panadería que su hermano ha abierto, ella se encarga de administrar ver todo lo que falta.  
Desde que Carmen esta en Finca aprendió a desenvolverse, ha expresar lo que siente por que era muy callada.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de una vitrina y compra productos de belleza.
El sueño de Carmen es ver su casa terminada con acabados.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank San Judas Tadeo. Carmen is married, 41 years old, and has 3 children ages 23, 19, and the last who is 6 years old is in the state school. For years Carmen has dedicated herself to sale of beauty products through a catalog, and now is also working in a bakery that her brother has opened; she is in charge of managing to ensure that nothing is lacking. Since Carmen has been with Finca she has learned to come out of her shell and to express what she feels because she was a very quite person. Carmen needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase a display case and beauty products. Carmen dreams of seeing her home completely finished.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case and beauty products.

loans.name: Yamileth Eneyda

texts.es: Yamileth Eneyda V. L.  reside en el cantón La Loma ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Yamileth vive  con sus padres y su pequeña hija. Yamileth se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y producción de leche de vaca. Yamileth posee un ambiente ideal para la crianza de su ganado bovino y porcino ya que es un terreno al aire libre con un buen pasto el cual asegura una buena alimentación al ganado, Yamileth solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en ganado para incrementar su volumen de producción en los productos que se derivan de los mismos.
texts.en:
Yamileth Eneyda V. L. lives in the La Loma District of Cuscatlán. Yamileth lives with her parents and her young daughter.
Yamileth works in milk production and raises pigs. Yamileth’s open-air pasture is the ideal environment to raise cattle and pigs and ensures that they are well fed.
Yamileth is requesting a loan to purchase livestock in order to increase production of her cow- and pig-derived products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle and pigs

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 7 hijos.  Tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en el Centro Poblado de Rosa Cani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor (ovinos) para engorde.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y darles educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia, belongs to the Communal Bank "Manuela of Today" which is located in the district of Llave, Province of El Collao, Puno Department. She is 46 years old, married and a mother of 7 children. She has completed primary school and lives in the town of Rosa Cani. She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos group for 5 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S /. 300.00 , which she used for the purchase of small livestock. At this time she requires a loan of S /. 500.00 new soles for the purchase of small livestock - (sheep) for fattening. Her desire is to continue working and to provide her children with an education. She enjoys the savings and meetings of community banks.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’adidogomé où elle réside avec son mari et ses 04 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. Elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local d’adidogomé. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, elle veut augmenter son stock et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes «hi-target » et 10 pièces de pagnes « soso ».
texts.en:
This woman lives in the district of Adidogomé with her husband and four children. She is earning an income by selling colourful traditional fabrics called "pagnes". She runs her business in a local market in Adidogomé. Her clientele is increasing every day and she would like to increase her stock. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 15 pieces of "Hi-Target" brand fabric and 10 pieces of "Soso" brand fabric.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Masan Kossiwa A.

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la couture, mais elle n’a pas trouvé les moyens pour ouvrir un atelier. Pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 03 enfants, elle a décidé en 2007 de se lancer dans le commerce de pagnes dans son quartier à Agoè Nyivé. Elle a désormais une clientèle qui lui est fidèle. Pour avoir un nouveau stock, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 15 paires de pagnes Hitarget, 10 paires de pagnes Phoenix et 30 paires de pagnes Java.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned how to sew, but she hasn't found the means to open a workshop.  To help her husband support their three children, she decided to launch a business selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in 2007 in her district of Agoè Nyivé.  She now has a loyal customer base.  She is requesting a WAGES loan to buy 15 pairs of Hitarget pagnes, 10 pairs of Phoenix, and 30 pairs of Java.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gasoline and motor oil in bulk

loans.name: God's Gift Group

texts.en:
God’s Gift is a group of 5 borrowers led by James K.B. W.. James is 42 years old and married. His 6 children are 2-9 years old. The range of grades they are enrolled in is from nursery school to third grade. James also cares for 4 siblings.

James is a 10th grade drop-out due to lack of support. He lives in the West Point community in southern downtown Monrovia, Liberia. West Point is a community that is very crowded and is also filled with people who can’t afford a daily meal.

James’s business is selling dry goods like rice, farina, dishes, sugar, and the like. He started this business over 5 years ago with his retirement funds. In Liberia, retirement funds are like a peanut, because they can’t take care of a whole family for 2 months, so James decided to use it to open a small-to-medium business. Today, his business feeds his family.

Because James lives in a community that is home to many fishermen, he sells things that fishermen need. He has been doing well, since most of his customers are those same fishermen. James needs this loan to purchase more dry goods so that he can continue to serve his customers. 

James hopes to become a successful businessman in the field of importation. His dreams include building his own house in a better environment and sending his children to a better school.

loans.use: Purchase more dry goods that can serve the fishermen.

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Cette s’est spécialisée dans la vente de pagnes de qualité, en particulier les basins du Mali. Elle exerce ce commerce dans sa maison située dans le quartier d’Agoè - Sorad à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un conducteur de taxi, mais le couple n’a aucun enfant. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2000. Beaucoup de clients font confiance dans la qualité de ses pagnes ; elle commande en effet ses pagnes du Mali, car ils sont faits dans des tissus de qualité. Des femmes revendeuses ambulantes de basins viennent s’approvisionner le plus souvent chez elle. Actuellement elle est presque en rupture de stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 35 pièces de basins.

loans.use: Achat de basins de qualité

loans.name: Olanitan

texts.en: Olanitan is 30 years old and married with two children. He has been selling cement for years. He uses part of the profit for family upkeep and invests the remaining profit in his business. He lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 naira to purchase more cement to sell. He says God bless Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase cement to sell

loans.name: Cosme

texts.en: Cosme C. is from the village of Toril, Panalsalan. He is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Cosme owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty-five years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Cosme joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Cosme is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 5th from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: A. Rahima is 49 years old. She is married and the mother of three adorable children. Rahima has a grocery store which she tends to herself, in addition to caring for her family and her home. She started her small business 8 years ago with financial support from her husband who has been selling spare parts for automobiles for some time. Her reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business she requests for a loan of 5000 Somoni. Rahima is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods to sell thus increasing her variety of merchandise. She thanks everybody who decided to support her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Bikamwa Plus Group

texts.en:
Yvon P., age 44, is the leader of the “Bikamwa Plus” community bank, which is composed of 28 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through HOPE RDC to develop their businesses. Yvon is married and has three children between 1 and 11 years old. Only one goes to school.

Yvon started his business in 1990 with $50 of initial capital. He manages his business in the western part of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of HOPE RDC who has already received four different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to buy three 25 kgs/cartons of meat to resell so he can increase his profits. Each day, his business brings in a profit of $5. 

His ambition is to open a cold storage facility.

loans.use: To purchase three 25 kgs/cartons of meat to resell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia G. is from the village of Olingan. She is 61 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Virginia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP average per month. In 2006, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies, and as additional capital for her other business which is selling fish. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies and to use as additional capital for selling fish

loans.name: Marina Enriqueta

texts.es:
Marina S. es una dama muy trabajadora que vive en el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León donde tiene 21 largos años de laborar como maestra en un colegio del municipio con el fin de obtener el ingreso para invertirlo en la remodelación de su vivienda ya que así lo necesita y debe llevarlo a cabo para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto ama. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción.
Es importante destacar que esta remodelación la llevará a cabo para cumplir sus sueños de brindarle a su pequeña hija excelentes condiciones para vivir y que tenga un techo digno donde desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Marina S. is a very hard-working woman. She lives in the municipality of El Sauce, León department, where for 21 long years she has worked as a teacher in a municipal college with the purpose of obtaining money to invest in the remodelling of her house. She requires the money to bestow better living conditions on her family, who she loves so much. She is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials. It is important to emphasise that Marina will take this remodelling project to completion, to realise her dreams of giving excellent living conditions to her little daughter and a dignified roof over her head where she can develop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sandra Katherine

texts.es:
Sandra V. de 32 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo que tiene 1 año.

Sandra empezó con un capital que había estado ahorrando, una vez que tuvo el capital necesario compro unas vitrinas con algunos productos de papelería.

Sandra ahora trabaja todos los días de 08h00 hasta las 20h00, ella vende la resma de hoja a $ 3.5, las plumas a $ 0.15, el pliego de cartulina a $ 0.3. El promedio de clientes que ella atiende diario es de 68 personas. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia del sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hojas, plumas, cartulina y otros artículos para la papelería. En el futuro quiere adecuar mejor su casa para poder trasladar su negocio y así tener más tiempo para su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra V., 32, lives in a periurban zone along Guayaquil's beltway. Her house is cement and has all the basic utilities. She is a single mother of a one-year-old son. Sandra started off with her own savings, which she used to buy some display cases and some stationery supplies. Sandra now works every day from 8am until 8pm. She sells a ream of paper for $3.5, pens at $0.15, a sheet of construction paper at $0.3. She sees about 68 customers per day on average. One of the difficulties she faces is the high crime rate in her area. She will use the funding to buy paper, pens, construction paper and other stationery items. In the future, she would like to equip her house so that she can move her business there in order to have more time with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Writing paper, pens, construction paper.

loans.name: Mourad

texts.en: M. is a 39-year old single man living with his mother and two brothers. He has worked as a house painter since 1992. Working on a freelance basis, he manages part of the housing projects in his town and its surroundings. With the help of the $1,000 loan he requested, he managed to expand his business by buying tools and a compressor to offer a better quality of service to his clients.

loans.use: to buy tools and a compressor

loans.name: Mr. Lun You Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This loan is a village bank loan, which consists of 14 borrowers who are located in Rean Thma village in Kandal province.  They all will use the loan, but each will use their money for different purposes.

Mr. Lun Y. is the village bank's president who has been selected by the bank's members. His wife, Mrs. Pot Samang, is a Chinese noodle seller. Mr. Lun Y. is the father of a child who is a garment worker.

Mr. Lun Y. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land one which he cultivates rice to make a living.  Since his rice farming is far from an irrigation system, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump so he can irrigate his crop.

loans.use: To buy a water pump with which to irrigate a rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business goods and to paint her house

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ran N. is from Samphli village in the TaK. province. She is 54 years old and serves as group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by AMK. Each member of the group loan will use it to support different purposes.  
      
Mrs. Ran N. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field and cultivates rice to earn a living for the family. On this farm, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farm crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for farm labor. Her husband, Mr. Chhon Tep, is a police officer and receives a small salary to support his family. 

Mrs. Ran N. is a mother of a child who is a farmer helping support her farm. Mr. Sith Vorng, who is a group guarantor, is also present in the village bank loan photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. est une femme âgée de 24 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 5 ans et a eu 10 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter une dizaine de moutons, les engraisser pour ensuite les revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maguette D. is a 24-year-old woman, she is married and a mother responsible for three children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” of Keur Ngalgou for five years. She has had ten great experiences with borrowing. She fattens up sheep. Her new loan will enable her to buy about ten sheep, fatten them up to then resell them at the weekly markets in her area. Her goal is to help her husband in providing for the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her cattle sales activity

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
K. Rahima is 33 years old. She is married and has four children. Her family lives in Shahrituz, Southern Tajikistan. Rahima sells clothes for men, and has been in this trade for many years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. 

Rahima is hoping to take out a loan of $800 to increase the variety of inventory in her store and keep her business running successfully. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La joven Dina habitante de colonia Talolinga, desde  su pequeñez se ha dedicado ala actividad pecuaria junto a su familia ya que ella viene de una familia campesina, actualmente esta laborando como docente de primaria en la Escuela Rafael Salmeron en colonia Talolinga, solicita este financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcciòn y asi construir una habitacion, el cual la ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida en el hogar.                                                                                                          

Dina es una joven que todavia no tiene hijos su esposo se encuentra en Costa Rica Trabajando para asi mejorar sus condciones de vida,  ella vive con su ancianita madre a la cual la ayuda con los gastos del hogar, es una joven con muchos deseos de superacion, espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA, según referencias de su comunidad la consideran por ser responsable,  honesta y de buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Dina is a young lady who lives in the Talolinga neighborhood. Since she was small, she has worked together with her family in livestock raising since she comes from a rural family. Currently she is working as a primary school teacher in the Rafael Salmeron School in the Talolinga neighborhood. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials to be able to build a house. This will improve her standard of living. Dina is young and doesn't have children yet. Her husband is working in Costa Rica to improve their living conditions. She lives with her elderly mother who she helps with the household expenses. She is a young lady with many goals of getting ahead and she hopes to receive a loan from KIVA. According to what people say about her in her community, she is responsible, honest and has good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of her group Amor y Esperanza (Love and Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo, where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their five children.

Yolanda is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing by purchasing a packet of used clothing that comes from places like the salvation army in the US. She will use the profits to purchase construction materials to finish construction on her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: A packet of used clothing

loans.name: Niolie

texts.en:
Niolie V. is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: Videoke business, Computer games and running a general store. She lives in Prk. Tuburan, Brgy. Malingin, Bago City, Negros Occidental.  

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now eans an average income of PHP12,000. 

Niolie is borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can buy more inventory for her store. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Niolie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es separada y vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Copacabana ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Flora es rentista y produce tortas y masitas en una tienda en su zona, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la ampliación de una habitación de su vivienda.
Esta es la cuarta  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Flora is separated and lives in her own home in the neighborhood of Villa Copacabana on the west side of the city of La Paz. Flora is a pensioner and she makes tortas (sandwiches) and pastries in a shop in her neighborhood. She lives off of this income. She's requesting a loan for the expansion of a room in her house. This is the fourth occasion on which she's asked for a loan, and a socioeconomic analysis has deemed her qualified to access the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en el sector Atusparias del distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito con mayor población D. la región, considerado como el distrito con mayores indices D. pobreza, la mayor parte D. su población se encuentra situada en zonas urbano – marginales. Se encuentra ubicado próximo a la ciudad D. Chiclayo, a diez minutos D. su plaza D. armas.

Se dedica a la venta D. comida dentro del mercado D. su localidad, ella cuenta con un puesto dentro D. este centro D. abasto donD. ofrece a sus clientes diversos platos D. comida, el negocio goza D. buena acogida en la zona debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando allí, al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus productos. Con los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Felicita desea mejorar la infraestructura D. su negocio adquirirendo mobiliario y algunos utensilios, D. modo que sus clientes se encuentren cómodos al momento D. consumir los alimentos que prepara, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Felicita es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Todos los dias se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante su negocio, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una buena calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Felicita, 45, is married and has two children living at home. She lives in the Peruvian district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, the most populous district in the region and the one with the highest incidence of poverty. The majority of the district's people live in or around urban areas. Felicita lives near the city of Chiclayo, ten minutes from the city's main square. Felicita operates a food business at a local market. She has a stand at the market where she sells a variety of dishes to her customers. The business is popular because her dishes are well prepared, she charges a fair price and she works when she can count on the most traffic. She uses the income from the business to help her husband with the family's expenses. Felicita wants to improve her business by buying furniture and a few utensils that will help her customers eat at the stand more comfortably. For that purpose, she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 new-soles, her first loan from the bank. Felicita is a hard-working, responsible woman. She works as hard as she can every day to make the business a success, always with the goal of giving her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to food business.

loans.name: Betheljane

texts.en:
Betheljane O. is from the village of Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 19 years old. Betheljane is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Betheljane owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Betheljane has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Betheljane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betheljane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Betheljane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros V. is a widow with one son who has full-time employment. She lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Ros is a farmer who also raises ducks at home. She buys baby ducklings and raises them until they grow big enough to lay eggs. She sells the duck eggs in Phnom Penh City. Ros wants to expand her business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional ducks to raise.

loans.use: To use for raising duck.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old. Josephine is married and has thre school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is from the village of Canubay, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Oliva is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Oliva owns & operates a sari-sari store. Oliva has been doing this business for about three months and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for this activity. In 2004, Oliva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oliva has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC of 4,000 PHP. Oliva is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for her sari-sari store. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Oliva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo F. is from the village of Bigaan, Mabini. He is 52 years old, widowed and has 1 school-aged child. Guillermo owns and operates a business raising hogs to sell. Guillermo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Guillermo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillermo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for his business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Guillermo from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for hog raising

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo, de 36 años, vive en casa de su madre, en compañía de ella, sus hermanas, su esposo Fredy de 42 años que es chofer y sus 2 pequeños hijos; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. A partir de muy joven, esta emprendedora mujer se dedicó a trabajar en busca de un futuro mejor; y siempre ayudo a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Desde hace 1 año empezó a estudiar cosmetología, y hace 6 meses empezó a trabajar en lo que aprendió que es cortar el cabello, hacer peinados y también maquillar los rostros de las damas. Aunque solo atiende a conocidas y amigas tiene mucha ilusión de instalar en el futuro su propio salón de belleza; además dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le permite ofrecer el servicio en la tranquilidad de su casa, pues sus clientes la visitan ya que ella tiene casi todos los implementos necesarios para brindarles un buen servicio a un precio módico. Como si fuera poco paralelamente también lava ropa a sus vecinos que le pagan regularmente por sus servicios. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar con su negocio; también manifiesta  que le gusta mucho el trabajo de los miembros de su grupo porque todos son trabajadores y emprendedores al igual que ella. Consuelo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una secadora y otros implementos como cosméticos que le hacen falta para seguir ofreciéndoles el cómodo servicio de corte de cabello y maquillaje a sus clientes, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en: Consuelo, 36-years-old, lives in her mother's house with her mother, her sisters, and her husband, Fredy (42-years-old), who's a chauffeur, and their two small children. Everyday they work together to get ahead. From a young age this hardworking woman has worked hard in search of a better future, and she's always helped her husband with the constant home expenses. One year ago she began studying cosmetology; six months ago she began working as a barber/stylist and makeup artist. Even though she currently only services friends and acquaintances, she hopes to open her own beauty salon one day. She says that she likes her work a lot because it allows her to offer her services in the comfort of her own home. Her customers visit her because she has nearly all of the necessary tools to offer them a good service at a reasonable price. She also does laundry for her neighbors, who pay her regularly for her services. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually because she doesn't want to upset the people who have made the loan possible that will permit her to continue her business. She would also like to say that she likes the work of her group members because they're all very hard working and enterprising, just like her. Consuelo plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a hair dryer and other cosmetic implements that she needs to continue offering her comfortable beauty service to her clients; she hopes to keep progressing in that direction.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryer and cosmetics to offer a good service

loans.name: Kely Aurora

texts.es:
KELY AURORA DIA N.
La señora Kelly  socia del banco comunal  luchando por nosotras, distrito yarinacocha, departamento Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad casada y un hijo a su cargo, para ayudar a la economía del hogar decidió invertir en la compra de chatarra que es un negocio muy rentable,  en estos tiempos, compra y vende ripio. Y también trabaja junto con su esposo.
Los préstamos que saca cada ciclo los invierte en la compra de ripio y cosas recicladas dependiendo de los meses el ripio llega tener un buen precio y tienen que aprovechar en comprar todo lo que pueda.
La señora Kelly trabaja en su casa y puede estar con su hijo que todavía necesita de sus cuidados.
El ultimo préstamo de s/. 3,000 lo invertirá comprando, 2 volqueta das de ripio y lo demás lo destinara a la compra de chatarra.
La señora Kelly  muestra su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por la confianza a su persona, al otorgarle los crédito,  y también porque tiene la oportunidad de seguir creciendo en sus negocios y le permite estar cerca a su familia.
texts.en:
KELY AURORA DIA N.

Nelly is a member of the “Luchando por Nosotras” (Fighting for Us) communal bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department.  She is 47 years old, married and has a son in her care.  To help support the household’s economy she decided to buy scrap, which is a very profitable business.  Currently she’s a gravel merchant.  She works alongside her husband.

The loans she takes out each cycle are used to buy gravel and recyclables.  Depending on the month, gravel can attain a good price and they have to take advantage of this and buy all they can.

Kelly is able to work from home and care for her son who still needs her attention.

The s/.3, 000 loan will be used to buy two dump truck’s worth of gravel and the rest will be used to buy recyclables.

Kelly is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the trust they have placed in her by granting the loan and because it gives her the opportunity to continue growing in her business while keeping watch over her family.

loans.use: To buy gravel.

loans.name: Burulcha Bakoeva's Group

texts.en:
Burulcha B. is the leader of this group. Burulcha is a resident of Tashkomur. She is 23 years old and married. Her husband earns a living by selling cars. Together they bring up two preschool sons (under seven). A year ago, with an initial investment of 50,000 KGS, Burulcha started to sell women’s clothing. In this way she makes 10,000 KGS per month. She hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to purchase winter clothes for resale. In the future she wants to expand her business and her dream is to open her own store.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes for resale

loans.name: Awoussi Immaculée

texts.fr: Immaculée  a 27 ans. Elle gère comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de pagnes. Elle expose ensuite  ses différentes marchandises à la devanture de sa maison et compte dans cette activité 2 ans. Avec le nouveau crédit, elle espère acheter 100 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en: Immaculée is 27 years old. She makes a living by selling “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabrics]. She displays her wares in front of her home. She has two years of experience. With this new loan, she hopes to buy 100 sets of “pagnes.”

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "pagnes" fabrics

loans.name: Ruth Wangari

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and is married to Joseph, who also contributes to their family income. They have three children. She runs a business selling sand for construction. This is very marketable in Kenya as many people invest in the construction of rental houses. She has been in the business for three years and earns an income of about 15,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

This is her second loan from KADET after successfully repaying her previous loan. She hopes to be a leading sand supplier to give her children a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To acquire more sand for her business.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Doña Salvadora de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo don Pedro en Lolotiquillo departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de pescado y pollo, este negocio en ambulante ella sale a ofrecer los productos por las principales calles de Lolotiquillo, en busca de clientes, este es el ingreso que por su parte recibe y es el que alivia sus necesidades.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pescado fresco y pollo, esta inversión la hará con el objetivo de mantenerse en el negocio, de continuar proveyendo ingresos, ya que estará apoyando a su esposo para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
Sueña con mantener un negocio estable sin la necesidad de caminar por tanto tiempo para poder hacer sus ventas y también a través de las ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Salvadora, 47, lives with her husband Pedro in Lolotiquillo, which is in the department of Morazán.  She is an itinerant vendor of fish and chicken.  She offers her products for sale along the main streets of Lolotiquillo, where she looks for customers.  This is how she earns income to help cover their needs.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy fresh fish and chicken.  She will make this investment with the aim of keeping her business going so that she can continue earning for her family.  She will be supporting her husband to cover their household necessities.

Salvadora dreams of maintaining a stable business without having to spend so much time walking to make her sales.  She also dreams of earning enough to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish and chicken to sell

loans.name: Marta Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña  Marta del Socorro Q. F. trabaja en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería como Conserje desde hace 20 años.
Ella es soltera de 50 años de edad con 3 personas a su cargo. Lleva 3 créditos cancelados en CEPRODEL los cuales ha pagado en tiempo y forma los que ha utilizado para ir mejorando su casa.
Ella utilizará este crédito para compra de Materiales de Construcción.
texts.en:
Ms. Marta del Socorro Q. F. has worked at the National University of Engineering as a custodian for the past 20 years.
She is 50 years old. She is single with 3 dependents. She has paid off 3 loans from CEPRODEL. They have been repaid on time. She has used them to make improvements to her house.
She will use this loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: She requests the loan to buy construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: Maria Félix tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella siempre está pensando en sus hijos y en proporcionarle un ingreso que le ayude para el futuro. Pues ella trabaja todos los días algunas veces su esposo queda a cargo de la pulpería, siempre está pensando la manera de incrementar  su negocio. Para un futuro le gustaría poder tener una buena estabilidad económica. El crédito que solicita es para materia prima invertida en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Félix is 38 years old and has been managing a store for more than three years. She always thinks about her children and providing an income to help provide for their future. Maria works every day, but sometimes her husband is left in charge of the store. She always has plans to increase her business. In the future, she would like to have better financial stability.

The loan she requested will be used to buy merchandise to invest in her business.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in Mianchannu which is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in the area of Muhallah Rehmania with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 20 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her clothes-selling business. She started this business to share the financial burden with her husband who is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his passengers. 

Naseem purchases clothes from the city of Multan which is famous for its clothes and embroidery industry and sells to her local area clients at a profit. With the loan, she will buy clothes in different varieties and in bulk quantities to fulfill customers' demand and to expand her business. 

She has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. Her two elder sons are also associated with their father's driving profession and the remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Naseem is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her and her family’s financial condition will improve.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In her previous loan years, she always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes-selling business

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.ru: Sharafat F. 50 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje. Sharafat yavlyayetsya IDP personom, ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmetse so svoyey drujnoy i lubimoy semyoy. Sharafat uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji kosmetiki,duxi i t.d. Seychas Sharafat nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina dlya toqo chtob pomestit bolshe tovarov.
texts.en: Sharafat F. is fifty years old.  She is married and has two children who go to college.  .  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with close, beloved family. Sharafat has been selling cosmetics, perfume, etc. for seven years now.  Currently, Sharafat needs 2300 AZN to expand her shop in order to offer more products.

loans.use: expand the shop

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Marìa Magdalena de 40 años de edad, con dos hijas mayores de edad las cuales trabajan y estudian ellas asumen sus gastos personales y compromisos de pagos, por lo que doña Magdalena solo asume sus propios gastos, labora como docente de secundaria en la Escuela Francisco Aaaron Joce desde hace 19 años todos los fines de semana, ademàs trabaja para la Alcaldia de Nueva Guinea los dias de Lunes a Viernes como responsables de la Casa de la Adoslecencia es una mujer bien trabajadora que le gusta el progreso y asi ayudar a su linda familia, ella cuenta con la ayuda aconòmica de su compañero de vida ambos asumen los compromisos adquiridos y los gastos basicos del hogar, ya ha sido beneficiada anteriormente con financiamiento de Kiva a quien agradece, pues pudo repellar su casa con este credito.

A la vez pretende seguir mejorando su vivienda;  por lo que solicita nuevamente el apoyo de Kiva con otro credito que requiere para pagar la mano de obra de un albañil que le está  realizando mejoras en su vivienda y para comprar un zinx  que le hace falta.  
Su sueño es que sus hijas tengan su propia vivienda en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Marìa Magdalena is 40 years old, with 2 grown daughters who work and study. They cover their own personal expenses and pay their own bills, so Doña Magdalena only has to cover her own expenses. For 19 years, she has worked as a secondary school teacher at the Francisco Aaron Joce School every weekend. She also works Monday through Friday for the Nueva Guinea town hall as the person responsible for the Casa de la Adolescencia [Adolescents' House]. 

She is a very hardworking woman who likes progress and being able to help her lovely family. She also has economic support from her life partner. They both share the bills and basic household expenses. She has previously benefited from financing from Kiva, which she is grateful for, since this is how she was able to plaster her house. Now she is trying to continue improving her home, so she again requests Kiva's help with another loan. She needs the money to pay a builder who is making improvements to her house and to buy zinc metal sheeting which she lacks. Her dream is for her daughters to have their own homes in good condition.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement work and to buy zinc metal sheeting to put on her house

loans.name: Manuela Maria

texts.es:
Manuela de 54 años, una mujer trabajadora que empozo su actividad vendiendo colas, jugos y poco a poco su tienda se fue variando.

Empieza a laborar de 6h00 a 22h00  diariamente con la ayuda de hijo.  Ella tiene tres hijos mayores de edad uno de ellos le ayuda en la tienda. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite para aumentar sus ventas y obtener más ingresos .Su meta es llegar abastecer su tienda con productos que necesitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuela is 54 years old. She is a hard-working woman who started her business by selling soft drinks and juices, and little by little her store expanded with a greater variety of goods.

She starts work at 6 a.m. and continues until 10 p.m. every day, with the help of her son. She has three grown children, one of whom helps her with the store. With the loan, she would like to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil in order to incraese her sales and obtain a higher income. Her goal is to be able to stock her store with products that her customers need.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and other products for her store

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess B. is 24 years old and married with an infant child. She is from the town of Osmena, Ilagan, Isabela. Princess owns and operates a frozen-food selling business. She has been engaged in her business for almost one year and earns 2,000 PHP a month.

Princess joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make products for sale. This is the first loan taken out by Princess from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 47-year-old married man with five children all below 18 years of age. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a retail shop and a bar and has been in business for four years, after leaving his job as a night watchman. The current fluctuating prices are a big challenge to him and his desire is to become a wholesale trader. John needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 19 y 24 años de edad, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde hace 35 años aprendió de su padre todo el proceso necesario para trabajar la tierra, su horario es de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas, este préstamo le ayudara a tener todos los insumos necesarios antes de iniciar el proceso de siembra, teniendo una mayor seguridad en el cultivo.  
Su objetivo es apoyar a su familia, con los gastos más necesarios, y velar por su bienestar.
texts.en:
Miguel with his wife and their two children, aged 19 and 24. He has been cultivating corn and beans for the past 5 years. He learned from his father the necessary process to work the land. His work schedule is from 6:00am to 3:00pm He requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This loan will help him have all the products he needs before starting the plantation. This will help secure the cultivation. 

His objective is to support his family, to cover the most necessary expenses, and to ensure their wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to use on his farm land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Solmara
