texts.es: La Señorita Solmara  tiene como actividad venta de productos de limpieza y enlatados  (detergentes, lavandinas, desinfectante; como también Aceite, viandadas y pañales para bebes), Su venta es de puerta a puerta y recorre todas las tiendas de su zona, actualmente ella abrirá una tienda para la venta de sus productos en la misma zona donde ella vive, Zona Villa El Carmen, una zona comercial que esta cerca de la cumbre camino a los yungas, su actividad  está muy bien administrada su familia esta compuesta por su mamá quien también trabaja de la misma manera y su hermano menor. Solmara es una persona responsable, agradecida y emprendedora el objetivo del crédito solicitado es el de tener una tienda para ampliar su mercado y compra de mercadería en pañales para bebe, es un apersona con ganas de superacion y de esta manera lograra  salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Solmara engages in selling cleaning products and canned goods (detergents, bleaches, disinfectants, as well as oil, canned meat and baby diapers). She sells door to door visiting every shop of her area. She will soon open a shop to sell her products in the same place where she lives, Villa El Carmen, a business area close to La Cumbre, on the way to Los Yungas (the warm valleys of Bolivia). She manages her activity in a good way. Her family is composed of her mother, who engages in the same activity, and a younger brother. Solmara is a responsible, appreciative and resourceful woman. The loan she is requesting will be used to open a shop to extend her market and to buy products such as baby diapers. She is a woman who wants to improve herself and to succeed, thanks to this improvement, in getting on in life and in improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To open a shop and to buy products to sell such as baby diapers.

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Making baskets is a part of 48-year-old Mrs. Chou’s daily routine. She and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell at the mobile place. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 1990. Mrs. Chou has five children. Three of her children are employed as garment workers. Mrs. Chou will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. The loan will offer her an additional new asset. Mrs. Chou and her granddaughter are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for planting rice crops.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 41 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of five school-aged children. Alma has a mini-grocery store at home that sells food in pouches, coffee, milk in sachet, oil, soy sauce and canned goods. She has been in this type of business for one year. She earns PHP 5,000 for this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase stock to sell.
Alma has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Alma hopes to buy a rice field and renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Maria Evelia

texts.en: Maria lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras where she makes a living by selling freshly prepared food from her home. She works seven days a week and has a steady clientele of neighbors from her village. She is requesting a loan of HNL12,000 to purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to purchase beef, chicken, pork, cornmeal, rice, beans, tomatoes, peppers, corn, plantains, cheese, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: FIFONSI est un groupement constitué de onze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Laure Sèblo. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe FIFONSI sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Laure Sèblo est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Laure Sèblo est une veuve ayant cinq enfants à sa charge, dont deux représentent ses propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Laure Sèblo assure seule les diverses charges des enfants. Laure Sèblo n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Laure Sèblo mène comme activité, la vente de chaussures dans une ville du Bénin. Laure Sèblo est également une restauratrice qui vend du riz accompagné de sauce, des pâtes alimentaires, etc. Laure Sèblo s'approvisionne au Bénin. Laure Sèblo exerce cette activité depuis une douzaine d'année, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Laure Sèblo et aux autres membres du groupement FIFONSI de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d'augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire et leur clientèle. Plus tard,Laure Sèblo ambitionne acquérir une parcelle et construire une maison.
texts.en:
FIFONSI is a group made up of 11 persons whose leader (the woman who is raising her hand in the photo) is named Laure Sèblo. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. For the first time, in order to grow their working capital, this FIFONSI group is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

 Laure Sèblo, 47, lives in Bénin. She is a widow raising five children, two of whom are her biological children. Some of these children are enrolled in school. Laure Sèblo supports the children all by herself. 

 Laure Sèblo did not attend school. To earn a living, she sells shoes in a town in Bénin. She also sells cooked rice with sauce, pasta, etc. She buys her supplies in Bénin. She has been working at this businss for a dozen years, and it allows her to cover her family's daily expenses. This first loan will surely permit  Laure Sèblo and the other members of the FIFONSI group to raise the level of their businesses and grow their turnover and their clientele. 

Later on, Laure Sèblo would like to acquire a parcel of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen pairs of shoes and one sack of rice.

loans.name: Deysi Esperanza

texts.es:
Deysi Esperanza tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Deysi se dedica al comercio de prendas de vestir y al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.
 Solicita el crédito para comprar ropa. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas. Enfrenta desafíos como la competencia. Su sueño es tener un local propio de prendas de vestir.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Deysi Esperanza is 24 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in the Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  

The “Nueve de Abril” (Ninth of April) Communal Bank is located in the San José parish, which is in the Chillanes canton.  The members of this communal bank work in agriculture, and they mainly grow corn and cacao.

Deysi sells clothes, and she grows corn and cacao.  She buys and sells her products at the San José de Tambo market.

She is requesting the loan to buy clothes.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs.  She faces challenges like competition.

Her dream is to have her own place to sell clothes.

She likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (an orphan). Jane has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week. Jane sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Jane has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Jane include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she sells only on a wholesale basis. Jane lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicine (paractemol, and cough syrup) for her business.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita, 53, lives in the town of Naguilan, province of Isabela. Elenita works hard to support the needs of her children. Her husband is farmer, and they help each other to achieve their dream for their children.

Elenita is a vegetable vendor. She is asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy different vegetables that she can sell in the community. 

She dreams that someday she will have her own store and provide a better quality of life for her family

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbage, squash and beans for her business.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es:
Narcisa de Jesus tiene 37 años de edad es soltera vive con los padres no tiene hijos, vive en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

 La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, esta conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc. 

Narcisa se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, arroz, maíz, soya, plátano  las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos fertilizantes, urea, insumos y líquidos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para lo posterior venderlos. 

Con el préstamo le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrentar desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas. 

El sueño es comprarse una casa y un terreno más para sembrar y aumentar los ingresos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los padres.
texts.en:
Narcisa de Jesus is 37 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  She does not have any children.  She lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Unión y Progreso la Colombia Baja' community bank has fifteen members and is located 90 minutes from our cooperative.  The members of this bank work in farming, growing cacao, rice, corn, soy, bananas, oranges, etc.

Narcisa is a farmer who grows cacao, rice, corn, soy and bananas.  She makes her purchases and sales in San José del Tambo every weekend.

Narcisa is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, urea, supplies and liquids to keep her crops in good condition for when she sells them later.   

This loan will help Narcisa to financially cover her needs.  She faces very frequent challenges in the form of competition and pests.

Narcisa's dream is to buy a house and a further plot of land so that she can sow more and increase her income.

In her free time, Narcisa enjoys going out for walks with her parents.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, urea, supplies and liquids

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonalyn, a 29-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband, Sonny, is a painter. They have three children: two are already studying in elementary school while one is still too young for school and stays at home. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jonalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to residents of the local neighborhood. It is, for example, the place to go to buy shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling individual items at retail prices. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 PHP in sales every day.

To help her to continue to operate the business, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP. She would like to utilize the loan proceeds to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as a result of the loan because it will enable her to expand her business.

Jonalyn hopes her business will be stable and dreams of being able to provide her children with a high-quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (grocery items and other products) needed for her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is 46 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. She has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Rosario has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela es madre soltera de tres hijos, uno de 5 años, otro de 2 años y el último de 2 meses que hacen que esta mujer luche cada día por salir adelante de la mano con su fritadora en la que hace comidas rápidas. El préstamo le ayudará a Daniela a comprar surtido y un carrito de perros que sería el único en su barrio ya que nadie más presta este servicio. El gran sueño es poder montar su negocio de comidas rápidas en un local con todas las especificaciones y seguir para adelante con sus tres hijos y su mamá.
texts.en: Daniela is a single mother of three children, ages 5, 2 and 2 months, for whom she fights everyday to make headway with her fast-food fryer business. The loan will help Daniela to purchase and stock a hot dog cart, which will be the only one in her neighborhood since no one else offers that service. Her biggest dream is to set up her fast-food business in a store with all of her specifications and to keep making progress for her three children and her mother.

loans.use: to purchase a hot dog cart.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old and widowed. She has two children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Lucila has been in this business for six years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Lucila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, single, and lives with four family members, two of whom work.

Diyaa has owned a men’s clothing and accessories shop since 2006.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good reputation. His shop is located in a crowded area, so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He is applying for a loan of $1800 to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to earn more profits to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 52 years old and is a married man with 6 children. His children are between 12 and 28 years old. 

Jaime is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is able to support his family through his fishing business. He plans to use his loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks and baits. Jaime also sells food items to his community. Jaime hopes to have a stable income to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks and baits

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 35 years old and married with three children. She is  a very hardworking woman who has practiced mixed farming for over five years. Rebecca also runs a salon. 

Rebecca is applying for her first loan to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and wheat seeds, and to expand her salon business. She intends to use the additional income generated with her loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she hopes to develop her businesses and become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and expand her salon business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 52 years old. He is married to Lucy. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a retail shop for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES  20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy stocks of maize flour, rice, and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will help him to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of maize flour, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is twenty four years old and is married with two children. She has owned a business planting and harvesting taro for sale for many years. Lilia needs a loan of WST $1,250 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Lilia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lilia's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Achok

texts.en:
Achok is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, and all of them are in school. 

She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Achok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco tiene 44 años, está  felizmente casado con la  Sra. Maria, ellos llevan  25 años de casados y gracias a Dios tienen 3 hijos.
El Sr. Francisco es carpintero  y se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de muebles que hace, y gracias a su buen trabajo está saliendo adelante.  Él tiene la aspiración de ir creciendo día a día en su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa y de sus hijos ya que es el sustento de la familia y desea verles a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima, maderas, clavos. Agradece la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en: Francisco, 44, is happily married to María; they’ve been married 25 years and thanks be to God have three children.  Francisco is a carpenter.  He sells all types of furniture he manufactures and thanks to his good work he’s moving forward.  He hopes his business will grow day to day with help from his wife and children since it’s his family’s source of support and he wants to see his children become great professionals.  He’s requesting the loan to buy raw materials, wood, nails.  He is grateful for the opportunity he’s getting because it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy lumber, nails, etc.

loans.name: Ignacio's Group

texts.en: Ignacio, Justino ana Valentin live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 3 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where this picture was taken). All of the 30+ households in this community depend on ocote pine for lighting. Ocote sends out a lot of smoke and gives out very little light. This causes the family of Ignacio with his four children to have an inadequate environment for family, education and other activities in their home, besides being a health, security and environmental hazard. Ignacio works in the field, mainly with corn, coffee, sugar cane and beans and consumes more than 12 pieces of ocote each week for lighting. His community and other households get these by cutting down trees in nearby forests, and depend exclusively on daylight for income-generating activities. He is very excited on acquiring a solar home system to have additional working hours for him and his kids to study, and commented on the importance of reducing the smoke caused by his current lighting sources.

loans.use: Ignacio, Justino ana Valentin to buy a reliable solar home system and stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting.

location.town: Cerro Cuero, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at the village school. She lives with her husband, who is also a teacher, and her 25-year-old son. Together with her husband, Karine runs a farm. The farm currently includes cows, pigs, and chickens. Near the Achajour village where Karine and her family live, they also own a plot of land where different types of fruit and vegetables are cultivated. 

Due to their hard and tireless work over the years, Karine and her husband own a sustainable farm. However, currently, because of financial difficulties that they are facing, it is difficult for this couple to increase the number of livestock and enlarge their agricultural profit. Karine has applied for this loan of USD 2000 to purchase a cow and a calf. The loan will be a huge support for Karine and she is very thankful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy, 39 year old, married and has 4 children. She borrowed a loan to buy for more pigs in her piggery business. She will buy a piglet then take care and feed it, and then sell it when it is at the appropriate weight. Through her business she was able to help his husband who is working abroad. She was able to support their everyday needs with her business. She also have a rice farm, a mango tree and coconut tree that will give her enough financial when the harvest comes. She want to expand her business and able to provide the educational needs of her children and help her family who are need as well.

loans.use: To buy for more pigs in business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has about 2 years of experience in the restaurant business. She decided to start it on her own initiative after being fed up of her work as a housekeeper. With her savings and the help of her brother in law who is a carpenter, she was able to acquire tables, chairs and utensils for her business. She started off by having the business outside of her home, but now she has made space inside to sit her clients. Maria is eager to continue improving her business but she needs a loan in order to make aesthetic improvements. She has 3 children who are all grown up and often help her in the restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the appearance of her restaurant

texts.en: A. is 25 years old and is married with a two year-old child. She sells household goods, such as rice, cooking oil,and cigarettes from her small kiosks. Becoming a member of MBK has been really helpful, otherwise she would have been forced to close her shop. Her husband, Tatang, sells firewood in the market. He earns not much more than $2 per day. She now needs a significantly larger loan to help increase the stock of inventory in her store.

loans.use: Expand her household goods store

loans.name: Rakhib

texts.en:
Rakhib has a small shop where he sells spare parts. He is a very kind, friendly, and hard-working person. He has had his business for 4  years, and it allows him to support his family. He is 21 years old. Rakhib is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, in the Fizuli region. He is settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fizuli region.
He is applying for a loan of $1200 to expand the area of his shop. He is very optimistic about the future of his business.








.

loans.use: to expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria Lucia is 22 years old and single. She manufactures blouses, skirts, and shawls, which she and her mother later embroider. They sell their product to the women of their community. She is a member of the Neblina1 Group, along with Ms Maria Hernandez Vasquez (blouse craftswoman). They ask for a loan to purchase silk and cloth to increase the production of her workshops.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA LUCIA , TIENE 22 AÑOS , SOLTERA , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS , FALDAS , CHALES ARTESANALES LAS CUALES POSTERIORMENTE BORDA JUNTO CON SU MAMA Y VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO NEBLINA 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARIA HERNANDEZ VASQUEZ ( ARTESANIA EN BLUSAS ) . AMBAS ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN HILOS DE SEDA Y GENEROS PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE SUS ARTESANIAS.

loans.use: To purchase material, like silk and cloth, to increase production

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Latofat H. is 44 years old, she is the mother of 2 children and has a high school education. Her husband trades goods, her older daughter is married and her son studies in school. Latofat has been selling children’s and men’s clothing for 12 years. She started her business by selling children’s clothing. Slowly after receiving a loan and using it fully she expanded her product line by adding men’s clothing and expanded her place of business. Today her assets have doubled.

Latofat plans on using the new loan to add shoes to her product offering.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Холматовой Латофат 44года, она мать двоих детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается торговлей старшая дочь замужем, сын учиться в школе. Заниматься торговлей детской и мужской одежды 12лет. Начала свою деятельность с продажи детской одежды. Постепенно после получения займа и целевого использования она расширила ассортимент товара, то есть добавил мужскую одежду, расширила место деятельности. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза, в будущем она планирует добавить в свой ассортимент и обувь.

loans.use: to add shoes to product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new refrigerated glass display case

loans.name: Bertha Ema

texts.es:
Bertha is a 32-year-old teacher in the community of Clara Cuchio. Concurrently, she also sells cosmetics, clothes, and accessories. She has an 8-year-old daughter. Bertha has been working both jobs for a long time, thus she has plenty of experience. She has moderate competition because there are other people in her area who work in the same field as she does. She will use this loan as capital to purchase more merchandise, since the year-end festivities allow for a greater demand of apparel and accessories. Prices vary depending on consumer demand and the quality of the product. Bertha’s credit history is excellent.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha tiene 32 años de edad y es maestra en la comunidad de Clara Cuchio, paralelamente también se dedica al comercio de cosméticos, ropas y otros. Su familia está compuesta por dos personas ella y su hija de 8 años de edad. Bertha trabaja desde hace bastante tiempo en ambas actividades por lo que su experiencia es extensa. La competitividad en ambos negocios es medio debido a que existen otras personas que trabajan en estos rubros. El presente préstamo será destinado como capital de trabajo, Bertha adquirirá mercadería dado que por las fiestas de fin de año existe bastante demanda de diversos artículos y prendas de vestir, los precios de los mismos varían dependiendo a la demanda y calidad. Los antecedentes crediticios de Bertha son excelentes.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Prof. Mery dedicates her time in the running of her corner store selling items and cold drinks to her community and she also works as a very good teacher, loved by her community. She is a very good business woman and she is dedicated to her work and gives fine customer service to the public. Given this demand Mery does not have sufficient funds to purchase products and merchandise and the few funds she does have from her work as a teacher she uses to cover her own living expenses. For this reason she is requesting your help to replenish and expand her business. You will be happy to share in the happiness of this devoted teacher, in her work, in her labor, for the benefit of her community.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La profesora MERY, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas heladas en su comunidad y aparte de ser una muy buena maestra y querida en la comunidad es una muy buena bodeguera dedicada a su trabajo y a dar una muy buena atención al público.Pese a esta demanda Mery no posee el dinero suficiente para la compra de sus productos y mercadería y el poco dinero que gana en el magisterio solo le ayuda a cubrir sus gastos propios; es por ello que solicita su colaboración para surtir su negocio y ampliarlo.No puede negarse a poder ser parte de la alegría de una maestra comprometida con su labor y el trabajo en beneficio de su comunidad.

loans.use: Inyección de capital para adquirir mayor y mejor calidad de productos para su bodega.  Influx of capital funds to acquire better and greater quantity of products for her warehouse.

loans.name: Theopista

texts.en:
Theopista M., age 48, is married and has 2 children (ages 18 and 20). She owns a restaurant business which she started 5 years ago. Theopista's restaurant is open from 6:30 am until mid-night every day, allowing her to earn a monthly profit of about US$873.

In the past, Theopista has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania in order to expand her restaurant. She now hopes to receive a new loan to buy more and better equipment for the same business.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment and tools for a restaurant

loans.name: Candy

texts.es:
Candy is a hard working mother. She dedicates herself to the cultivation of her lands with the help of her oxen. She would like to increase the quantity and quality of her products to improve the quality of life for her family. This loan will enable her to invest in the business.

Doña Candy, es una trabajadora madre de familia que desempeña con satisfacción en sus tierras de cultivo gracias a la ayuda de sus bueyes, el deseo de incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos para generar mayor bienestar a su querida familia, a esta razón atiende la solicitud de un préstamo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER FARMING BUSINESS AND INCREASE THE QUANTITY AND QUALITY OF HER PRODUCTS.

loans.name: Rose's Mandingo Group

texts.en:
Rose is 33 years old and is married with 1 child, age 6. Rose is a tailor; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 5:00 AM to 4:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items and cloth items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Kigenda and Mwanaraji, who have businesses dealing in cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items and cloth items for her business

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
B. Zamira is an unmarried, 28-year-old woman. Zamira has been operating her own business for 5 years already. Zamira sells clothes for kids and women in a store located in one of the most highly-inhabited parts of the city. Because Zamira is very nice and polite, she has developed a dedicated and loyal client base. Accordingly, the business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for her family. 
Currently she is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to be repaid over a 9-month term in order to increase the business' stock of summer clothes for kids and women. She promises to pay the loan back on time and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To increase inventory and to prepare for the summer sales season by purchasing new kids' and women's clothes

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
A plumber by profession, Yaovi V. was born in 1963 in Notsè in Haho prefecture. His has as his wife Dovi ASSIOGBO, a hairdresser. In 2000, he opened a shop "Bar Christian City" selling beverages in the Agoè district in the north of Lomé. In this shop, he also sells plumbing supplies.

He is on his second loan and is requesting 450,000 francs CFA to buy 76 bottles of liquor and plumbing supplies.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Plombier de profession, Monsieur V. Yaovi est né en 1963 à Notsè dans la préfecture de haho. Il a pour épouse madame ASSIOGBO Dovi qui est une coiffeuse. Depuis 2000, elle a ouvert une boutique de vente de boisson « BAR CHRISTIAN CITY » dans le quartier Agoè au nord de Lomé. Dans sa boutique, il vend également des matériels de plomberie.

Il est à son second crédit et sollicite 450.000FCFA pour acheter 76 bouteilles de liqueur et des matériels de plomberie.

loans.use: To buy 76 bottles of liquor and some plumbing supplies

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William Alberto is dedicated to the sale of electronic household items and new and used clothing. He opened this business 11 years ago by selling just clothes and established a fixed point. Today, his sales are also conducted by travelling from area to area.

William's plans for his business are to augment salest in order to offer a better quality of service to his clients. He would also like to, in the future, be able to have a store for these products. William Alberto is married with four children that are of schooling age. His wife supports and helps him with his business.

They live in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood, an area where juvenile delinquincy has increased. For this reason William is asking for a loan in order to purchase material and build a wall behind his house and in this way provide more security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

William Alberto se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, ropa nueva y ropa usada, empezó su negocio hace 11 años vendiendo solamente ropa y establecido en un punto fijo, ahora sus ventas las realiza también de forma ambulante. Los planes que William tiene para su negocio es aumentar las ventas para poder ofrecer mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes, y desea también en un futuro poder poner una tienda de estos productos. William Alberto es casado, tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposa lo apoya en la actividad del comercio. Habitan en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, lugar donde la delicuencia ha aumentado es por eso que William solicita el crédito, para comprar materiales y construir un muro en la parte trasera de su casa y así brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.

loans.use: Build a wall in the area behind his house

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa Q. is a 47-year-old woman who breeds calves and, at the same time, sells milk to local people. She is married and has 4 children. Rafiqa started her business in 1982 in her home village in the Imishli region. As she and her husband are unemployed, her business in the only financial resource for her family.

Rafiqa would like to expand her business which can help her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. For this purpose she has applied for US$ 1200 to purchase a milch cow for US$ 800 and two calves for US$ 200 each.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and one milch cow

loans.name: Mrs. Hur Tonn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hur T. is the president of the village bank.  This village bank consists of nine people who are all live in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Hur T. is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Toem Sareth, is a fisherman in the local lake. Aside from this business, he breeds pigs and cows. In Mr. Toem Sareth's fishing business, he does not have enough money to buy fishing equipment so his wife, Mrs. Hur T., decided to ask for a loan for her husband to buy the equipment. Mrs. Hur T. is a 54-year-old mother without any children. 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishing equipments to catch fish.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
ANA LUISA S. R. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

LA SEÑORA ANA LUISA SE DEDICA DE ASISTENTE EDUCATIVA, ES UNA PERSONA MUY DEDICADA Y RESPONSABLE LUCHANDO POR SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE YA QUE ES MADRE SOLTERA Y POR ELLO HA HA DEMOSTRADO LA FORTALEZA Y MADUREZ QUE POSEE, POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO QUE SOLICITA DESEA CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO PARA AMPLIARSE Y BRINDARLE A SUS HIJOS UN MEJOR ESTILO DE VIDA.
texts.en:
ANA LUISA S. R. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

Ana Luisa works as a teacher's assistant. She's a hard-working and responsible woman, a single mother struggling to lift her family up. Her hard work demonstrates that she's both strong and mature. With the loan that she's applying for she wants to build an extra room and provide her children with a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build extra room.

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Mrs. Yam K. lives in Ponlai village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells coconuts. She is a 63 year old widow and the mother of a child who sells petrol. Even though Mrs. Yam K.’s family members have different businesses, they do not earn very much money. Thus, Mrs. Yam K. decided to ask for a loan to buy petroleum for her daughter’s business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy petroleum for her daughter’s business.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Oeurn N., 36, of Treal Commune in Kompong Tom Province, raises pigs, sells groceries, and provides the services of his rice mill machine to local customers. His wife, Mrs. Sham Oun, 36, who takes care of their three children, all attending school, also sells groceries and raises pigs in her home.

Oeurn is requesting a $400 loan to purchase a rice mill machine to replace his old one and to buy more groceries for sale. (Oeurn's wife is pictured because he was not available for the photo.)

loans.use: To purchase a rice mill machine

loans.name: Sa Aeth's Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of eight members, is located in Svay Khoy village in Kampong Chhnang province. The group members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sa Aeth A. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She sells fish in the market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Mr. NhO. Sat, breeds pigs. Mrs. Sa Aeth A. has a child who attends the local school. 

One member in this village bank loan is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The one member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term ( EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Mrs. E. is 46 years old, married with no children and resides in Maribojoc, Tudela. Her husband is motorcycle driver known as Habal-habal Driver and also a farmer. She started her grocery store when she got married, and because of a lack of profit, she borrowed the capital from her close friend and neighbor. Until now, her business still works with m management. Upon learning from her neighbor that Paglaum MPC is inviting new members to join the Coops programs, with a Theme "Helping People, Help Themselves". She became interested and became one of the members of Rose Center in Maribojoc, Tudela. She admires the continuous education conducted by the Technical Officer of their Center and enjoys being a member of the Cooperative. As this time, Mrs. E. is applying for a loan of Fourteen Thousand Pesos as additional capital to purchase grocery items for her grocery. Her plans are to be able to renovate her house and expand her business.

loans.use: Additional Grocery Items

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương năm nay 46 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình. Hiện tại  cả gia đình chị đều làm công việc dệt chiếu và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm nguyên vật liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu tăng thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hương is 46 years old. She has three grown children. In 2003, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed funds to invest in the family's mat weaving business. Right now, her entire family works in the mat weaving business and it is also their main source of income providing 3,000,000 VND per month. For this upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND to buy more raw materials to further the her family's weaving business and improve their income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to weave mats

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Ana P. se dedica con muchísimo esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de productos festivos para toda actividad como lo son piñatas. Festones, vasos, platos, entre otros, todo con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los productos y por esta razón requiere de dicho crédito para suplir su negocio y continuar desarrollándose.
texts.en:
In the town of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Ana P. spends a huge amount of effort managing her business selling festive products for all sorts of activities, such as piñatas. Decorations, glasses, plates among other things: all with the aim of improving the sustenance of her home. The reason why she has placed her faith in Ceprodel is because she has asked for a loan to purchase these products because she needs this credit to stock her business and continue her self-development.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase festive products

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат выращивает дома домашний скот. Это дополнение к заработку мужа, который работает в колхозе, а по воскресным дня посещает скотные рынки и если попадается бараны подешевле скупает и привозит домой. Месяц другой Саёхат и дети смотрят за ним и затем продают. Саёхат 37 лет, имеет 2 детей. Вместе с односельчанами решила прийти в МикроИнвест и подала заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Sayohat raises livestock at home. This is an additional to her husband's income who works in a collective farm. And on Sundays she visits livestock markets and if she finds sheep that cost less, she buys and brings them home. For a couple of months Sayohat and her children keep after them and later put them for resale. Sayohat is 37 years old and has two children. Together with her fellow villagers she decided to come to MicroInvest and apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anneth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26 year old Anneth N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with no children. She is also responsible for supporting two dependants because they attend school in the area. Anneth has been running a taxi business since 2007. She has one employee who is a driver. Anneth currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to open a beauty salon. Anneth thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To open another business (beauty salon).

loans.name: Shamim Javed Masih Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is the wife of J. M.. They have lived in a city named Lahore in Pakistan for the past ten years. Lahore city is famous for its Punjabi foods and for its historical places. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy snooker for her game shop.

Her husband runs a game shop in the community. Children come to play the games and spend their free time. He has been in this business for the past five years. Shamim baji operates a business sewing clothes. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount.

She is the leader of a group of five other women from her locality. Fozia baji and Rubina baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits for their fruit selling business. Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy vehicle engine oil to sell. Sarfraz baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy snooker for her game shop.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 39 years old and married with 3 children. He sells VCDs and electronics. He hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal Paz y Desarrollo
Maria es casada tiene 38 años tres hijos de 18 esta en la universidad del estado, los de 17 y 12 años están en la escuela estatal.
Maria estudio partería un año, se compro un horno a gas y se ha puso hacer pasteles al por mayor, reparte por su barrio a las tiendas, envía a provincia , también esta enviando a  familiares y amigos que tiene en Estados Unidos. 
Desde que Maria  esta en Finca, le gusta la manera que tienen para hacerle ahorra  les alientan a no tener miedo para empezar un negocio, o para pedir un préstamo. 
Maria  necesita un préstamo de  3000 soles, para la compra de una moto-car al contado.
El sueño de Maria exponer una fuente de soda en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Paz y Desarrollo" (Peace and Development). Maria is married, is 38 years old and has 3 children, ages 18, 17 and 12. The 18-year-old is a university student and the 17 year-old and 12-year-old are students at public schools. Maria studied midwifery for a year. To start her business she purchased a gas oven and began making pastries and she started selling them in bulk to stores in her neighborhood. Her pastries were also sent to stores in outlying areas and to family members and friends that she has in the United States. Since Maria has been in Finca she has really liked the way that they have to help people manage their money well and to motivated them to not be fearful to start a business or to ask for a loan. Maria needs a loan of $1025 (3,000 Soles) to be able to buy a moto-car. Maria's dream is to start a soda shop in her home.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto-car.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат 41 год. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Мухаббат занимается продажей фруктов и овощей на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Ее муж помогает ей в бизнесе, иногда заменяет жену, когда у нее есть другие дела. Мухаббат закупает овощи и фрукты у дехканин, которые каждый день ранним утром приносят на рынок свежие фрукты и овощи. Мухаббат является постоянной клиенткой нескольких дехканин. Сейчас время овощей нового сезона и Мухаббат просит очередной займ для закупки свежих овощей.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 41 years old, married and has 3 children. Muhabbat is involved in sales of fruits and vegetables at the Panchshanbe market in the city Khujand. Her husband helps her with the business and sometimes relieves her, when she has other things to do. Muhabbat buys vegetables and fruits from dekhan farmers, who bring fresh fruits and vegetables to the market early every morning. Muhabbat is a consistent customer of several farmers. Now is the time for new seasonal vegetables, and Muhabbat is requesting her next loan to buy fresh vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh vegetables

loans.name: Idalia Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Idalia Amparo S. se dedica a su actividad de agricultura en el municipio de Telica donde a diario se esfuerza en el desarrollo de sus cultivos esperando una cosecha de mucho beneficio.

Ella actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la actividad agrícola por medio de la siembra, el arado e insumos para alcanzar una buena cosecha. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así le brindará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia porque aumentaran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Idalia Amparo S. works in agriculture in the municipality of Telica where she works hard every day caring for her crops and hopes for a very good harvest. She has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan to invest in planting a crop, in plowing and inputs in order to achieve a good harvest. She is very confident that her loan will be granted and that it will help to provide better living conditions for her family because her income will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in planting a crop

loans.name: Насим

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Насимчон молодой человек , который второй год кредитуется в организации. Займ берёт для расширения бизнеса животноводства. Сам работает разнорабочим по изготовлению глиняных кирпичей на заказ. Он планирует на следующий  займ, закупить  несколько голов баранов .

loans.use: откорм и продажа  скота

loans.name: Flor Kantutita Group

texts.es:
Martha P.  de 39 años es integrante del grupo “Flor Kantutita” que pertenece al Centro Focal “German Busch”  y ella vende comida  hace un año, inició su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso que le ayude a cubrir los gastos de su hogar, tiene su puesto de venta en la puerta de su domicilio. Actualmente ella quiere seguir mejorando su negocio y necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, papa y fideo. Al igual que Martha las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de telas, otras atienden tiendas de barrio, algunas tejen chompa y finalmente una vende fruta. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en su negocio comprando mercadería, materia prima e insumos. 

“Flor Kantutita” está compuesta por 11 integrantes y están juntas hace aproximadamente un año , actualmente la presidenta es la señora Martha P..
texts.en:
39-year old Martha P. is a member of the ‘Kantutita Flower’ group, a part of the German Busch centre. She began selling food a year ago because she needed an income to cover household costs. Her stall is located in the doorway of her home. Martha now wants to improve her business and needs a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, potatoes, and noodles. Similarly, the other members of the group have their own businesses. Some sell material; some have stores in the neighbourhood; others knit sweaters; and one woman sells fruit. They all need money for their businesses: to buy merchandise or ingredients. The Kantutita Flower group is composed of eleven members who have been together for approximately one year. Their president is Sra. Martha P..

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and ingredients

loans.name: Pela

texts.en:
Pela K. makes a living providing general alterations and tailoring services in her community. She is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Ulutogia. She is married and has five adult children. Pela has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2007, Pela (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Pela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase a new sewing machine.

Pela is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her second loan from SPBD. Pela plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agrandir sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais

loans.name: María Edith

texts.es: María Edith M. D. F. D. 59 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. María vive con sus tres hijos y un nieto D. 5 años D. edad, María ha dedicado la mitad D. su vida trabajando en su negocio con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, hace veinticinco años ella inicio su negocio D. venta D. tortillas, ahora también posee un pequeño inventario D. ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes, con estos dos negocios María logra  generar ingresos para sostener su hogar, pero ahora ella solicita D. un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, la cual ha tenido una gran demanda por sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Edith M. D. F. is 59 years of age and lives in the department of San Salvador. María lives with her three children and her five year old grandson. Maria has spent half of her life working in her business which is how she has been able to get her children ahead. Maria started her business 25 years ago making tortillas, and now she has a small stock of clothes to offer to her customers. With these two businesses Maria has been able to generate enough income to sustain her home, but now she is requesting a loan to buy more clothes, since this is in great demand by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her new business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia M. lives in the village Prk. Bayong, Barangay Balintawak, Escalante City. She is 58 years old and married to Glecerio M. who presently works as a dental technician. Glecerio used to be the sole breadwinner for the family, but in spite of all his hard work, his income was just not enough to cover the expenses, especially the education-related expenses of their five children. Because both Cecilia and Glecerio aspired to a better life for their children, it was their dream to send them all to finish college. Because of her sewing and dressmaking skills, Cecilia started accepting sewing jobs from a few regular customers until, by word of mouth and recommendations, her roster of clients grew. To have more working capital for her growing business, Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 and, because of the additional capital infusion, she took the opportunity to open a rice retailing business. Now her combined business income earns her an average monthly profit of PHP 7,000, which has made a big impact on their quality of life. Today, Cecilia’s children, who are between 16 and 31 years of age, are well on their way to achieving Cecilia’s and Glecerio's aspirations for them. As her businesses continues to grow, Cecilia uses her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon to sustain the capital required to operate them. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 was used to maintain the inventory level of her rice retailing business as well as to purchase sewing supplies. Now on her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to continue sustaining her businesses. She intends to use the income for the education of her children and to save for their future. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sewing and rice retail businesses

loans.name: Folayèmi A. Wossilatou

texts.fr: L. Folayèmi A. Wossilatou est née en 1957 et est mariée à YESSOUFOU Mazoukou, un commerçant. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés, mais seulement deux sont à leur charge. Wossilatou réside depuis 25 ans au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Wossilatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Wossilatou a abandonné l'école depuis le cours primaire. Il y a 20 ans de cela que Wossilatou mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits de mercerie dans sa boutique  qui fait face à la voie menant à la mairie de Dandji à Cotonou. Wossilatou s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C'est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et renforcer son activité pendant la période des fêtes, que Wossilatou sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Folayèmi A. Wossilatou L. was born in 1957 and is married to Mazoukou Yessoufou, a shopkeeper. The couple have five children, all in school, but only two of whom are in their care. Wossilatou has lived for 25 years in the Dandji area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Wossilatou helps her husband provide for the family. Wossilatou abandoned her studies in primary school. For 20 years since then, Wossilatou has run a business selling various sewing and dressmaking supplies in her store, which faces the road leading to the Dandji town hall in Cotonou. Wossilatou gets her supplies in Nigeria, a country bordering Benin, and at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longtime client of ALIDÉ who has repaid all her loans properly. To increase her working capital and strengthen her business during the holiday period, Wossilatou is seeking a sixth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various sewing and dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 34-year-old single lady who takes care of four orphans left by her deceased elder sister. The four children are 6 through 12 years old. She lives in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Laila has many responsibilities and expenses to cover in her family and that is why, 5 years ago, she decided to become a self-employed businesswoman. Laila sells women's clothes in her community which are in high demand in the local market. Laila works from 8 AM to 8 PM every day except Saturday.

Laila is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so that she may purchase additional, attractive clothing to sell. With these new offerings, Laila hopes to attract more customers and to earn more profit. Laila plans to reinvest a portion of profits earned into her business. In addition, Laila will continue to pay school fees for her sister's children and gradually improve the life of her family.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Vitesse Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Vitesse sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Ouayerma II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire et tous les précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles font la vente  du bois de chauffe, des fruits et légumes, des pommades et la fabrication  de boissons  non alcoolisées telles le jus de gingembre.
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, un chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 paniers d’oranges, 3 régimes de bananes, 2 sacs d’ananas, 5 colis de pommades et 1 sac de 50kg de sucre +3 sacs de 100kg du gousse de gingembre (pour la préparation du jus de gingembre). 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au grand marché de Sikasso, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers  et à domicile, au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Vitesse group are essentially married women who are on average 43 years old with an average of five children and mostly living in polygamous families in Ouyerma II, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They work together with the microfinance company, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the demand of their customers. They are on their fifth group loan and all the previous loans have been repaid without any problem. They sell firewood, fruit and vegetables and creams and also make non-alcoholic drinks such as ginger juice. With their new loan they are planning to buy a truck load of firewood, four baskets of oranges, three stems of bananas, two bags of pineapple, five parcels of creams, one 50kg bag of sugar and three 100kg bags of root ginger (for the preparation of the ginger juice). They get their supplies at the market in Sikasso and in the neighbouring villages. They sell at the large market in Sikasso, moving around the various districts and from door to door, for cash and also on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. They are counting on making an average monthly profit of 20,500FCFA each, of which part will be used for savings and the rest invested in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Yencala Leon, distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y venta de cerdos y aves. El cría los animales para luego sacrificarlos y vender su carne entre los vecinos de la zona. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para su comunidad ya que provee de carne a sus vecinos, que no pueden ir hasta el mercado para adquirirla porque la zona en donde viven queda en una zona rural alejada del centro de la ciudad.

Andrés desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El es un joven bastante responsable y muy respetado en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Andrés, 30, is single and lives with his parents in the Yencala Leon sector, Lambayeque district, which is 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 6 years he has raised pigs and fowl. He raises the animals and later sacrifices them to sell their meat among his neighbors. This is a very important business in his community in that he provides his neighbors, who are unable to travel to the market because they are located in a rural area far from the city center, with meat. Andrés would like to enlarge his business purchasing more animals but he lacks sufficient capital to do so. He has called upon Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time therefore, to request funding in the amount of 1500 new soles. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and to provide his family with a better quality of life. He is quite a responsible young man who is held in high regard in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Gloria María Méndez Laínez

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria Maria M. tiene una pulpería en su casa ella realiza las compra en Managua el mercado oriental y también tiene una venta de ropa usada en el mercado municipal ella compra las pacas en Managua y la vende aquí en su tramo en el mercado, el crédito lo solicita para compra mas mercadería como arroz, azúcar, frijoles aceite para surtir su pulpería  y ropa escolar . Este negocio surgió de cuando ella cambio de domicilio y vio la necesidad que había en poner una pulpería ahí en ese lugar ya que no había y también para no estar ella sin hacer nada ha tenido cuatro créditos con Ceprodel y le han impactado muchísimo ya que a podido incrementar sus ingresos tiene tres hijas una ya esta graduada y trabaja y las otra dos estudian en la universidad.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria M. has a small general store in her home. She buys her products in Managua at the Asian market. She also has a used clothing stand at the municipal market. She buys her stock in Managua and sells it from her stall in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her store, such as rice, sugar, beans, oil and school clothing. Her business arose when she moved to a new house, and she saw the need for a general store in the neighborhood, since there was none in the area; she also wanted to have something productive to do. She has had four loans with Ceprodel, and they have had a great impact on her life, allowing her to increase her income. She has three daughters; one has already graduated and is working, and the other two are studying at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, cooking oil and school clothing such as white shirts

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou J. is from the village of Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 7 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling ready to wear items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of relatives and other family members. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chantale

texts.fr: S. Chantale est née vers 1980 à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin, mais habite depuis 12 ans au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à DOHUIN Clément, un chauffeur, Chantale est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Chantale vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Chantale n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Il y a quatre ans, Chantale s’est mise dans la vente de la nourriture (pâte rouge et viande), de façon ambulante au Parc MIVVO, dans la commune de Sèmè-kpoji. Chantale mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de thé, des boissons, et du charbon. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Chantale s’approvisionne.  Chantale est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés.  Chantale sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et accroître sa clientèle.  Chantale ambitionne plus tard avoir une place pour pouvoir vendre ses marchandises au lieu de se promener sous le soleil.
texts.en:
Chantale S. was born round 1980 in Lomé in Togo, a country adjacent to Benin, but has been living for the past 12 years in the Sègbèya area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Clément DOHUIN, a driver, Chantale is mother of two children, both attending school. Chantal lives with her husband and children, and the couple share family expenses. Chantale has never been to school. Four years ago, she began selling food - red paste (cornmeal-based) and meat - as an itinerant vendor in Mivvo Park, in the Sèmè-Podji area. As a side business, she retails tea, beverages, and coal. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Chantale is a regular client of ALIDé, having been granted three previous loans, all repaid in full. She is now requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, to strengthen her business and increase her customer base. Her ambition for the future is to have a stall where she can display her products without having to walk around in the sun.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, gari (processed cassava root) and condiments

loans.name: Surtiditas Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento SURTIDITAS es un banco que trabaja con nuestra Institución desD. el año 2007, la mayoria D. las participantes trabaja en el comercio informal.

La Sra. TANIA es una D. las fundadoras del banco, esta a cargo  nuevamente D. la presidencia y se dedica al comercio D. diferentes productos, ya sea viveres o ropa, tiene una familia numerosa y con su negocio a conseguido hacer estudiar a sus hijos, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. mercaderia al por mayor. 

La Sra. ALEJANDRINA Es una joven participante y ocupa la secretaria, ella esta a cargo D. su hija D. 5 años, se dedica a la venta D. calzados con el prestamo a podido aumentar su capital y sus ingresos.

La Sra. MARIA MAGDALENA es la tesorera del banco , tiene una familia numerosa y con el prestamo a comprado lana para realizar mantillas que son comercializadas en las ferias , a parte que tambien se dedica a la venta D. comida, todos estos ingresos le ayudaran aumentar su capital y producción con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos mantienen el hogar solas, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento (Venture Bank) SURTIDITAS is a bank that has worked with our Institution since 2007. Most of its participants work in informal traD.. Tania is one of the founders of the bank. She bears the responsibility of the presidency once again, and works dealing in different products, whether it be provisions or clothing. She has a large family, and with her business she has managed to see to it that her children have studied. The money from the loan will be used in the purchase of wholesale merchandise. Alejandrina is a young member, occupying the position of secretary. She is responsible for her daughter, who is five years old. She works selling footwear, and with the loan she was able to increase her capital and revenue. Maria Magdalena is the treasurer of the bank. She has a large family, and with the loan she bought wool in order to make mantillas (light scarves) which are marketed during the holidays. Moreover, she also works in food sales. All of this revenue helps her increase her capital and production. With the money from the loan, she will purchase merchandise. All of the members are responsible people and hard workers who, in many cases, maintain their households on their own. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust afforded to them in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Khalida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Khalida Parveen is a citizen of the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. She is an uneducated lady but she has good talking skills. Khalida Parveen runs a business selling women's clothes. Once a month, she travels to various places to purchase clothes for resale.
Her husband, M., has a fruit-selling business. He sells fruits from his cart in different areas. Khalida not only manages her business but also helps M. in his business by arranging the fruits on the cart, a job she does every day. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Sopia Kotoine

texts.en:
Sopia Kotoine N. is 34 years old and married to Jackline. Together they have two children. 

Sopia is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land. He has been farming for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET from other members within his area of residence who are already registered as clients. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant more wheat on a bigger farm than the one he is currently doing because wheat has proved to be doing well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat.

He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set of goals.

loans.use: To plant 20 acres of wheat

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mrs. Mean S., 32, has been planting a variety of crops on farmland she owns and typically earns around US $1 per day. She lives in a commune in Phnom Penh, the capital, with her husband and their four children, who go to school or work. Her husband, Theap Lor, 31, is working in the construction field. 

To increase her family's income, Mean S. hopes to invest in a pig-raising business. She has already built a pigpen, but she lacks money to buy piglets for her stall. Therefore, she would like a loan in order to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Juan C. le está haciendo falta la impermeabilización del techo ya que esta en muy malas condiciones, también los acabados del exterior de la casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargaría de realizar la mejora, el se dedica a la construcción desde hace mas 10 años. Desea que su familia este en un buen lugar donde no les pueda pasar nada ya que tiene tres hijos pequeños y no quiere que se le enfermen por la humedad que hay en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de ingreso que tiene de sus trabajas en la construcción.
texts.en:
