José Juan C.'s house's roof is still not waterpoof; it's in very poor condition. Also, the exterior finishes of the house's are also in poor state. He is asking for funds to buy materials and supplies and he, himself, will do the work; he has been a construction worker for over 10 years. He wants his family to be in a place where no harm will come to his three small children; he doesn't want them getting sick due to the dampness in the house. He plans to repay the loan with part of his income from construction jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete exterior finishings and waterproof the roof.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en: Rubik B. is 26 years old and lives in Lchashen village, Sevan area. He is married and has two children. For about ten years, Rubik has been engaged in farming. He has six cows, three calves, and a plot of his own land. Rubik and his wife cultivate their land and keep their animals. With their profit from farming, they take care of their young family. Rubik is aksing for a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy four cows to develop his stock-breeding.

loans.use: To buy four cows to develop his stock-breeding

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila P. is from the village of  Kolambog  Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old. Teofila is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Teofila owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling  processed food and Ready to Wear items in the local community. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teofila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Teofila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Kolambog, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 48 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mario de 57 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los hermosos campos del poblado natal de Luisa, han sido en su vida el lugar que la ha visto crecer y forma su familia. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Es así que tiene 28 años cultivando alverja, papa y olluco, pero el tener que transportarlo le resulta bien difícil hacía el mayorista de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta hacerlo. Dentro su grupo comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luisa, age 48, is a woman who has always fought hard to be successful in life. She lives in her own house with her 57 year old husband, Mario, and their two minor children. She wishes to give them a better quality of life. The beautiful fields of Luisa’s native village have been the place that she has formed her family and seen it grow. Since she was very little her parents taught her to work on the farm. She now has her own fields in which she works very carefully and with much sacrifice. She has been growing peas, potatoes, and “olluco” (a yellowish tuber) for 28 years. Having to transport them to the wholesale market in Tarma is difficult for her. In time, she wishes to buy more land to increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that she has the responsibility of making all of her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is always up to date on the agreements arrived at in her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 soles that she is requesting to buy more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Paxtoca Group

texts.es: Emiliana Tomasa Cuá Cuá, estado civil casada con oficio Artesana “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos”, tiene 4 hijos, tiene el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en el extragero, pero estos meses que se aproximan aumenta la demanda de su negocio, y quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes. Los demas integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades, los cuales mencionamos: Venta de Ropa típica, elaboración de chalinas(bufandas para mujeres), costurera, Elaboración de Güipiles Típicos. Han decidido entonces unirse para solicitar un prestamos para incrementar el capital de cada uno de los integrantes y asi poder tener un negocio mas grandes y mejores ganacias. Este grupo de personas viven en cantón Paxtoca en los parajes Xecoxom 1 y 2, paraje Chibatz 1.
texts.en:
Emiliana Tomasa Cuá Cuá, is married and works as craftswoman "Making traditional clothing". She has 4 children and she has the support of her husband who works abroad. But these months that are approaching increase the demand on her business, and she wants to increase her working capital to cover the demands of her customers. The other members of this group work in diverse areas, which we will mention: sale of traditional clothing, making chalinas (scarves for women), seamstress, making traditional Güipiles (woven poncho). They have decided then to join forces to request a loan to increase the capital of each one of the members and so be able to have bigger businesses and improve profits. This group of people live in the canton of Paxtoca in Parajes Xecoxom 1 and 2, Paraje Chibatz 1.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Hellen has a business of wine making, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy a machine that makes wine.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hellen hopes to generate greater profits and help her educate her young sister.  In the future, Hellen hopes to own a house and a vehicle.      

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: to buy a machine for wine making

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shamim A. is a wife of M. I. and resides in a city called Multan, famous for its shrines and sweetmeats in Pakistan.  She is 47 years old and the mother of five children, four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son runs a CD center in the market. Her next two children are involved in vegetable selling business. The youngest of them has no work and doesn’t do anything. Her daughter is involved in a sewing business. They all contribute some of their earnings to financially support their family.

Shamim herself is involved in an embroidery business. She is good at her art, and crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes to give them a new and good look. She has a contract with different boutiques and by fulfilling their orders she earns a good income of approximately 5,000 PKRs every month which is a big support to her family.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her eldest son who has been running his CD center for the past five years. He sells movies and films, music, and games CDs as well. He has a good clientele base in the market. With the loan, he plans to stock more CDs desired by his customers and hopes increase his earnings.  Shamim is hopeful that this investment will enable her son to enhance his business and increase his income.   This is Shamim's second loan from Asasah, and during her first loan cycle, she never missed any meetings and paid all her installments on time.

loans.use: Purchase movies, music, and game CDs for resale.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie O. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 36 years old. Lenie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lenie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lenie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lenie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lenie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 33 years old. Janet is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Janet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future. Janet is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Janet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion O. is from the village of Carugmanan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 44 years old. Salvacion is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Salvacion owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salvacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Salvacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Salvacion is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Salvacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Marcia Leonor

texts.es: Marcia Leonor tiene 38 años, es una madre soltera por lo que tiene 3 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos. Por más de 5 años que tiene este negocio pues ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos para su hogar.  Pues siempre ha sido una madre responsable, que se preocupa por su familia la mayoría de sus clientes viven cerca de su vivienda y con otros tiene que recorrer distancias muy largas. Desea mantener este negocio activo.
texts.en: Marcia Leonor is a 38-year-old single mother of three children. She sells general merchandise, and for this reason this is not the first time she's had funds. She has had this business for over five years, which has been her principal source of household income. She has always been a responsible mother and looked after her family. The majority of her customers live hear her home but others come from much further distances. She wishes to keep her store in business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda forma parte del banco comunal “Esperanza y Fe” perteneciente  a la comuna de Independencia. En su triciclo ella sale a vender, desde hace veinte años, diarios, revistas y productos que los mismos periódicos entregan como promoción (colecciones especiales por ejemplo (Cds, ediciones especiales de autos y motos, etc.). Su esposo le ayuda cuando no tiene trabajos que hacer, ya que él trabaja de manera independiente como albañil. 
Con este préstamo, Bernarda comprará mercadería, principalmente productos de colección. Su sueño tener pronto un permiso para instalar el kiosco que tiene guardado,  en un lugar establecido. Ella ya hizo las gestiones y solo está esperando que le den la ubicación final. 
A Bernarda le ha servido mucho el apoyo de Fondo Esperanza, tanto económico como en la  orientación en los negocios.
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Se caracteriza por la presencia de edificios de mediana altura. Aquí se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile, entre otros 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a member of the “Esperanza y Fe” (Hope and Faith) communal bank in Independencia.  For 20 years she has gone out daily on her three-wheel vehicle to sell magazines, newspapers and products that the same newspapers offer on special sale (promotional items like special collections, CDs, special editions on cars and motorcycles, etc.).  Her husband helps her when he doesn’t have work since he works independently as a bricklayer.

Bernarda will use the loan to buy merchandise, primarily collectionables.  Her dream is to have a permit soon for a place to set up the kiosk she has stored.  She has already made the necessary requests and is only waiting for the final location to be assigned to her.  Support from Fondo Esperanza has been very helpful for Bernarda both economically and in business training.

Independencia is one of the 34 communes that make up the city of Santiago (capital of Chile).  It is located in the center-north sector and is noted for its buildings of medium height.  The Chilean Indigenous Cultural Center can be found here as well as six other Chilean historical monuments.

loans.use: For merchandise.

loans.name: Maimuma

texts.en:
Maimuma T. is currently in the business of selling onions, beans and simsim (sesame) and is requesting a loan to stock more beans, onions and rice to sell.  Maimuma is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house.

loans.use: Stock more beans, onions and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc. for resale

loans.name: Patrick Kuya

texts.en:
Patrick Kuya, aged 33 years, runs a cereals shop at Kware Estate, which is a well populated semi-slum area. He is married to Christine Kuya and together they have one daughter, Belinda, aged six years in preschool. He was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Patrick has been running this business for a period of two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. This loan of Kshs 10,000 is his second loan from KADET. He intends to use the loan to increase stocks of green gram in his cereals shop. If the loan boosts the business, he plan to use the profit to add his stock to make his shop a wholesale.

Patrick’s future dream is to open a wholesale shop and to educate his child. he describes himself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stock of green gram in his cereals shop

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
Mr. San S., age 57, is a laborer and his wife, Mrs. Phon Sophann, is a seamstress in a garment factory. With their careers, they are able to earn some income to support their family. Currently their house does not have a kitchen for cooking. Thus, Mr. San S. would like a loan to add to his savings to buy timbers to build a kitchen to support his wife's cooking. This couple has two children who are working as security guards for a company. 

Eighteen members have formed this village bank, located in Liek village in Kandal province. Mr. San S. is the village bank president having been selected its members. The members of this village will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a kitchen

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Señor Daniel es transportista y propietario de dos movilidades,  ambas trabajan como radio taxi, una la conduce el y de la otra percibe una renta fija mensual, el vive en alquiler en la zona de Senkata junto a su pequeña hija y su esposa que se dedica a la venta de flores, contribuyendo así con el gasto en comida y transporte, con el tiempo don Daniel piensa tener su casa propia por el momento trabaja desde las siete de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche, solicito el crédito  para el mantenimiento de una de sus movilidades, don Daniel es un buen cliente y es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito en la institución, es un joven muy trabajador y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Daniel is in the transportation business and owns two vehicles, both of which he uses as radio taxis.  He drives one and rents the other out for a fixed monthly rate.  He lives in a rented home in the Senkata district, together with his young daughter and his wife, who sells flowers in order to contribute to their food and transportation expenses.  In time, Daniel would like to have his own house but for the moment, he is working from seven in the morning until ten at night.  He is requesting a loan for maintenance on one of his vehicles.  Daniel is a good client and this is his fourth time applying for a loan from Emprender.  He is a hard-working young man and is grateful for the support he is being offered.

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth A., de 27 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Francisco, convive con Jesús Laureano de 45 años y tienen 02 hijos Franklin de 09 años y Joseph de 06; viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Carmen Pampa perteneciente al distrito de San Francisco. Con mucho esfuerzo Yaneth y su esposo, han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; Yaneth es agricultora se dedica a cultivar plantaciones de cacao y café; que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos de cosecha Yaneth tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos de las plantas. Viene trabajando 08 años en la agricultura y reconoce que este trabajo es muy rentable, es por ello que se esmera en cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo el tener que transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco, le es un muy complicado, pero sabe que todo sacrificio es recompensado. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de los integrantes. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para realizar el desmonte de malezas y comprará semillas de café y cacao para cultivar.
texts.en:
Yaneth A. is 27 years old and from San Francisco district.  She lives with her partner, 45 year-old Jesús Laureano, in their own home in Carmen Pampa neighborhood, in San Francisco district.  They have 2 children: 9 year old Franklin and 6 year-old Joseph. 

Through a lot of hard work, Yaneth and her husband have managed to work their land to make it more productive.  Yaneth is a farmer who grows cacao and coffee, which are sustainable products for her personal finances.  At harvest time, Yaneth has to hire laborers to harvest her crops.  She has been farming for eight years and acknowledges that the work is very profitable.  For this reason, she pays a lot of attention to her crops.  However, when she needs to transport her crops from the farm to the city of San Franciso, it is very complicated.  Regardless, she knows that every sacrifice has its reward.  In the future, she would like to buy new land to increase her crop production.

This is Yaneth's fourth loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual in paying back her previous loans and she hopes to keep this up.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank.  Yaneth will use her 3,000 Peruvian soles to hire laborers to weed her land and she will also buy coffee and cacao seeds.

loans.use: To hire laborers to weed her land and to buy cacao and coffee seeds

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib is a 37 year-old married man and father of three kids, living in Tayouneh with his beloved family. Najib has owned a general car maintenance garage for 26 years, since 1985. Najib started working since he was 13 years old.   He started working early to help support his family with their income. Najib didn't face any troubles starting his business since he's born to it. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a specialized car scanner in addition to a CO testing and regulating machine.   He hopes to improve his business more, and that will provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy a scanner and a CO testing and regulating machine

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita C. is from the city of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 53 years old. Pacita is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of selling bananas in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2011, Pacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase bananas and other products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Yola

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad.  Está casada y  tiene 02 hijos, la señora estudio educación primaria. 
Hace cinco años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo utilizó en la compra de habas y hongos.
Con éste crédito de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará 25 sacos de habas, cada saco contiene de cuatro a  cinco arrobas de habas.  Mercedes trabaja junto con su esposo, quien a su vez trabaja en el municipio y en jornales de chacra.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio para generar mayores ganancias.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la responsabilidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 44, is a member of the Virgen de Lujan community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is married and has 2 children.  She only has an elementary school education.
Mercedes has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  She used her first loan, for S/.300 new soles, to buy beans and mushrooms.  
Mercedes is applying for a new loan, for S/.3000 new soles, so that she can buy 25 sacks of beans, each of which contains five "arrobas"--a weight measure equal to about 13 kilos or 30 pounds--of beans.  
Mercedes and her husband work together.  Her husband also works for the town and farms a bit of land.  
Mercedes wants to improve her business so that she can make more money.  She likes her community bank because it provides a ready source of funds and because the other members are responsible.

loans.use: buy sacks of beans for retail food business

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, de 59 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Esperanza de 48 años y sus 2 queridos hijos menores Jonatan de 21 y James 8, quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Armando, es la siembra de papa, choclo y arvejas, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Él tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus productos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera comprar o alquilar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Armando is 59 years old and a very modest and friendly person. He lives in his own home along with his wife Esperanza, 48, and their two children, 21-year-old Jonatan and 8-year-old James, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Armando makes a living harvesting potatoes, corn and peas, which he sells at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. He has a number of customers who, knowing the quality of his products, never hesitate to buy everything in bulk. What he likes most about his work is sowing his fields and making them fertile and productive. He has 25 years' experience in this activity, and the thing he considers to be the most difficult is protecting his crops from harmful pests. In the future, he hopes to buy or rent more land to expand his production. This is Armando's 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows that he must make his payments on time if he wishes to receive another loan in the future. He is a responsible member of his community bank and is always concerned about his fellow members' well-being. With the loan of 3,000 soles he is requesting, he plans to purchase more fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma S. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Thelma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Thelma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & beverages, especially soft drinks, in the local community. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Thelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages & canned goods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Thelma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Las Rosas", los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque la dueña de la casa donde se reúnen tiene un jardín lleno de puras rosas, esta  historia es acerca del señor Melchor A. C., ya que es uno de los integrantes que conforman este grupo, cuenta con 58 años de edad, está casado con la señora Eufrocina con la cual tiene tres hijos, Octavio, Manuel y Sandra de los cuales ya todos están casados, el tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual lleva mas de 10 años.

Dice que eligió este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposa e hijos y sacarlos adelante, para así mismo tener una mejor solvencia económica y excelente calidad de vida, aparte de que dice es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, es por eso que decidió empezar con este negocio, con el préstamo que recibió va a continuar invirtiendo en su tienda, en la compra de mas mercancía como son: refrescos, aguas, aceite, huevos, sal, azúcar, leche, frijol, jabón, papel higiénico y demás artículos, para continuar con sus ventas.

Don Melchor dice que su meta  es la de hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que quiere construir un local más grande, puesto que lo que el mas desea es convertir su pequeña tienda en una abarrotería, para de esta forma tenerla muy bien surtida y así obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

El dice que conoce muy bien a sus compañeros y nos comenta que son personas muy responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable que tienen ganas de salir adelante y superarse, por lo mismo en ninguna ocasión se han atrasado o fallado con los pagos de su crédito, ya que quieren seguir contando con el apoyo de mas prestamos.

Da las gracias a FRAC y a los prestatarios de kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en él, ya que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de las rosas son los siguientes: Marcelina, María Elvia, María Isabel, Guadalupe, leonarda, Elvira, rosibel, Melchor, Martha, estela y juliana, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: tienda de ropa, frutería abarrotes, venta de pescados, maíz, refresquería, elaboración de tamales, y carnicería.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Rosas” (The Roses).  The members of the group decided on this name because the owner of the house they meet in has a garden full of just roses.  This story is about Mr. Melchor A. C. since he’s one of the group members.  He is 58 years old and married to Eufrocina with whom he has three children: Octavio, Manuel and Sandra, all of whom are married.  He’s had a grocery store for over 10 years. 

He says that he chose this business because he wanted to find a way to support his wife and children as well as have better economic solvency and an excellent quality of life.  Besides, he says that it’s a very good source of income and that’s why he decided to start with this business.  He will use the loan he got to continue investing in his store, to buy merchandise like: soft drinks, water, oil, eggs, salt, sugar, milk, beans, soap, toilet paper and other articles, to continue with his sales.

Melchor says that his goal is to cause his store to grow as a business since he wants to build a larger locale because what he most wants to do is turn his small store into a large grocery store to have it better stocked and thus obtain more and better profits.  

He says that he knows his fellow group members well and comments that they are very responsible, hard working, trustworthy people who very much want to get ahead and better themselves.  In addition, they have never been late or missed any loan payments because they want to continue relying on the support from subsequent loans.

He thanks FRAC and Kiva lenders for giving him the opportunity and for trusting him but, above all, for believing in him since thanks to the help he was able to invest in his business and have a better quality of life and a better future with his wife and family.

The people who make up the Las Rosas group are the following: Marcelina, María Elvia, María Isabel, Guadalupe, Leonarda, Elvira, Rosibel, Melchor, Martha, Estela and Juliana who are in a variety of activities like: clothing store, fruit stand, groceries, fish sales, corn, snack bar, tamale making and butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, oil, eggs, salt, sugar, milk, beans, soap, toilet paper and other articles for his store.

loans.name: Concepción María

texts.es:
Concepción María tiene 22 años, es soltera vive con los padres y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Concepción se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz, trigo y papas. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terrenos para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta conversar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Concepción María, 22, is single living with her parents and children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  She has two children.

The NUCANCHI KAWSAY communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton 25 minutes from the Cooperative’s office.  The members are in a variety of occupations:  farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and sawmill.

Concepción farms corn, wheat and potatoes.  Purchases take place in Guaranda’s market and sales at the wholesale market in that same city.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, diseases and weather variations.  Her dream is to have land to continue farming.

She enjoys chatting with her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is married with four sons and a daughter. Her daughter is a professional nurse while her sons are enrolled in school and getting their education. Her husband is a farmer and grows different seasonal crops. He works very hard all the day at his fields to fulfill the basic needs of his family. 

Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to boost her husband’s agriculture business. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to get better results from his field and earn better profits. 

He has been doing this business for the past 20 years and Bashiraan is confident about the positive growth of her husband’s business and about the better financial future of her family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Lang Eng

texts.en:
Lang eng, 44, sells food at her home. Her husband, Samnang, 42, is a motor taxi driver. Lang eng is asking for a loan of $700 to add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work. 

The couple has two sons, one has full-time employment and another one is in school. They live in a suburb about twenty kilometers outside of Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 38 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of five school-aged dependents. Juliet operates a service shop at home to earn extra income for a living. She offers plastic lamination and wood framing. She has been engaged in this type of service for 12 years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. Juliet requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase materials for framing and lamination.

Juliet has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Juliet hopes to have a photo shop and gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase materials for framing and lamination.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha de 39 años de edad es soltera, labora para el MINED como docente desde hace 24 años. Esta solicitando su 9no credito con el objetivo de comprar algunos libros y pagar mensualidades en la universidad, pues esta estudiando su 4to año de su carrera en Licenciatura en Pedagogia, ademas desea sacar el curso para obtener el titulo de PEN, por el cual le reconocen economicamente en su centro de trabajo.  

Sueña con poder terminar su carrera exitosamente y posteriormente estudiar una especialidad que le permita seguir brindando el pan de la enseñanza.-
texts.en:
Martha, 39, is single and has been working as a teacher for MINED for 24 years.  She is requesting her 9th loan in order to buy books and pay for monthly tuition at the university where she is in her 4th year earning a teaching degree.  She also wants to take a course called PEN which will benefit her economically at her work center.

Her dream is to finish her education successfully and later specialize through a post-grad course in order to continue her teaching career.

loans.use: To pay for university tuition and buy books.

loans.name: Ma.fe

texts.en:
This is Ma.Fe, 38, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Romulo, a welder. She has three children: two are in high school and one is in elementary school. With her husband and children, she manages their household and operates the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma.Fe operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She also earns income by selling personal products through direct selling. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy grocery items and other products for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Ma.Fe dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery products and personal items for her general store

loans.name: Neiser Heriberto

texts.es:
Neiser Heriberto tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijos de 27 y 25 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Neiser se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.
 
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es comprarse una finca.

Le gusta jugar vóley, además las fiestas como el Carnaval.
texts.en:
Neiser Heriberto, 50, is married living with his wife and children who are 27 and 25 years of age in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueve de Abril” (April 9) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members are mainly corn and cocoa bean farmers.

Neiser is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  He makes his purchases and conducts his sales at the San José del Tambo market.

He is asking for the loan to buy farming supplies.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming activities.  He faces such challenges as the drop in price of his products as well as middle-men.  His dream is to buy himself a farm.

He enjoys playing volleyball as well as the festivals like Carnival.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Segundo Alejandro

texts.es:
Segundo de 57 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Segundo brinda servicio como odontólogo en la zona donde vive, desde hace varios años, es conocido por los pobladores por el buen servicio y atención que brinda a sus clientes, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá cubrir sus gastos diarios de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles  para la compra de nuevas herramientas y materiales dentales para seguir brindando el buen servicio que le caracteriza, al mejorar su atención tendrá más clientes y por ende sus ganancias aumentarán lo que le permitirá solventar su crédito otorgado ymejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Segundo es un hombre correcto, trabajador y que se esfuerza día a día para que su familia tenga lo que él no pudo tener y brindarle más comodidades.
texts.en:
57-year-old Segundo lives with his family in his own home which has access to all services.  It is located in the urban part of Cayaltí district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

Segundo works as a dentist in the area in which he lives.  He has been in this business for several years and is known by the locals for the good service he provides to his patients.  He uses the income that he makes to cover his household's daily expenses.

Segundo has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy new dental tools and equipment so that he can continue providing the good service that he is known for.  By improving his service, he will gain more patients and, consequently, his profits will increase.  This will allow him to repay his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  Segundo is a polite, hard-working man who works hard every day in order to ensure his family has what he was not able to have himself and to provide them with more comforts.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
This is Novie, 55, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Lindro, and mother to their four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Novie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Novie hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucia  vive en la comunidad conocida como Esquilan Chico en la ciudad D. Cochabamba, junto a su esposo y su hijo pequeño. La Sra. Lucia  se dedica a la producción D. leche cruda, su producto lo entrega a la Empresa PIL Andina la cual se encarga D. la distribución D. leche en toda la ciudad D. Cochabamba, actualmente tiene 14 vacas en producción, produciendo en promedio 90 litros diarios. La actividad que realiza es familiar y regular a lo largo del año. El cliente solo entrega a la empresa Pil el monto mínimo D. leche para que su Mama no pierda la acción es por cuestión D. precio D. venta, y falta D. tanque D. enfriamiento en la zona que no pueD. vender el 100% D. su producción a la PIL
El siguiente crédito que solicita es para la compra D. un tanque D. leche enfriamiento (el tanque D. enfriamiento es un deposito D. leche cruda que se mantiene en buen estado, es D. este tanque D. donD. recoge la Empresa Pil la leche todas las mañanas y todas las tardes) el cual en primer lugar tiene un costo aproximado D.  16.000$us, es por esta razón que la compra la están haciendo conjunta con otras 15 personas D. la misma comunidad poniendo 1000$us cada uno. La Sra Lucia ahora que podrá tener acceso a este Tanque D. enfriamiento podrá entregar el 100% D. su producción D. leche a la Empresa Pil Andina.
texts.en:
Señora Lucia lives in the community known as Esquilan Chico in the city of Cochabamba, with her husband and young son.  Señora Lucia works producing raw milk.  She delivers her production to the Pil Andina Company, which is responsible for milk distribution throughout Cochabamba city.  She currently has 14 milking cows, producing on average 90 liters a day.  It's a family business, and one that takes place throughout the year.  This client only delivers the minimum amount of milk to the Pil Company, so that her mom doesn't lose her contract.  It's a question of selling-price, and as she doesn't have a cooling tank in her area, she cannot sell 100% of her production to the Pil Company.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a tank for cooling milk (the cooling tank is a place to keep raw milk in good state, and is how the Pil Company receives the milk every morning and evening). This tank costs approximately $16,000, so for this reason she is making the purchase together with 15 other people in her community, who are putting in $1,000 each.

Señora Lucia will now be able to have access to this cooling tank, and will be able to deliver 100% of her milk production to the Pil Andina Company.

loans.use: to buy a cooling tank for raw milk, together with other people.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife and one family member.

Jaafar has been an owner of a bakery since 2010; he produces and sells flour-based food baked in an oven such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1800 loan in order to reconstruct the stone oven for his bakery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to reconstruct the stone oven for his bakery.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 35 years old and single. For the past 11 years, he has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. Stephen was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be his first loan.  

Stephen is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, he hopes to engage in a more diversified dairy farming business in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Bomporo

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Bomporo from Grassfield in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 13 and 18. Her children are currently attending school.

Bomporo runs a general merchandise store.  At her store, she sells bundled water, crates of soft drinks, batteries and milk. She has been running this business for eight years. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is dealing with slow sales during the rainy season.

Bomporo has requested a loan in order to buy more food merchandise. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and maintain good well-being. In the future, she plans to expand her store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more bundles of water, crates of soft drinks, batteries and milk.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée à un menuisier. Elle a 2 enfants, dont un va à l’école. Le premier à 8 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Abla travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle achète et revend des charbons pour tous les clients à Lomé. Elle achète les produits dans les villages. Elle travaille seule et n’a aucun employé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque d’argent pour satisfaire toute la demande.
ABla a requis son premier cycle de crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter et revendre du charbon. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Abla voudrait élargir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abla is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a carpenter. She has two children, one of whom attends school. Her older and younger children are 8 and 2 years old, respectively. Abla has worked as a retailer since 2006. She buys and re-sells charcoal to all types of customers in Lomé. She buys the products in various towns. She works by herself and has no employees. Currently, her main difficulty is a lack of money to satisfy the full demand. Abla has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy and re-sell charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business. 
In the coming years, Abla would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 36 years old, married and has three children.

Naim has been an owner of a food market since 2007.  He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field.  His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2000 in order to make an outdoor ceiling, an aluminum showcase and to add more foodstuffs to his market.  He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to build an outdoor ceiling, an aluminum showcase and to add more foodstuffs to his market.

loans.name: Tashbibi

texts.ru: Ташбиби готовит пирожки и блинчики для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается четыре года. Она вдова. Ей 50 лет. У нее четверо детей. Двое ее детей работают на рынке. Ташбиби берет кредит для покупки продуктов необходимых для приготовлений пирожков и чебурек.
texts.en: Tashbibi makes piroshki and pancakes for sale.  She has been involved in this business for four years.  Tashbibi is 50 years old, a widow and has four children.  Two of her children work at the market.  Tashbibi is requesting this loan for the purchase of products necessary for cooking piroshki and chiburekki.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Bruna

texts.en:
Bruna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

For 20 years, Bruna has run a shop where she makes and sells snacks like rice and pancakes that are known locally as torta. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making her snacks.

Bruna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bruna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 28-year-old single woman. She describes herself as a good woman. 

Margarel operates a retail business where she sells peanuts. She has been involved in this business for the last year. Her primary customers are frequent and new. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased cost of peanuts when buying them wholesale. She will use the loan to buy more peanuts. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts.

loans.name: Faiee

texts.en:
Faiee is twenty-eight years of age and is married with four children.

Faiee owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Faiee needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Faiee joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faiee's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry is 39 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and is a father of one school-aged child. 

Gerry is a motorcycle "habal-habal" driver who owns and operates his own business. He provides passenger services to his local community. He has been engaged in this business for two years. 

Each month, Gerry earns approximately PHP 5,000 from this work. Gerry has been a member of GDMPC for two years. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase a motorcycle sidecar. In the future, Gerry hopes to purchase another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle sidecar.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene 46 años de edad él vive en Chimore de la provincia Carrasco, de la ciudad de Cochabamba él se encuentra separado con la señora Natividad con la cual tiene tres hijos,  Juan trabaja como chofer. Juan  vivía en Arani hace como veinte años atrás él tuvo que venir a Chimore porque no tubo ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia,  Juan lo dejo toda sus pertenencias por la separación que tuvo con la esposa, él se volvió a levantar solo y  tomo un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezó de cero, ahora él tiene un vehículo con el que trabaja como chofer en un sindicato.  El préstamo que solicita Juan es para la compra de lote para construir su casa y de esa manera podrá tener donde vivir con mejores condiciones de vida. Juan sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que el no pudo terminar el colegio ni hacer una carrera, pero él quiere que su hija si pueda realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old and lives in Chimore in the province of Carrasco in Cochabama city. He is separated from Natividad with whom he has three children. Juan works as a driver. Juan lived in Arani twenty years ago, he had to come to Chimore because his income wasn’t enough to support his family. Juan left all his belongings because of his separation with his wife. He got up again and took a new path, starting with nothing. Now he has a house in an urban area of Chimore in the town of Cesarzama where he lives and works with his vehicle. That’s one of the ways that he receives his income as well as working as a driver making it into the union on June 2nd. 

Juan is requesting this loan to purchase an agricultural lot so that he can build his home. Juan dreams of a better future for his children. He couldn’t finish school nor have a career so he wants his daughter to be able to have a career and be able to help people in the area.

loans.use: to purchase a lot to build his home

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is 46 years old and married with four children. With all 2 children in school, Jeneth works very hard to provide for them.

Jeneth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jeneth has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Jeneth would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned foods, milk, sugar, seasoning, coffee, shampoo etc

loans.name: Dopé Noëlle

texts.en:
Trained as a secretary and stenographer, Ms. Dopé Noëlle A., born on December 20, 1973, has not had the opportunity of having a permenant, stable job. She is most often hired as a replacement, but she likes her work and does it very well. Her situation does not provide enough to pay her bills and ensure a good future for her. Although she is single and has no children, she is responsible for her mother and two cousins. With her pale skin and enviable beauty, she does not want to leave herself open to abuse by men. Her small savings and a $300 standby credit allowed her to buy a portable computer to do travelling secretarial work. This service would do more to increase her success and help her if she could receive more consistent financial support. This is why Ms. A. is currently asking for a $2000 credit to open a business center. The credit will be used to buy a microcomputer and a photocopier, and to install a telephone. Financing Ms. A. would act as encouragement and a good example for girls who succumb to debauchery, prostitution, and easy money, with all the problems that brings today like AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases. A plan like hers deserves to be financed right away.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Secrétaire sténographe de formation, Mlle A. Dopé Noëlle, née le 20 décembre 1973, n’a pas eu la chance d’avoir un emploi fixe et stable. Elle est employée le plus souvent comme remplaçante, pourtant elle aime son travail et le fait très bien. Cette situation ne lui permet pas se prendre en charge et lui assurer un bon avenir. Or, bien que célibataire sans enfant, elle a à charge sa maman et deux cousines. D’un teint clair et d’une beauté enviable, elle ne veut pas se laisser abuser par les hommes. Avec sa petite économie et un crédit d’appoint de $300, elle est arrivée à acheter un ordinateur portatif pour faire le secrétariat ambulant. Ce service peut mieux lui réussir et lui rapporter bien si elle avait bénéficié d’un appui financier plus consistant. Aussi, Mlle A. Dopé Noëlle sollicite-t-elle aujourd’hui d’un crédit de $2000 afin d’ouvrir un centre d’affaires. Ce crédit servira à acheter un micro-ordinateur, un appareil photocopieur et à installer un téléphone. Financer Mlle A. Dopé Noëlle c’est encourager et donner un bel exemple aux filles qui se laissent à la débauches, à la prostitution et aux gains faciles avec tout ce que cela comporte aujourd’hui comme le SIDA et autres maladies sexuellement transmissibles. Un projet comme celui-ci mérite d’être financé aujourd’hui.

loans.use: Buying a microcomputer and photocopier and installing a telephone to open a business center

texts.en: A. is 25 years old and is married with one child, aged 2. She sells household goods such as rice, cooking oil, and cigarettes. Becoming a member of MBK is really helpful, since she would otherwise have had to close her shop. Her husband, Tatang, sells firewood in the market. He earns no more than $2 per day. She very much needs a bigger loan to increase her selling.

loans.use: Purchase capital to expand her business

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 32 years old, married with four young children, three boys and a girl. He trades mainly in maize, buying at Myanga and selling within the local area.

Kenneth has participated in several local seminars on business education. With the proposed loan of US$150 from PEMCI, he plans to expand his business which would enable him to buy in larger quantities, cutting down on travel time and cost. Due to competition, Kenneth is forced to travel a long way to buy maize where it is cheaper in order to improve his profitability. He has a small store where he is able to keep the maize and offload it slowly. The loan will help stabilize his business. This project is recommended for funding.

loans.use: Cereals Merchant

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria Elizabeth is married and lives in the Apodaca area of Nuevo Leon. Twelve years ago she started selling cosmetics to help her husband with the household expenses and their children's education. They have recently acquired their own home because their previous rents reduced the family's income greatly. At a previous job, Maria started selling her products to colleagues at work. Little by little her customers and the number of products she marketed increased. Now, she only dedicates herself to her business, exhibiting her work at people's homes, which has helped her business grow rapidly.

At this time, Maria is asking for a loan of 925 dollars to purchase merchandise to help her meet her customer's demands and continue growing her business. She intends to pay off her loan in 6 months. You can help Maria improve her family's way of life. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elizabeth es casada y vive en la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León. Hace doce años ella empezó a vender cosméticos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, ya que acababan de adquirir su propia casa y las hipotecas que pagaban reducían mucho el ingreso familiar. Anteriormente tenía un empleo y comenzó sus ventas entre sus compañeras de trabajo, poco a poco fue incrementando sus clientes y la cantidad de productos que comercializaba, ahora solo se dedica a su negocio y realiza demostraciones en casas de familiares, lo que le han ayudado a crecer rápidamente.

En estos momentos Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú pues ayudar a Maria a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is a 34 year old woman. She is a mother of 2 boys and 1 girl (7, 5 and 1 year and half). Hafiza has more than 10 years of experience in child care services and has owned her own kindergarten in the area of Moussaitbeh, Beirut for the past seven years.

Hafiza has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past six years and has an excellent record of payment on her loans. With the consecutive loans she has received, she enhanced the security features, regularly changed the carpets, wallpaper and furniture in her kindergarten.

She now needs a loan of $1,200 in order to change the wallpaper and to buy new educational toys for the children.

loans.use: Change the wallpaper and buy new toys for her child care center

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Mrs. Chhin H. is 68 years old.  She is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She buys yams from growers and then resells them, earning about $3 profit each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works driving a motor-taxi and makes on average around $3 each day.  One of her children is a broker and the rest are laborers. Mrs. Chin Hok is humbly requesting a loan to purchase more yams in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to improve her business.

loans.name: Komi

texts.en: Komi is a 60-year-old widow with six children, all of whom are married with children of their own.  Although she is a grandmother many times over, Komi is still going strong, running a stand where she sells popcorn and ice cakes (or popsickles in plastic bags). She sell these items to the people of her village, including members of her church. Komi earns the equivalent of $68 every week, and has applied for a new loan which she plans to use for home improvements and to expand her business

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her snack stand and for home improvements

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is a very hardworking woman. She is always looking out for her family's development, needs and foreseeable economical falls. These virtues make her her family's main economical source. Her husband is one of the luckiest people for having her constant support. Year after year and inspite of the difficulties, she has successfully maintained her home thanks to her hard work and achievements.

Elena currently farms potatoes and corn. She also raises pigs to help her during shortage periods. Raising pigs helped her a lot when she lost all the investment she put into the fields two years ago, when the ruthless winter killed her farming fields.

Elena is requesting a loan to acquire fertilizers. Have solidarity with Elena because she is responsible and she will respond and return this credit which she will be able to get thanks to your support.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena, es muy esforzada y siempre está observando el desenvolvimiento de los suyos para conocer sus necesidades y también prevenir posibles caídas económicas, esa virtud la convierte en el principal sostén de su hogar y su esposo es uno de los señores más dichosos por tenerla a ella siempre apoyándolos. Año tras año a pesar de las dificultades a llevado con éxito las riendas de su hogar gracias a su laboriosidad y desempeño.Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de papa y maíz, además para tiempos de escasez cría cerditos, estos le han servido aún más cuando perdió totalmente lo invertido en sus campos de cultivo hace dos años después del inclemente invierno que azotó sus campos de cultivo. Solicita un préstamo para adquirir abono y fertilizante. Solidarízate con Elena porque es responsable y responderá a tiempo con la devolución del crédito al que accederá gracias a tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Kyabagu Central D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nidia N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to expand business. Nidia is 30 years old and is a widow. She has 1 child aged 10 who goes to school. Each week, Nidia makes approximately UGX 18000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business. Nidia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more goods and the loan was paid back on time.

Nidia is joined in her small group by Annet N., Rehema K., Betty W., and Barbara B.. Annet N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase more shop items. Rehema K. is currently operating a business running a retail shop and wants a loan to add to the business. Betty W. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to boost business. Barbara B. is currently in the business of operating a bakery and is requesting a loan to buy more baking mixture.

loans.use: To expand clothes business

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
Ubaldina has been working in agriculture the past eight years after the father of her small girl left. She sows corn and potatoes that she then commercializes at the local market. She is doing really well because of the quality of her products. The desire to increase the quantity of her products in order to cover the school needs that her small girl is starting to demand made her request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Ubaldina, a consecuencia del abandono del padre de su pequeña niña, hace ocho años se dedica a las labores agrícolas en su tierra natal, siembra maíz y papa que luego comercializa en el mercado local obteniendo muy buena acogida por la calidad de sus productos. El deseo de incrementar la cantidad de sus productos para alegría y atención de las necesidades escolares que inicia a demandar su pequeña niña la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: Increase of working capital to increase the quantity of her products.

loans.name: Dženita

texts.en: Dženita is a 26-year-old woman and she is not married. She works and her monthly income is 320 KM (about US$ 250).  This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 975 and Dženita will use it to buy more inventory items for her shop of mixed goods. She wants to improve her available selection of goods in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: For supplies for her shop

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina has an established business selling women’s clothing in the city of Simferopol in southern Ukraine. She currently has five vending locations at a huge outdoor market where hundreds of vendors sell all sorts of items. Irina started her business about 20 years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind, and she has worked hard to develop her business. Buying clothing inventory from Turkey, where she can get better prices, is one way in which she is able to gain a competitive business advantage. Moreover, she is planning on bringing goods in from China. Irina is married, and she has a 20-year-old daughter. One of her goals for the future is to purchase a house for her family.

Irina is requesting a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Griven ($1,050) in order to open yet another sales location. With an additional location in which to sell her goods, she will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: To further expand her business by opening a sixth vending location

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is very popular and well-liked in her city. Ever since she took the responsibility of caring for her two loving children all on her own, she has worked in different activities with the goal of offering them superior schooling so that they have better opportunities for work in the future. Genoveva currently runs a small candy stand in a highly-frequented street in the city of Juliaca. In addition to that job, she buys and sells American stuffed animals on the weekends. Thanks to her efforts, and especially her desire for self-improvement with her two activities, she has managed to obtain great results but she believes that with more investment capital, she could improve her income considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Genoveva, es muy popular y querida en su localidad, desde que se hizo cargo sola de sus dos queridos hijos, trabajó en diferentes actividades con el fin de ofrecerles estudios superiores a fin de que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.Doña Genoveva actualmente tiene un pequeño puestito de golosinas en una concurrida avenida de la ciudad de Juliaca, adicionalmente a esta labor los fines de semana se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de peluches americanos; gracias a su empeño y sobre todo voluntad de superación en las dos actividades a las que se dedica esta logrando obtener buenos resultados pero cree que con mayor presupuesto de inversión podría mejorar considerablemente sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increase capital to increase the variety of her products.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.en:
Oneida M. P. (pictured on the far left) is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two-month-old son in a small community called Los Hatillos in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling bedspreads, sheets, curtains, and towels two years ago and continues to increase her inventory with each loan.  Currently, Oneida travels from town to town selling her products in addition to selling them from her home; however, it is her hope to continue growing her business so that she will be able to establish her own store in town one day.  Above everything, she works to provide for her newborn boy, so that he may have a good education in the future.  In Oneida´s free time, she enjoys going to church, reading the Bible, and spending time with her family.

Oneida is the leader of the 5-person micro-bank group, Mujeres Solidarias.  In English, this means ´women in solidarity`.  Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. 

On behalf of Oneida, the Mujeres Solidarias group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy curtains, sheets, bedspreads, and towels

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en: Marjana is a young  woman from the town of Derventa.  She is not married and works in a shoe factory.  She makes about 450 KM (less than 350 USD) a month through this job.  This is Marjana’s 2nd loan with Žene za Žene, which she is requesting in the amount of 800 KM.  She will use this money to order cosmetics from a wholesale retailer and then resell.  For her 1st loan, she had bought and sold cosmetics too, and is very happy with the result.  She was able to make enough to pay back her loan and  keep some for herself, and she feels confident she can do the same this time.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Тагоева Мастура жительница района Вахш. Возраст 35 лет, замужем , имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Мастура   болле 2 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Она и ее семья сеют пшеницу на своем участке земли. Готовый урожай они  запасают на целый год, а лишнее обменивают на другие продукты питания,такие как масло и крупы. Сейчас Мастура хочет  купить семеня пшеницы для очередного посева.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Mastura T. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 35 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a secondary education. Mastura has been practicing agriculture for more than 2 years. Her family has a plot of land where they grow wheat. They store the harvest to last through the year and barter any excess for food products, such as butter and grains. Currently, Mastura wants to buy wheat seeds for the upcoming sowing season. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Juanita Eva

texts.es:
