Juanita inicio el negocio hace mas de diez años, empezó vendiendo por catalogo, cosméticos y perfumes, pero ella tenia el deseo de superarse por lo que ingreso a una academia a estudiar para ser estilista, y así monto su estética desde hace 8 años, ya que su familia siempre tuvo peluquerías, ya tenia nociones de eso. Gracias a el buen servicio que presta ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necsita un prestamo por US $225 que pagara en 6 meses para para comprar una vitrina, pintar y decorar la estética.Con tu ayuda ella seguira progresando.
texts.en:
Juanita started in business more than 10 years ago. She started selling cosmetics and perfumes by catalog, but she had the desire to improve herself, so she enrolled in a school to study to be a stylist. She started her salon 8 years ago, and since her family has always had salons, she wanted to do this. Thanks to the good service that she offers, she has managed to get ahead.

She needs a loan of $225, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase a display case and to paint and decorate the salon. With your help, she will keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case and to decorate her salon

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi, 35 years old and married with 4 children, has been selling bags of charcoal for the past year, travelling twice a month to Oyo State to buy the charcoal to sell in Lagos State.  She is now requesting a loan to buy additional charcoal to sell.  Omowumi is very happy about the help being rendered to her by Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nau

texts.en: Mrs. Nau C. is 29 years old and has three children, all of whom attend a local school. Her husband, Mr. Yan Pao, works as a motorbike repairer. Mrs. Nau C. lives in the Veild village in Kampong Cham Province, earning a living cultivating rice on a plot of land that she owns. Additionally, she also breeds pigs. At present, Mrs. Nau C. needs a loan to purchase additional pig feed to increase her business revenue.

loans.use: Purchase of pig feed

loans.name: Ngo Thanh

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thanh Tý năm nay 56 tuổi, hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng là cán bộ hưư trí và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2002 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư kinh doanh bia và ga. Ngoài lương  hưu của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của các con đây cũng là một trong những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện any với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng/.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư cho kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thanh T. is 56 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a pensioner, and two grown-up children. In 2002, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in beer and gas distribution.Together with the pension of her husband and financial support of her children, the distribution business brings the main source of income for her family, currently at VND5,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle Mrs. T. would like to borrow VND12,000,000 to expand her business. .

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand beer and gas retail

loans.name: Abike

texts.en: Abike sells prayers items like incense, olive oils, crucifixes etc. She has been in this business for a long time. Abike is 46 years old and married with two children. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more prayer times to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more prayer items to sell

loans.name: Hien

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền năm nay32 tuổi. Chị tham gia quỹ tình thương năm 2006 và vay vốn để đầu tư buôn bán cá. Hàng ngày chị mua cá của ngư dân vùng biển và đem cung cấp cho người tiêu dùng tại thành phố Thanh Hóa . Công việc kinh doanh phát triển thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 100.000đ/ ngày. Bên cạnh đó chồng chị làm bảo vệ nên hàng tháng cũng hỗ trợ thêm cho gia đình khoảng 2.000.000đ vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị khá ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000d để tiếp tục đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán cá .
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Hien is 32 yrs old. She joined TYM fund in 2006 and borrowed money to invest in selling fish. Every day she would buy fish from the fishermen and re-sell them to the locals in the town of Thanh Hoa. Her business is profitable and brings in 6.00 USD per day. In addition, her husband works as a security guard so every month he supplements their income with approximately 117 USD, and thus her family's economic situation is quite stable. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 525 USD to invest in her fish-selling business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Martha M. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de ebanistería el cual aprendió desde muy pequeña y hoy ha adquirido muchas habilidades en este trabajo. 
Antes de dedicarse a este negocio, ella trabajaba ambulantemente pero al ver la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y de sus dos hijos decidió poner su negocio en su propia casa y a pesar de las difíciles circunstancias económicas que ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante. Por esto es que ella espera en que Ceprodel le proporcione un crédito para la compra de la madera para llevar a cabo los trabajos y de esta forma continuar en el mantenimiento de su amado hogar y familia.
texts.en:
In the Somotillo municipality of the city of Chinandega, Martha M. works very hard at her cabinet-making business. She learned the trade as a young girl and has now acquired many skills. She worked as a street vendor before starting this business, but seeing that she needed to improve her living conditions and the quality of life of her two children, she decided to relocate her business to her home. Despite the economic difficulties she has faced, she has come out ahead. For this reason, she hopes that Ceprodel will provide her with a loan in order to purchase the wood she needs to accomplish her work and continue to support her beloved home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Каримова Зарина проживает в городе Яван. имеет одного ребенка.Одна воспитывает сына , так как является вдовой. Приходится много работать. Привозит товар из города Душанбе  и продает на рынке , который работает два раза в неделю. Торгует хозяйственными товарами. Опыт работы три года. Решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zarina K. lives in Yavan. She has one child. Zarina is raising her son on her own, because she is a widow. She needs to work a lot. Zarina brings her products from Dushanbe and sells them at the market which is open two times a week. She sells household products and has three years of experience. Zarina decided to take out a loan in order to increase her turnover. She will be able to pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar Q. is a 46 year old man who sells fruits and vegetables in the center streets of his home village. Eldar runs this business since 1998 and he is very experienced in searching for fresh fruits and vegetables. He wakes up early in the morning and goes to the central bazaar to purchase fresh products. People throughout the village always come to Eldar to buy something because he is very friendly and always has fresh products.

Now Eldar thinks about the future of his three children who are studying at school. Eldar dreams to be able to pay for their education in university in the future. He would like to increase his income and for this purpose he has applied for $USD1200 loan. This loan he will use to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase his income

loans.name: Afolashade

texts.en: Afolashade sells vegetable and palm oil. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more vegetable and palm oil to sell. Afolashade is 36 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina E. is 51 years old  and a mother of 5 children. She lives in Del Carmen Iligan City.
She has a small variety store in their village that she has operated for a long time. This store helps them a lot in paying for their daily needs, and supports her husband financially. She needs to expand her business to cater to the customer's needs and to compete well in the market. Therefore she is requesting her first loan of PHP 5, 000 from the HSPFI - KIVA  field partner.

loans.use: additional stocks for her variety store

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es: Yesenia Esmeralda S. R. de 28 años de edad reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su pequeño hijo de apenas tres años de edad. Ella posee un cafetín en el Centro Médico de Ahuachapán, en el cual los empleados de dicho centro médico le pagan semanal o quincenal los alimentos que ella les provee. Yesenia cuenta con muy buena reputación en el lugar como una persona muy activa y trabajadora, la cual brinda un excelente servicio. Ella solícita un préstamo para poder comprar más suministros para su negocio, ya que como madre soltera necita trabajar arduamente y obtener mayores ganancias para ofrecerle una mejor vida a su hijo, debido a que ella es la única que vela por su hogar, necesita invertir en su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias lo cual puedo lograrlo a través del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Yesinia Esmeralda S. R. is 28 years old. She lives in the Ahuachapán region with her little three-year-old son. She owns a small café in the Ahuachapán Medical Center. The employees of this medical center pay her weekly or every two weeks for the food she supplies them with. Yesenia has a very good reputation there as an active and hard-working person. She provides excellent service. She is applying for a loan to purchase more supplies for her business. As a single mother she needs to work arduously and obtain greater earnings to offer her son a better life. Since she is the only one who watches out for her home, she needs to invest in her business to gain greater profits. She can achieve this with the loan she has applied for.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is happily married with 2 children and she is 34 years old. Grace produces and sell sachet water in retail and wholesale to her customers.

She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more cellophane to produce more sachet water to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cellophane to produce more sachet water to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijas que son menores de edad. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la chatarrería (recolección de chatarra), pero en este negocio no le fue muy bien, por lo que decidió se inclinarse al comercio. Ahora vende combustible y líneas telefónicas, labor que viene ejerciendo desde hace un año y le está yendo bien. Lo que le gusta de estas actividades es que lo mantienen ocupado y no son muy cansadas con lo era la recolección de chatarra. Además le son muy rentables porque el combustible y las líneas telefónicas ya las tiene repartidas y sus ingresos son seguros porque sus clientes son trabajadores con una remuneración regular. Para más adelante, Carlos quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes.  Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son sinceros, responsables y sobre todo, muy unidos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará combustible en un monto de 2000 soles, con lo restante comprara líneas telefónica para seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old , he lives with his wife and mother of his 2 daughters who are minors. From a very early age he devoted himself to the junkyard (collecting scrap metal), but the business did not do well, so he decided to go into the retail business. He now sells fuel and telephone lines, and has been doing it successfully for a year. What he likes about this business is that it keeps him busy and it is not very tiring, compared to his previous business of collecting scrap metal. This business has been very profitable because fuel and telephone lines are now popular retail items, guaranteeing him a steady income. His customers are hard working people who have steady incomes as well. In the future, Carlos wants to have a grocery store. This is his 6th loan with MFP and what he likes about his community bank is that his colleagues are sincere, responsible and above all, very united. With the money he is requesting, he intends to buy fuel in the amount of 2000 soles, with the remainder he plans to purchase telephone lines to continue supplying his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to restock.

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
Ambe S. is a 46 year old mother of four. She lives in Nchuabu, a neighborhood in Bamenda, Cameroon, and makes her living selling produce in the food market. In the past she has sold potatoes and coco yams, using the profit to buy more food, pay school fees and medication for her family.

With this next loan, Ambe will continue in the same vein; selling potatoes and coco yams. She also plans to sell plums. She will make a personal contribution of 50,000 fCFA to make sure that this business succeeds, but she is also looking for a loan to supplement this amount.

Her business plan is to purchase goods in bulk and resell them in the Bamenda market in small quantities at a decent profit. This plan will be coupled with S.’s experience in selling goods in the market. Her children will be there to help her.

S. will sell nutritious food to the people in the market at a lower price, and she will be able to reduce the distance traveled for people to be able to find food of similar qualities. S. came to GHAPE because of the agreeable terms on loans, such as no collateral and low interest rates. She has come to love the organization because of the training and help received to help make her business a success.

--------------------------------- The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, Ibo coco yams and plums.

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora María L. dedica sus esfuerzos para atender su negocio de venta de granos básicos el cual los posee en sacos grandes almacenados en su establecimiento.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos como es el frijol y por esta razón espera ser beneficiada grandemente y así continuar brindando mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María L. lives in the department of León. She operates a business in which she sells basic grains. The grains are stored in large bags in her shop.

Today she came to the office of Kiva partner Ceprodel and applied for a loan to buy basic grains, particularly beans. She expects to benefit greatly from this loan and be able to continue to provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
"Ana I. (0) is a 45 years-year-old woman living in the town of Moataa.  She is married and has 6 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Ana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Ana has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 650 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2005, Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3500 tala WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Ana is now requesting a new loan of 2900 tala WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Ana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Botul

texts.en: Botul A. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at the resturant and is requesting a loan to purchase big suaspanes for cooking.  Botul is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase big suaspanes for cooking

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
. Srun C., age 27 and her husband, Mr. Soben Sum, age 26, live in a small village along National Road Number four about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have 2 children: one son and one daughter. 
 
Mrs. Srun C. used to be a garment factory worker, but she stopped the business because just gave a birth. Her husband has been operating grocery store for one year. He buys grocery items from Chompou Van market approximately 3 kilometers from his house for resale and his home.

Srun is applying for her first loan of $200 in order to help capital her husband for buying additional grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To help capital her husband for purchasing additional grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 25 years old and runs a shop in Nyayo Market in the Ngara area of Nairobi. He sells snacks, soft drinks, foodstuffs, and papers and employs two people. He has run this business for two years and is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to increase his current stock. In the future, he hopes to both expand his business into several shops and also to buy land on which to build houses. He describes himself as a dedicated worker.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 33 years old, married and blessed with four children. One of them is already in high school while three are still at the elementary level.  

Agnes is a retailer of goods in the school canteen in their village.  Aside from this, she is also engaged in the hog raising business.  She would like to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000 that she needs to develop her business.  Her husband's source of income is farming and he also helps her in managing her hog raising business.  

Agnes dreams of developing her business to sustain the immediate needs of their family, especially in sending her children to school.  She believes that with her business, she can fulfill her plans in life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Bibiane

texts.en:
Bibiane is 31 years old, single, and she takes care of one dependent who is 16 years old. Bibiane lives in the Nyarugenge district in Kigali, Rwanda's capital city. Bibiane has been working as wholesaler of charcoal for 2 successful years. She works long hours in her job, from 6 AM to 8 PM six days per week.

This is the first time for Bibiane to request a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. When she is lent this sum, she hopes that it will allow her to buy a greater volume of charcoal at lower prices and give her some extra working capital to operate her business. She also hopes to increase the number of her customers and make more sales and profit. If successful, this will allow her to invest in the education of her dependent and in addition, she will be able to build a more secure future for herself.

loans.use: More charcoal for sale and general working capital

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has a restaurant where she sells drinks and pepper soup. The greatest joy her work gives her is one-on-one contact with customers. Bola is married, has two children and is 44 years old. She is a member of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. She has applied for a loan for 100,000 NGN to buy more drinks to sell and ingredients to make pepper soup. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and ingredients to make pepper soup

loans.name: Henry Gitau

texts.en:
Henry Gitau is 34 years old and married to Salome Waithera. They have a son called Lawrence K.. Henry was introduced to Kadet by a former neighbour who is a Kadet client who had borrowed a loan previously with another microfinance institution.

Henry runs a series of businesses, all located in Kisumu Ndogo-Malindi. They include a barbershop, a tailoring shop, a stall where he has placed a pool table, and a boda boda (bicycle) taxi from which he gets a monthly profit of Kshs 7,000. He has been operating all these for nine years. With this loan, he plans to add a pool table to the one he already has, and add materials for his tailoring business. With the extra earnings/profits, he will build a place where all his businesses can be located.

He desires to be a prominent business entrepreneur in Malindi.

loans.use: To purchase a pool table (Kshs 45000) and tailoring materials (Kshs 15000)

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie F. is from the village of Alitaya, Mangaldan, Pangasinan, Philippines. He is 31 years old, married, and has an infant-aged child. To make a living, Freddie operates a family member's rice processing business. While not the only means of revenue, providing rice-processing services to local community members is the main source of income for the business. Freddie has been engaged in his business for over 10 years, and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Freddie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services that would help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Freddie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in his business's expansion. This loan will be Freddie's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients consist mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expand rice processing business

loans.name: Susana Audelia

texts.es: Susana tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, los dos mas grandes ya trabajan y la ayudan en los gastos del hogar, tiene una tienda y venta de comida, Susana atiende muy amablemente su negocio, es por eso que en tampoco tiempo su negocio ha prosperado esto le anima aún mas a poder salir adelante y solventar las necesidades de su familia, quienes son la razón de su esfuerzo. El sueño a futuro de Susana es tener más clientes y mas ventas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con la fundación FAPE, El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido para comprar productos para hacer la venta de las refacciones y cumplir con las entregas a los establecimientos para los que trabaja.
texts.en:
Susana is 43 and lives with her husband and 3 children. Her two oldest children are already working and help her with their home's expenses. She has a store and sells food. She is very friendly when she attends to her business, and that's why it has prospered. This motivates her even more to get ahead and to solve her family's economic needs. Her family is the reason that she works so hard. Her dream for the future is to have more clients and sales. This is her first loan with FAPE. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies and to fulfill the orders of the establishments for which she works.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her store

loans.name: Modou Dame

texts.fr: Monsieur Modou Dame F. est agent de sécurité âgé de 30 ans. Il pratique également  l’embouche bovine et  le transport de taxi clando pendant ses heures libres. Il est  depuis 2009 membre de U-IMCEC Bambey, une ville située à 120 Kms de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Cependant, Monsieur F., voulant augmenter ses revenus, demande un prêt de 150 000 FCFA  pour completer son capital consacré à acheter un bœuf et un mouton de race pour relancer son embouche.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou Dame F., aged 30, is a security guard. He also fattens cattle and operates an unofficial taxi during his free time. Since 2009, he has been a member of U-IMCEC of Bambey, a city located 120 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Yet wanting to augment his revenues, Mr. F. is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs CFA to round out the capital he has set aside for buying a cow and a type of sheep in order to renew his work in husbandry.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a cow and a sheep

loans.name: Sèmawon

texts.fr: A. Sèmawon est née vers 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a sept ans que Sèmawon s’est installée au quartier Dandji à Cotonou.  Sèmawon est mariée et mère de deux enfants.  Sèmawon n’a jamais fréquenté l’école mais tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Sèmawon vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Sèmawon vend des produits divers (conserves de tomate et de sardine, riz, pâtes alimentaires, œufs).  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Sèmawon s’approvisionne et vend ses produits.  Sèmawon a 15 ans d’expérience de ce domaine et est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé.  Elle a bien remboursé le premier crédit et en sollicite un autre pour renforcer son activité et pour augmenter son profit.
texts.en:
Sèmawon A. was born around 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She settled seven years ago in the Dandji area of Cotonou. Sèmawon is married and mother of two children. She has never attended school herself but all her children have had schooling. Sèmawon lives with her children and her husband, with whom she shares responsibility for family expenses. To meet her needs, Sèmawon sells various food products (canned tomatoes, sardines, rice, pasta, eggs). She gets her supplies and sells her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Sèmawon has 15 years’ experience with this activity and has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which she duly reimbursed. She is now requesting a second loan to strengthen her business and generate more profit.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, eggs

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 32 year old gentleman.  He sells paints in retail from his shop and he has done this in Naivasha town for the last 3 years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid well his first loan of Kshs 50,000 which he used to buy more paints for selling in bulk.  He plans to use these funds to diversify his paint products and add a range of oil based paints since the paints he has now are water based.

He plans to start manufacturing paints in future, set up his own company, buy the necessary machines and start manufacturing paint for sell in Naivasha and surrounding towns.

loans.use: To buy more oil based paints for sale

loans.name: Gulmaira

texts.en:
Gulmaira is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Olgii province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian tent. Her oldest son, Nurbol, is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and one of her children attends a local secondary school.

During the day, she operates a meat trading business at a local market. She has been operating this business since 2002 and has expanded it. Previously, Gulmaira operated a food retailing business between 1998-2002. Furthermore, she has received nine loans from XacBank, and has been successfully operating her business. The most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. Gulmaira says, “I would like to be financially able to afford my son's university fees until he graduates.” She is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~ 635 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat at wholesales price to resell it for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase meat at wholesale prices for resale

loans.name: Bolivia

texts.es: La Señora Bolivia esta casada y tiene dos hijitos pequeños se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, vende hamburguesas, pollo frito y salchipapas fuera de su casa, en esta ocasión ella necesita el credito para comprar sillas y mesas para la venta de su comida, el  esposo de la Sra Bolivia es chofer de transporte Urbano, entre los dos trabajan muy duro para poder comprar su lote y poder construir su casa, por el momento ellos estan viviendo en anticretico. Son buenos clientes en la institucion además de que no es la primera vez que acceden a un crédito con Emprender y no tubieron problemas con el pago de sus cuotas. La Sra. Bolivia esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ms. Bolivia is married with two small children. She sells fast food, such as hamburgers, fried chicken, and hot potatoes outside of her house. She needs a loan to purchase chairs and tables for the sale of her food. Her husband works as a chauffeur for Urbano Transports. The two of them work very hard in order to be able to buy their plot of land and be able to construct their house on it. Currently, they are living without credit. They are very good members of the institution and this is not the first time that they have had a loan with Emprender. They have never had problems with paying their quotas. Ms. Bolivia is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their faith in her by giving her credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chairs and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more yams, potatoes, beans and frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Méry

texts.fr: Méry W. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 28 mars 2008 et a eu 3 expériences avec le crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son petit commerce en approvisionnant en bonne quantité en marchandises telles des chaussures, des bijoux, et des tissus teintés. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et à satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Méry W. is a 48-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois since March 28, 2008 and has had three experiences with loans.  Her new loan will enable her to bolster her small business by stocking up on a good quantity of merchandise, such as shoes, jewelry, and dyed fabrics.  Her revenues allow her to help pay for her children's schooling and to meet her personal needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her level of self-financing, bolstering her small-scale commerce

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 24 years old and married, and she has two children. She completed primary school. 

She is a tailor. She will use this loan to purchase a big sewing machine, cloth, and other sewing supplies. 

Because she is an experienced and skilled woman, many clients visit her and have her sew their garments. She has a good reputation in the market and that has earned her more clients who bring their sewing to her. She has an ambitious plan to develop her business and to get more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana lives in a mid-sized city called Vehari, Pakistan with her husband and a son. Her son, 22, had to terminate his education when he was in 8th standard to support his family. He now works in a factory for a meager income.

Ramzana has applied for a loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan) for the repair of her husband’s rickshaw which he bought few years ago. A fully repaired rickshaw will help her husband do his job more comfortably and efficiently, allowing him to drive it more smoothly and for a longer duration to make more income. Ramzana hopes that she will be able to save money from the profit of her husbands’ business for her son’s marriage.

Note: Ramzana also supports her husband by operating a domestic sewing business, and she is showing her work in this photo.

loans.use: Repair a rickshaw

loans.name: María Ignacia

texts.es: María Ignacia H. F. de 50 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio en el cual comercializa ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, así mismo posee una papelería y una tienda en la cual comercializa productos los cuales son los más esenciales en el hogar. Ella vive junto a su esposo el cual es empleado de una empresa privada y junto a un pequeño nieto de 3 años de vida, quien se encuentra al cuidado completo de ella, junto a ellos reside en San Pedro Masahuat, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Para María sus negocios son muy fundamentales para el sostenimiento de su hogar, ya que de ellos es de donde obtienen gran parte del capital necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar y para el sostenimiento de su pequeño nieto. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en sus tres negocios y de esta forma hacerlos crecer, comprando todo lo esencial como: páginas de papel bond, lapiceros, juegos de geometría, productos alimenticios para la tienda y así mismo poder comprar mayor variedad de ropa.
texts.en:
María Ignacia H. F. is 50 years old and runs her own business selling children’s, women’s, and men’s clothing. She also has a paper goods shop and a store where she sells other, more necessary, products for the home. She lives with her husband, who is employed by a private company, and her three year old grandson, who is completely dependent on her for care and support. She lives in San Pedro Masahuat, located in the department of La Paz. María’s businesses are fundamental for maintaining her household and it is through them that they obtain a great portion of the money they need to pay the household expenses and support their young grandson. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest into her three businesses and be able to grow them by buying sheets of bond paper, mechanical pencils, geometry kits, foodstuffs for the store, and a greater variety of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

location.town: San Pedro Masahuat, Departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Marleny Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marleny de 39 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), ella tiene una papelería.  

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares de su esposo y poder pasar tiempo con sus dos hijos comenzó a vender cuadernos, plumas y papeleria en su casa a sus vecinos, construyo la parte delantera de su casa en un local. Con la ayuda de su esposo ahora ella tiene una tienda y están mejor económicamente. 

Pero para continuar trabajando en su negocio ella necesita comprar con el préstamo una vitrina y papelería. En el futuro quiere readecuar mejor su casa y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
39-year-old Marleny lives in the urban zone Orquídeas de Guayaquil, named "the orchids" due to the discovery of many orchid flowers in that locale. She owns a stationery store. To help with her spouse's daily expenses and to be able to spend time with her two children, she began to sell notebooks, pens and stationery from her home to her neighbors. The front part of the house was built in a storefront. With her husband's help, she now has a shop and they are better off financially. To continue working in this business, Marleny needs to buy a cabinet and stationery with this loan. In the future she would like to renovate their house and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cabinets and stationery.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en: Segundina E. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 60 years old and is married with five adult children. Segundina owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Segundina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Segundina is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her eleventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria T. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (PULPERIA) negocio en el cual cuenta con varios años de experiencia.
El negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico en la calle principal de Villa Santa y el local es de un ambiente agradable, en su negocio se encuentra lo mas básico para el consumo diario como ser: Azúcar, Arroz, Manteca, Jabón, espaguetis, salsa, huevos, harina, pollo, etc.
Doña Maria es viuda quedando ella como madre y padre para sus hijos de los cuales ya solo uno depende a un 100% de ella.
La Sra. Maria es una persona con mucho espíritu de trabajo y lo a demostrado ya que al quedar sin su compañero de hogar ella sigue luchando.
En la actualidad la Sra. Torres, no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir más su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María T. is a grocer; she’s been in this line of work for several years. Her store is located in a very strategic spot on Villa Santa’s main street; it is a pleasant space. One can find the most basic daily use items there such as: sugar, rice, lard, soap, pasta, sauces, eggs, flour, chicken, etc. María is a widow who was left being both mother and father to her children only one of whom still depends 100% on her. María has a lot of spirit for work and has shown that having been left without her life partner she continues fighting to survive. She currently lacks sufficient capital to stock her store. She will use the loan to buy stock items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beans, rice, sugar, lard, cooking oil, tortillas, corn flour, wheat flour, margarine, bread, cookies, juices, churros (dough shaped into sticks or rings, deep fried and sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon), soups, pasta, sauces, cereal, toilet paper.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Margaret has had a restaurant business for over ten years and she works six days every week. Margaret works from home and sells to all categories of people on retail basis.    

Margaret has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bananas, rice, charcoal, crates of soda and beer, beef and chicken. Margaret's main business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel and build her own business premises. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bananas, rice, beef, crates of beer, soda and chicken

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El Señor Felix Ruben M. O., tiene la edad de 35 años habitante del Barrio San Antonio Sur, casado y su esposa labora como conserje, ayudando al gasto mensual en el que se incurre, ellos tienen un hijo de 5 años, que estudia la escuela primaria, él labora como docente, desde hace mas de 16 años, ellos  habitan en una humilde casita puesto que los salarios de los maestros en el país son valorados muy bajos, por tanto no cuentan con los recursos económicos para lograr repara algunas imperfecciones en su hogar, es por esta razón que solicitan un nuevo  préstamo, para edificar un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda con el propósito de separar el terreno de su vecino con el de él, y en segunda proteger a su familia de la delincuencia que amenaza a la población que habita en el lugar, siendo esta la razón principal de su petición, favoreciendo a futuro el bienestar socioeconómico de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Felix Ruben M. O. is 35 years old and lives in the San Antonio South neighborhood. He is married, and his wife works as a maintenance employee, helping with the family's monthly expenses. They have a 5-year-old child who goes to primary school. Felix Ruben has worked as a teacher for more than 16 years. They live in a humble house, since teacher salaries in the country are very low. Thus, they do not have the economic resources to repair some imperfections in their home. For this reason, they are requesting a new loan to build a wall behind their home, with the aim of separating their yard from that of their neighbor, and also to protect the family from the crime that is threatening the population of the area. This is the main reason for their request, which will favor the socioeconomic well-being of all members of the family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a wall behind his house

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie Q. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 27 years old. Marjorie is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Marjorie provides motorcycle (or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver for local community members. Marjorie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Marjorie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for maintenance to provide service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marjorie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for maintenance to provide service

loans.name: Santos Marta

texts.es:
la señora Santos Marta E. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en la aldea Agua Caliente de la ciudad de Choluteca, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio se
encuentra en un lugar donde la fluides de personas es bastante, esto hace que sus ventas sean buenas y que sus ingresos sean muy favorables, ademas lucha junto a su esposo para sacar adelante su hogar.
Esta aldea es muy productiva ya que se cultiva bastante granos basicos como ser maiz y frijol. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Marta E. is 59 years old and lives in the Agua Caliente area of Choluteca.  She sells popular consumable items and has a general store located within her home.  Her business is in a location where many people pass and her sales and income are good.  She and her husband work together to move ahead.

This area is very productive and large amounts of basic grains (corn and beans) are grown there.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Cacilda N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique divorciada e mãe de 1 filho de 22 anos de idade e já se encontra a trabalhar. Fez 6ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com o seu filho e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal sempre viveu com a sua família em Maputo. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade no quintal da sua casa e faz esta atividade ha muitos anos. Não tem empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.600.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produto (arroz, farinha, óleo, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

O seu maior sonho é construir uma mercearia ainda melhor na sua própria casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro crédito para poder realizar seu sonho.
texts.en:
Cacilda N. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She is divorced and has a 22-year-old son who is now working.  Cacilda finished sixth grade but did not continue school because of financial difficulties.  She lives in her own house with her son and does not support anyone else.

She never left her hometown, but always lived with her family in Maputo. For many years Cacilda has had her own business selling staple goods in the yard of her house.  She has no employees and earns around 5,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some money in her bank account.

Cacilda never had loans from other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution.  This is her second loan, and she is asking for 12,600 meticais to buy products (rice, flour, oil, broth and other items) to increase her inventory.

Her greatest dream is to build a better grocery store in her house.  She is confident that she will pay ahead of time and ask for another loan to make her dream come true.

loans.use: Buy products (rice, flour, oil, broth, etc.)

loans.name: Karkay Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Karkay” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Marie B.. Marie is age 46. She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman and three of her children are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. For seven years now, Marie has been selling slippers, lace cloths, ready-to-wear-clothes, etc. With this loan, she will buy slippers, lace cloths, ready-to-wear-clothes, at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy slippers, lace cloths, ready-to-wear-clothes, at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre muy trabajador, casado, con un hijo menor a quien da los estudios. Su trabajo que realiza es como cadete de taxi, siendo el vehículo propio, el cual adquirió con ahorros y lo compro accesible por medio de su hermano.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa ya que trabaja como supervisora. Y que ambos a futuro desean lograr tener su propia casa.
Con este nuevo financiamiento será para dar mantenimiento a su taxi en la mejora de sistema de dirección, comprar vidrio delantero, sensor de oxigeno. Logrando ofrecer un mejor servicio de unidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge is a hardworking man. He is married and has a young son who is a student. He is a taxi driver and has his own vehicle which he bought with his savings and with help from his brother.

Jorge’s wife also contributes to the household through her work as a supervisor. In the future they would like to have a home of their own.

This new loan will be used to do work on the taxi such as improve the steering, buy a rear window and spark plugs. In this way he will be able to provide his customers with a better quality vehicle.

loans.use: taxi maintenance (steering, rear window etc)

loans.name: Anteñita Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ANTEÑITA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Iscuchaka, provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Timotea; La socia tiene 61 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene  3 hijos ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia tiene su negocio de chicharronería y venta de chicha, la socia compra chanchos y algunos también cría para su negocio, la socia también alterna su chicharronería con la venta de chicha de maíz amarillo, la socia prepara ella misma la chicha a base de maíz amarillo fermentado, la socia sigue apoyando con los estudios superiores y a cada uno de sus hijos en sus vidas particulares, ella actualmente trabaja con dos de sus hijos lo que hace del negocio que inicialmente ella lo formó ahora un negocio familiar, la socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir exclusivamente en su negocio, la socia comprar chanchos tiernos para criarlo, también comprara papa al por mayor y aceite al por mayor, la socia también invertirá en parte en la compra de maíz para la elaboración de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al comercio minorista y venden frutas, comidas, tiene su tienda de abarrotes y todos ellos crían animales menores para la venta.
La socia que está separada del grupo con chompa roja y su pequeño en brazos es la socia Yovana que no pudo asistir  ala reunión de grupo y fué al día siguiente a firmar el requerimiento de solicitud de créditos.

La socia valora el préstamo ya que dicho préstamo le da la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Timotea  belongs to the Anteñita Communal Bank.  It is located in the Iscuchaka district, Anta province, Cusco department.

Timotea is 61 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a small businesswoman.  She has a business selling fried pork rinds and “chicha” (common sweet drink made from corn).  She buys pigs and raises some of them for her business.  She alternates her business activities at her pork rind stand with selling chicha made from yellow corn.  She makes the chicha herself by using a base of fermented yellow corn.

Timotea continues to help with higher education, and she helps each one of her children in their personal lives.  She currently works with two of her children.  The business that she stared is now a family business.

She wants the loan to be able to use exclusively in her business.  She will buy young pigs to raise.  She will also buy potatoes and oil wholesale.  Additionally, she will use part of the loan to buy corn to make chicha.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her business.

The other members have small businesses.  They sell fruit, food, and have a grocery store.  All of them raise small animals to sell.

She values the loan because it gives her the opportunity to improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Mrs. Bin Sokunthear Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people in Ta Phem village in Takeo province are making up this village bank loan.  They have selected Mrs. Bin S. to be the village bank president. The members will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living.  

Mrs. Bin S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Ven Sin, is a community clerk and construction worker who gets a low salary to support his family.  Mrs Bin S. wants to breed a cow, but her savings is not enough. To achieve this purpose, she needs a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. 

Mrs. Bin S. is a mother of two children,  who are all students in the local public school. Mrs. Phy Phun is a guarantor, so she is present in this picture. All the members are shown in the picture, although one member is blocked from view.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Amira  Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Amira Saturnina; ella tiene 34 años de edad, separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de ropa americana, la socia tiene su puesto en la feria de los sábados que lleva el nombre de “baratillo”, la socia también vende a sus amistades que le hacen pedido, la socia a la vez trabaja para una fábrica de lácteos ella trabaja de  lunes a viernes por las mañanas y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante que es lo mas quiere.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería de ropa y así poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta forma ganar más dinero.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MUJERES UNIDAS" (United Women) communal bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Ammira Saturnina is 34 years old and separated with two children.  She sells American clothing at a stand at the Saturday "bargain" market and also takes orders from friends.  And she works mornings, Monday through Friday, in a dairy products plant in order to bring in more income for her family.

She plans to use the loan to buy a wider range of clothing so she can offer more variety to customers and earn more income.

She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy a broader variety of clothing for retail sale to increase earnings

loans.name: Antonieta Yanet

texts.es:
Antonieta, tiene 42 años y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Cusco, provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Antonieta vive en el distrito de Wanchaq junto con su esposo Sixto y sus hijos. 

Antonieta se dedica a la venta de golosinas, caramelos, galletas y también tiene brinda servicios de llamdas, ella y su Sixto tienen un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en tapizar muebles de sala y otros. Ellos tiene un su domicilio un pequeño taller donde confecciona muebles de sala. 
 
Antonieta espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales como por ejemplo tela, esponja, clavos, cola de carpintero, madera y otras cosas más.  
Antonieta pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (Cada ciclo son 4 meses) y el banco comunal está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 42, has two children.  She was born in Cusco district, Cusco province of Cusco department.  She currently lives in Wanchaq district with her husband, Sixto, and their children.

Antonieta sells snacks, candy and cookies and also provides telephone calling services.  She and Sixto have a small family business upholstering living room furniture and others.  They have a small workshop at home where they make living room furniture.

Antonieta is hoping to receive a 500 new sol loan that she’ll use to buy supplies like: fabric, foam, nails, carpenter’s glue, lumber and others.

Antonieta belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Kukuli” communal bank which has been in operation for 13 cycles.  (Every cycle is four months long) and the communal bank is run by a governing board.

loans.use: To buy such materials like: fabric, foam, nails, carpenter's glue, lumber and others.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is married to M. A. who has a business of selling vegetables. He puts vegetables on his four-wheeled cart in the morning and visits different streets of the city to sell them. He is very good person and treats his clients respectfully. Shazia is a housewife and prefers to stay at home and do her household tasks. She is a very supportive lady, always ready to help her family at difficult times. She has given birth to 2 daughters and 3 sons. All of them are studying by attending the local school. 

Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s vegetable selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Shazia is hopeful that an investment will help him increase his sales and profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In her previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. She is a resident of Mian channu, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan,  known for its agriculture industry.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina V. lives in the Alvank community in the Meghri region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and daughter. Her son is currently serving in the Army. She works as an operator in the local post office. 

To bring additional income to her household, Angelina has been running a small farm for eight years. Her husband is unemployed and helps Angelina in their farming business. They sell the milk and meat products to the nearby markets. 

Taking into consideration the rising demand for cattle, Angelina is planning buy cattle. Having insufficient funds to invest in their business, Angelina has applied to SEF for a loan to expand their business and increase the household’s income.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Changement De Meyak 1 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Poligene habite dans la ville –Me yak  d’Haïti où de l’électricité n’existe pas et l’eau est très limitée.

Poligène a dirigé son commerce  du Charbon  pendant les dernières 10 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Poli gène  était un professeur

Poli gène  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir au commerce du charbon et de bois.

Poli gène peut utilise ses emprunt a l’aidera a réalisé un plus  gros bisness

Des autres membres de Changement de Meyak ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tells  commerces comme boisson, vêtements et produits alimentaire.

Celons Poli gène   ses défis  principal c’est manquement d’argent pour être un grand commerçant.

Poli gène dit que son but principal  est possédé un gros biseness il veut considérer comme un leader  de la communauté.
texts.en: Poligène lives in the city –Meyak d’Haïti, where there is no electricity, and water is very limited. He has been running his charcoal business for the last ten years. Before starting in this commerce, he was a teacher. Poligène would like to use this loan for investing in the commerce of charcoal and wood. He can use these loans to help him create a larger business. Some of the other members of Changement de Meyak need a loan for commerce, such as in beverages, clothing, and food. According to Poligène, his principal challenge is the lack of money for becoming a major merchant. Poligène says that his main goal is to own a large business. He wants to be regarded as a community leader.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 50 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció, pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos todos mayores de edad, solo su hija que es soltera vive con ella. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque en las reuniones comparte con sus amigas.

Tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, en el cual prepara para la venta deliciosos platos, trabaja tres días a la semana desde las 16h00 hasta las 21h00 ya que solo prepara meriendas, su hija le ayuda en su negocio. Nos cuenta que tiene su restaurante por dos años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Sus metas son tener fuerzas y recursos para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Dios con Nosotros" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Florón neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, which is known as the Ciudad del Valle (valley city) because it is surrounded by mountains.

Here we meet Mrs. Rosa who is 50 years old.  Several years ago her husband passed away, but from that relationship she has three children who are all adults.  Only one daughter is single and lives with her.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and enjoys the meetings there because she is able to converse with her friends.

She runs a small restaurant out of her house and serves delicious dishes that she prepares.  She works three days a week from 4:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m., because she only serves dinner.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  She says the restaurant has been operating for two years and business is going well.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare meals.

Her goal is to have the strength and resources to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 30, is a charcoal vendor. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan in order to stock more charcoal to offer for sale. In the future, she hopes to build up her business with her extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Andrea M., que tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio solo hasta tercero de primaria porque sus padres no tenian dinero para darle mas estudios, esta casada con el señor guillermo que se dedica a trabajar de jornalero, ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela en su comunidad.

Doña Andrea nos platica que hace mas de diez años inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio de vanta de mojarra ya que queria ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus pequeños hijos, ella nos dice que vende los fines de semana y se levanta desde muy temprano para ir a comprar su pescado a la orrila de la presa, vuelve a su casa a limpiarlo y posterior mente sale a las comunidades cercanas como Tierra Blanca, pescadito y la granja  a venderlo con sus clientes. Doña Andrea es una persona muy  alegre y trabajadora que siempre le ha gusta trabajar para salir adelente.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de pescado para posteriormente venderlo.

ella espera que con este credito pueda hacer mas clientes para poder aumentar sus ganancias ya que le gustaria terminar de construir su casa y darle un mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec, which has a large lake which provides abundant fishing and work each year.  It’s also known for the presence of the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam.

Andrea M. lives here.  She is 45 years old and only has a third grade education because her parents didn’t have the money to provide more.  She’s married to Guillermo who works as a field hand.  They have two children who attend the local school.

Andrea says that she’s been working in her own business, selling fish, for more than ten years, because she wants to help her husband provide for the family and the children’s education.  She tells us that she sells on the weekends and rises early in the morning to buy the fish at the edge of the dam.   She takes it home to clean and then goes out to the local communities, like Tierra Blanca, Pescadito, and La Granja to sell to her customers.  Andrea is a happy, hard working person who likes to work to get ahead.

She needs this loan to invest in fish to resell.  She expects that this loan will allow her to have more customers and that she will be able to increase her earnings.  She would like to finish building her house and give a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio tiene 57 años, es viudo vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

José se dedica a la agricultura siembra trigo y maíz en terrenos propios y arrendados, ganadería 5 cabezas de vacas lecheras. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar insumos para trabajar en la agricultura y para alimentación para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que el negocio siga creciendo y que los hijos sigan con el negocio. 

Le gusta visitar a la familia
texts.en:
José Antonio, 57, is a widower living with his children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has 5 children.

The “NUCANCHI KAWSAY” communal bank is located in the community of El Rayo, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton 25 minutes from the Cooperativa’s office.  The members are involved in a variety of occupations like: farming, cattle raising, commerce, small farm animal raising, bricklaying and sawmill.

José farms wheat and corn on his own lands and on leased land.  He has five head of dairy cows.  Purchases are done at Guaranda’s market and sales take place in the wholesale market in that same city.

He is asking for the loan to buy farming supplies and animal feed.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and variations in weather.  His dream is that his business will continue growing and that his children will carry on with the business.

He likes visiting his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Mery Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mery  Elizabeth  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Ella estudió la secundaria.
La señora hace tres años que trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de granos de la región (papa, chuño, quinua).
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles comprará 50 arrobas de quinua.  La señora nos cuenta que sus productos los compra de Desaguadero y lo vende en la ciudad de Puno y Juliaca, su esposo trabaja en la chacra y con los ganados. 
Su sueño es tener una casa en Puno y un carro grande donde trasladar su mercadería.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la  facilidad del préstamo con meses de gracia y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mery Elizabeth is a member of the “3 de Mayo” (May 3) communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province and Puno Department.  She’s 29 years old, married and has two children.  She finished secondary school.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last three years.   Her initial loan was for 300 new soles and she invested it in her grocery sales business.  She currently sells grains from the region [potatoes, chuño (dehydrated, freeze dried potato), quinoa].  She will use this new, 2500 new sol, loan to buy 50 arrobas (1 arroba=11.5 kg. approx.) of quinoa.

She tells us that she buys her products in Desaguadero and sells them in the cities of Puno and Juliaca.  Her husband is a farmer and raises livestock.

Her dream is owning a house in Puno and a large car to transport her merchandise.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loans with month’s grace period and the savings.

loans.use: to buy 50 arrobas of quinoa.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and one child. She has owned a gifts and accessories shop since 2009. She sells an extensive range of original products. She decided to start her own business to better support her family. This will be her second loan; she said that the previous loan was sufficient to fulfill her business objectives. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products for her shop. She has high hopes for the future of her business and looks forward to continued expansion of her business in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 37-year-old borrower.  He is married and has 3 children aged 3, 6 and 9. In 2000, he established a business selling metal frame windows, doors, and gates. He began his business because it was the only means of employment for him to make his living.  

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy raw materials (assorted metals). He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, he plans to open another workshop to train youths, help educate his children, and buy land.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy raw materials (iron rods)

loans.name: Lucrecia Isolda

texts.es: Lucrecia de 50 años de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos mayores, trabaja como tecnica de planta desde hace 24 años. Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y no quiere que su familia se enferme por la humedad. Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar poco a poco su vivienda para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia que es su razon de ser.
texts.en: Lucrecia is 50 years old, single, and has three grown-up children.  She has been working as a plant technician for 24 years.  She is requesting her eighth loan to replace the roof of her house as it is in a bad state of repair and she doesn't want her family to become sick as a result of the damp.  Her biggest dream is to be able to gradually improve her home so that she can provide her family with more comfort as they mean everything to her.

loans.use: to replace her roof

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling her wares at the market to her neighbors. In addition, she also sells coconuts, which serves as a secondary source of income. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

Mwanahawa and her husband have one child who attends school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 80,000 loan she has requested, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to start up a transport business. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start up a transport business

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene una conasupo rural en la comunidad de Barrio las peñas, este lugar es muy bonito porque la mayoria de los arboles son muy grandes y el lugar es en un cerro, tambien es muy poblado, don Juan nos comenta las dificultades que ha pasado en su tienda y la primera es que nos dice que la gente que le manda el producto para vender manda un producto varias veces ya caducado y en ocasiones producto que no se vende y eso le afecta mucho y se reflejan en ventas bajas, por esa razón prefiere mejor invertir el en cosas que se vende mucho, por ejemplo el huevo, frijol, sopas y arroz, tambien leche y refrescos o agua, el credito le va ayudar para que la gente vuelva a comprar y conseguir en su tienda lo que busca y con esto mejorar en algo sus ventas, tambien busca comprar una vitrina ya que su meta es conseguir y vender carnes frias, con esto el siente que le iria muy bien en su negocio porque no hay tiendas que vendan carnes frias en su comunidad, toda la gente que busca estos productos tienen que ir hasta el municpio y es una perdidade tiempo y de dinero, el señor Juan es casado y tiene 4 hijos pero solo dos son dependientes, tiene 25 años de casado y 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia y su mujer es ama de casa.
texts.en:
Juan has a rural Conasupo (state subsidized foodstuffs stores) in the community of Barrio Las Peñas.  This is a very pretty place because most of the trees are very large and the place is on a hilltop.  It’s also quite heavily populated.  

Juan tells us about the difficulties he’s had with his store.  The first, he says, is that the suppliers that send him food to sell often send him items that are already passed their sell by dates and sometimes items that don’t sell at all.  This affects him quite a bit and reflects in his low sales.  Because of this, he prefers to invest in items that do sell well, like eggs, beans, soup and rice, milk, soft-drinks and water.  

The loan is going to help him so that people will return to buy and find in his store what they are looking for; this will lead to better sales for him.  He also aims to buy a display case because he’s hoping to start to sell cold cuts because he thinks that he’ll do very well with this because there are no stores in his community selling cold cuts.  Everyone wants these products and they have to go all the way to the main town to get them and that’s a waste of time and money.

Juan is married and has four children but only two are still dependent.  He’s been married for 25 years and is 52 years old.  He lives in his own house and his wife’s a housewife.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock his Conasupo (National Company of Popular Susbsitence items)

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
